Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O sons, if I have fulfilled this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, through its completion in me, and through its expositions and declarations by me, it seems to me that you will complete it with this treatise, which is part of the operation with the hand, and that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation with the hand is deprived in our time and age of all its strength, while the science of it is lost and its traces are left behind; and there remain of it only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which they have changed and directed to error and confusion, so that their understandings of it are closed off and its art is prolonged and stretched out.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that you will enliven this through the ordering of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that you may come to the forms of the tools of cautery and of the other instruments of the work as is fitting, through addition of declaration and through preparation for it, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why there is no good artificer with his hand in our time is that the art of medicine is long, and that one has to be exercised before it in the science of anatomy, which was known to the Gauls as they knew the parts of the members and their forms; and the connection and separation of them; and had knowledge of the bones, the nerves, and the tendons, and the number of these, and their outgoing.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this Hypocras says that with a name is much, but in the work little, and most especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not learned in what we have said of anatomy is evacuated and will fall into error by which men will die, as I have seen many of those, for some are formed in this science and throw themselves from it without experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and inexperienced physician make an ulcer of scrofula in the neck of a woman, and incise some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed and the woman died under his hand.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician who had to swallow a stone of a man who had a process in his state; and the stone was large, and he came to him and pulled out that stone with a piece of the bladder, and the man on the third day died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called to draw out that one, and saw that by the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient, who lay over him, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician who took stipends from a duke of our land for surgery, and treated a broken bone of a black person; and through his ignorance he drew out the fracture on the wound with poultices and bandages with strong tightness, and did not leave the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he drew it out according to his desires, and bound it up, and left it for several days, and commanded that we loosen the bandage; and he did this so that the leg and thigh became ulcerated, and came to harm.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to loosen the bandage, and peace came to him, and he grew calm of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But indeed the corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it, and the corruption did not cease to wander in the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who made an ulcer of a malignant cancer, and it was ulcerated for several days, until the wickedness of it grew great with its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this is that the malignant humour is pure in its nature; but it does not come to it through iron, unless there is a member which suffers from it altogether.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation with the hand be considered in two ways; one is an operation associated with health, and the other an act with which are associated the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already exhorted this in every place of this book in which occurs an operation in which there is error and fear; so that it is necessary for you to guard against this and leave that, so that the foolish do not obstruct your way and dissuade you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your weapons with solicitude and with protection of God, and your patients with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way through the grace of God, to lead to health and praiseworthy success; and lay aside the terrible illnesses of difficult cure, and take up your arms against what causes you fear, so that solicitude in your faith and in your name does not fail: for it will remain for your glory, and more in the world and beyond to your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gaulish already said in some of his own words:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“Do not treat illnesses with evil, so that bad physicians are not named.”
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have composed this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered from the head into the feet, in the forms of the instruments and in the tools of cautery, and of what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of bleeding and piercing, and of cupping, and of bandages, and of extraction of thorns and their like, all chaptered and ordered according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and dislocation, and of cure for twisting and their like; a chapter ordered from the head into the feet, and of the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and with sharp medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	May I declare the quality of the parts of that cautery and the pains of it, and in what disposition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the word of the quality of the part of cautery and of the pain of it is long and prolix, and subtle through science, and secret hidden; and many wise men have spoken much of it, and they disagree on it, and for me a little of their words suffices, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery brings forth universally in all complections, except two complecions, which are complictions of cold without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the compliction cold and dry with matter they disagree; for some say that cautery is beneficial to it, and others say the contrary of that, that cautery is not convenient in illness which is by quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and inconvenient that illness cold and dry is cauted and dry be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he says the contrary of that, that by cautery is made benefit in all illness cold and dry which one sees in the bodies of men; for when you compare the body of man and his humours to the compliction of fire, one feels the body of man hot.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say through the word of that, that I have discovered this experiment many times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, one should not come to this topic unless he is experienced and practiced in the chapter of cauteries through his knowledge of the diversity of human complexions and the dispositions of illnesses in their bodies, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in the other complexions, there is no fear of harm, especially with cold and damp illnesses; all doctors have agreed on this, and they are not disagreed upon when cauterization is done on them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing through cautery with fire and its goodness is that it is a simple action that only affects the part that is cauterized and does not affect any other part except with little harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of a burning medicine spreads to the other parts of the body and makes it difficult to heal them and causes great harm.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, through its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, only affects the part that is cauterized and not any other parts except with little harm. And we know this from experience and from a long time serving as a student in the study of the true causes; and so I am excused from speaking at length about it. And if it were not for the fact that I was not reading from a book, but rather a secret hidden in my mind, that the heat of fire and the quality of its action in the body and how one expels illnesses through it, demonstrated through philosophical reasoning, would be sharper in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when it is convenient to do cauterization and stop, choosing the best time in springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is convenient at all times because the harm caused by the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of it that is drawn from cauterization, especially if the cauterization is for pains or necessary wounds, strong and festering, which do not endure delay due to the fear of their coming, which is greater than the little harm caused by the timing.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And so do not fear in your hearts, o children, that this is not believed except by the common people and foolish doctors; it is that to that illness that is healed through cauterization, there is no reduction of time, and they pause the consequence of that.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think because cauterization is only in place of medicine that alters the complexion and dries the humidity which causes pain to come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But cauterization surpasses medicine through the will of its strength and power of its action, and the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness returns at some time of the year, depending on the complexion of the patient and the location of their illness, and the strength of it, and what has been prepared in the body from the accumulation of excesses in it, and what has come to them through food intake and similar causes; but if the illness in which cauterization is administered is a subtle illness in a part with few excesses and humidity, just like tooth pain and its likes, then it is possible that the pain does not return, but this happens in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	But the common speech is that cauterization is the last resort of medicine; and this speech is true, not to say that they understand it, because they believe that it is not healing that benefits from medicine or any other cause except cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is in contrast to that; and the intention that cauterization is the last resort of medicine is only when we administer methods of healing on certain illnesses, and those medicines do not confer it, and especially at the end of the cause, they administer cauterization, and it benefits from that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And so from here we see that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention that the commoners and foolish doctors understand it.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron; and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of cauterization does not make a difference except when it is absolutely true; for we have already proven that it only makes a difference in some bodies without the others, and cauterization with gold is good and better than with iron just as they said; but when you do cauterization with fire with gold, it is not clear to you because it is heated according to the quantity that you want due to the thickness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive friction; and if you place it over the fire, some thin layers are formed so that the artisan can see through that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason, cauterization with gold must be done more gently and closer to the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And we have already ordered this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head between the feet, so that I may ask you what you want from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization for pain in the head due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers with humidity and coldness the servant accident of which there are two causes; it is a cause of soda and multitude of fluxes, called rhinitis, from the head to the parts of the ears and from the eyes flowing, and multitude of sleeping, and of tooth pain and of the gullet, and generally of all illnesses that come through coldness, just as paralysis, stroke, and their likes in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first of all, command the patient to be evacuated with laxative medicine for three or four days, according to the strength of the patient and their age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command that they shave their head with a razor; and then let him lie between your legs on a low bed and let them place their hands on their feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the edge of your palm, then let it rest on the edge of the nose between your eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But when the place of your middle finger is reached, mark that place with a tent, and then light the cauterization olive, of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place it on the marked location, in such a way that it descends, and your hand be pressed little by little, and you revolve it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand gently and look at the location; if you see that any amount of the head is uncovered with bone, just as with the amount of grain, then lift your hand and if it does not return with that iron, with another one, if it is cooled down, until that is seen by the eye what we have said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the location and let it be for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place over it cotton soaked in oil and let it be over it until the char of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the location with tetramedication ointment once it has healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And so they say that when the Roman plaster becomes wet, as many times you throw a cloth over it, it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized within the eye, and to have the cauterization within it until a part of the substance of the eye is destroyed.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape away what is dry from the bone, and then heal it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery one must go to the end, until they press on the strong bones within which are found the bones, and this is the form of small alpecat.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They think that from that place the vapors of the head expire.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the ulcer is open for a long time, it should be healed until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two species of cautery at all, except in some men according to the path of fear; and leaving that aside, for me it is better for health when it is; because the head is devitalized by solution of continuity in him just as we have testified in other members, and especially when the patient's head has a phlegmatic nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the species of cautery first is more safe and better for me; and of that house and with that work I am saved.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the whole head there occurs a chronic and long pain and this is prolonged in the patient, and he uses leeches and cupping glasses and caput medusae and poultices and cataplasms and bandages and cauteries and similar remedies, and especially if he has already been cauterized with a cautery which we relate and does not benefit him at all from those causes, then consider that if the patient's head is of strong creation in its nature; and it is phlegmatic and finds great friction, then cauterize it after that with another cautery below that one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that above the horn of his head with a cautery until the scum is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	The scum having been cut away and the quantity we have related discovered and cauterized, then cauterize that with a cautery in the rear part of the head in the place which is called a vessel — and that is the place in which the windsock is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And loosen your hand over it, and do not discover the bones, because by that the patient experiences great pain different from the pain of all other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery is in its place, because the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occipital is a more subtle cautery than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Chapter third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cauterization of not ancient migration.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When in the front part of the head there is a hard pain, or a stinging pain goes into the eye, then evacuate with medicated shampoos, and administer the other treatment which I have written about in the beginnings of illnesses; and if all does not benefit, then cauterization in it is in two ways: either cauterization with an acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterization with a burning medicine is that you take a piece of alder wood and cut it up and mix the ends of it with both ends of the cautery.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then pierce the location of the pain in the temple with a pointed lance until it is in the place below the scum, and hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then bind it tightly over it with a descending constriction, and let that be for the space of three hours; and then loosen the ligature and treat it with water poured on it until the place makes a blister.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that with an ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterization with iron is according to this manner: ignite the cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a nail claw because its head has the form of a claw in which there is some curvature, and in the middle part of it is a small protuberance.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then pause over the location of the pain, and hold your hand  — so that it is not heated by the iron which is below  — and turn the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it which is heated by the specificity of the scum as far as its depth, and raise your hand so that the artery is not heated which is below, so that there does not come a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then moisten the cautery in salt water and pause it over the location, and let that be for three days; then pause a moistened cloth with vinegar on it, and cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the end of the scalpel according to cautery, and beware of incision of artery in this not ancient migration particularly.
Capitol quart.	Chapter fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cauterization of ancient migration.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure a migration with what we have said about the treatment preceding, and what we have said in the divisions of illnesses, and the treatment does not benefit, and you see for the illness that it does not suffice to it what we have said about the first cautery with medicine or with fire, then if you ignite the cautery cut into the scum until it is whitened, and when you have done this, then pause your hand over it for a while, and tighten it so that you cut the artery and it comes within to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However it is necessary for you to guard against the continuance of the mandible which is damaged because of mastication, and that the ligament not be heated and the nerve which hurts that, and that there not come from it a spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is over the custody and precaution of flow of blood from the artery that is cut, because in the cutting of it there is danger, and especially to him who ignores what he does and is not practiced and experienced; and let the operation be in him at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come with reminder of the regiment of flow of blood accidentally from the artery according to its way, in your location of this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see of this illness that it does not suffice to that cautery and you see the patient's body tolerable, then cauterize that in the middle part of the head just as we have related, and cure the ulcer until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter on stretching of artery with cautery having two ends, and that cauterization is better and more fitting.
Capitol .v.	Chapter fifth.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization of pains of ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from friction and it is cured with lacerative causes and with the other treatment which we have said in the division, and the pain is not alleviated, then ignite the cautery, and that is the one called puncta of which this is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then pause the cautery and let it be directed toward all of the ear just as the wheel is turned, or in the circuit of either eardrum if the pain is in one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Draw you out with the cautery of the edge of the ear little by little, so that you feel the location with your hand.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of many points in all the ears, and that is it, then cure the locations until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter sixth.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured and has cauterization not but of the spices which come by phlegm, according to what we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the affected area due to dryness or nerve spasm.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat this type of torture with blisters and scabs and wounds, and your cure is not effective, then you should cauterize the patient in three places: first, at the root of the ear; second, a little below his temple; and third, at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery opposite the affected area, for softening only occurs in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the way of cauterization is that you cauterize the ear at the highest point of its extremity, and on the temple another one, whose length should be according to the length of the fingernail; and apply your hand with the cautery until half of the size of a grain of cummin is burnt.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is made by the cutler, its shape being that of a table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But it is more subtle if you make it a little smaller; and one should cut away the excess thickness a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with what has been described before, until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cauterization for ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient, and you treat it as we have said, but your cure is not effective, and the patient has no fever, then cauterize him in four places: on all the corners of his head; with a cautery, also on the middle of his head, as we have said; and with a cautery on his neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done as it has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is more effective behind; and it should be treated with what has been described.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization for oblivion caused by a flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Let the patient be given at the beginning large blisters and pills of the purgative.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then scrape the head all over, and apply to his neck a plaster of vinegar described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it several times; for that is the way of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do that according to the order which medicine has given, which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if it heals well because of that, but if not, then do to him three cauteries in the back part of his head, which descend from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And let the distance between each cautery be the thickness of a fingernail, and treat the cautery with what it proceeds from.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you wish to increase the number and the patient can tolerate it, then do to him cauteries in the middle part; and if you wish to increase even more, then do them on the two corners.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat that until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-shaped according to the form which has been given above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of parasites and of softening of all the body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Let the patient be purged in his head with blisters and what we have said; then scrape the head of the patient, and cauterize him with a cautery on the middle part of his head, and with a cautery on all the corners of his head, and with a cautery on his neck, and with three cauteries on the back part of his neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body's parasites, and the patients tolerate it, and the illness is strong, then cauterize him with four cauteries on the back part of his neck, and lastly with a cautery on the place where half of a grain of cummin has been burnt, and lift up your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat that until it is healed; and let this be an olive-shaped cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic should not be cauterized unless the epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so, let the brain of him be purged at the beginning with herbs and with the other cure which we have said in the division when the patient is large and tolerates the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if he is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer to him purgatives and masticables, before which for several days there should be an abstinence from food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then scrape the head of the patient, and cauterize him with a cautery on the middle part of his head according to the previous manner, and with another cautery on the back of his head, and on each corner of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize him with cauteries which I have described, having paralysis and softening of the body on the back part of his neck and the back part of his back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the cautery be olive-shaped according to what has preceded it.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a subtle cautery according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humours and gross phlegm, then cauterize him with cauteries which we have said to cause paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess which inclines to melancholy, and the patient's body is moist, then give him something which purges his brain according to what has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then scrape the head of the patient, and properly make a bandage of linen over his skull, and apply that to the middle part of his head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated, and let him be held in every part.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply liniment; and it is more worthy of old wine of sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over the fire with a moderate heat, the amount which he can tolerate when it is on him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then put that on the middle part of his head in the circle, and let him lie down until it is cold.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that to the patient every day for a week with one application, while he keeps his other regimen until it is healed; or if you wish, cauterize him making small points according to his strength, unless you have your hand over a cautery thus ordered: this is a cautery which moistens the brain in equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then apply that cloth steeped in wine or in woolen rags.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization for water which descends into the hole.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have been told of the coming of water into the hole through the passages which you have described in the division, then begin and give to the patient something which purges his brain, and guard that from all moistness.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command that he wash his head, and cauterize him with a cautery on the middle part of his head; and then cauterize him with two cauteries on two temples if there is the coming of water into two holes, or from one side if there is the coming of water from one hole.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Penetrate with a cautery all the veins and arteries which are under the skin; and let the cauteries be long in that length of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Be careful of bleeding when cauterizing; and if you see bleeding from him, stop it with some medicine which is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And let there come to you wisdom, which is in extraction of arteries and abstention from those, and caution regarding bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck below the bones with two cauteries recently produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of the holes are old and thickly gathered, and through the veins and arteries which are in the manifest place of the head, and it is verified that this is superfluous, then cauterize that with a cautery which we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of water falling into the holes, and with a cautery in the middle place of the head, and with two cauteries in the neck below the temples, and with two cauteries in the neck below the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is a need for addition, then cauterize that in all parts of the hole of the eye above the extremity of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On cauterization for foul odor of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you are treating someone with that which we have said in the division, and your treatment does not help, then prepare and give the patient enemas for three nights; then cut his hair, and cauterize him with a cautery made of olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize that with a cautery of clove on both eyebrows below the hair, one small cautery on each.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to ignite the artery.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the cautery of clove:
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On cauterization for softening of eyelids of the holes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is made soft by illness or by moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery with this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you treat it, cauterize that on both eyebrows a little with two cauteries all around, and let them be extended from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	Let the length of each cautery depend on the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand with the cautery too much, but according to the amount that the upper part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On cauterization for the eyelid of the eye when the hairs have turned to the parts inside and close the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye have turned to the parts inside and close the eye, there are two ways to cauterize them: one way is with fire, and one way is with burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize him with fire, order the patient to open his eyes in such a way that he spreads out those hairs which are growing inwards, and let them be prolonged and curved; and if he closes his eye, then you strengthen his eyelids for him with a bandage so that he does not rub it while the hairs are growing.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are growing and curling, then put the head of the patient in your lap, and press on the eyelid of the eye with your finger, with a sign that is according to the shape of a dead leaf, and let the beginning of the sign be near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then put cotton dipped in egg white or in mullein tea on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then heat up the cautery, of which this is the form:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize over the figure which you have marked, little by little, in small spots, until the surface of the skin is burnt up, as though it were a leaf of myrtle; let it appear wholly as it should.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of health from your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted, and its hairs raised above the punctured place of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Then raise your hand and loosen it for three days, then put cotton on it with a bandage until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hairs return for any cause, and the eyelid is made soft again, then do the cautery on that place again all over as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the eyelid, then cauterize that until it is elevated to its natural place and is curved, and let the hairs not poke the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you order the patient to open his eyes in such a way that the hairs are prolonged and curved; then let the sign be made of linen according to the shape of a leaf of myrtle.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take of sage, one ounce, and of live coals, half an ounce. .I., Take that and mix it with honey, and make it into a poultice so that it is not cold; then spread that over the linen which is made according to the shape of a leaf of myrtle, and put that on one eye or both; then put cotton dipped in egg white on the eye, and let the head of the patient be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Then hold the finger on the medicine and press that a little and do not rub it while the patient feels the biting of the medicine, for the biting is in him as though it were fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Then when he perceives that the biting has ceased, let him loosen the medicine and wash it off with water; then consider if you see the eyelid already lifted up as though it were washed after cauterization with fire or with incision, for then it is well; and if it returns to that of the medicine on the place in which the medicine did not take effect and is not blackened until your operation has been curved and the eye drawn together.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then put a bandage on it so that the skin of the swelling is eradicated, and treat that with ointment of diascordium or another one until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, after your operation to guard against the falling in of the medicine, and if the eyelid within a few days is made soft and some cause makes the hairs poke into the eye, then repeat your medicine on that place from which the eyelid is made soft, and altogether as you did at the beginning, and cover it so that it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of a leaf of myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of men are various according to magnitude and smallness, therefore according to that is made your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not be amazed at the way of rettitude for him who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On cauterization for a fistula which is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fistula with that which we have said in the divisions of illnesses and your treatment does not confer, then know that you cauterize it according to this manner: order the patient to put his head in your lap, and let him hold his head by some servant in such a way that it is not rubbed or moved with his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then put cotton dipped in egg white or in mullein tea on the eye of him.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then heat up the cautery, of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which is hollow, as it is shaped like a reed or a feather, from one extremity on which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, let it be penetrated into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to let it come out like this with a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But however, what is convenient is best for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then compress the fistula if it is open and draw out from him pus and dry that up.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the rottenness from him.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place upon him the cautery which should be well ignited and have your hand a little below the cautery at the start of the nose so that your hand does not err or the patient be disturbed, then place the cautery in the grommet and corrupt that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And therefore if at the beginning of your cautery it pierces into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; and leave that as it is for three days, and then place upon that spot a plaster and surround it with an ointment which is drying until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it is not healed, then place upon him an acute corrosive medicine so that the bone is uncovered and scrape according to what is convenient in his case.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another manner of cautery for a fistula which some first said: enter into the place of the fistula and close it up and then pause in that fissure a subtle thread of which the form of it is; and pour into that the quantity of one ounce of molten lead; and hold your hand with good retention, and let not the patient be disturbed so that the molten lead does not reach the grommet of that; and cover where you pause upon the grommet of the patient with white linen or with water, for the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by a wonderful healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said of the cautery and the cure, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer an incision of the nose and reduce the fistula into the cavity of the nose according to where it will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cautery of the fissure of the nose.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times fissures happen in the lips and especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore when you cure those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your cure is not profiting, then ignite the cautery of a small scalpel according to this form that it is set:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the subtlety of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then pause that gently in those fissures so that the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cautery of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth there is an ulcer and then it comes to a head, and then it is broken, and then it is old, and then it becomes rotten and there is made a fistula, and then you cure that and your cure is not profiting, then where you ignite cautery according to the quantity that is received in the fistula, and then place that ignited iron into the opening of the fistula, and have your hand so that the hot iron reaches the bottom of it, and at the end of it do that one or two times; and then cure that with what we have said about the cure until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore if the pus is discharged and it is healed, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to uncover the place and scrape away the rotten bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cautery of teeth and of softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth ache, and you cure those with medicines and it does not confer, then place the head of the patient in your lap, and then ignite the cautery of which the form will come hereafter, so that you pause the quanula on the tooth and insert into that the ignited cautery quickly, and have your hand a little so that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth where it is pierced.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift up your hand, and then repeat the cautery several times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient will hold his mouth open with water of salt and hold that for one hour, and then stop that, for the aching tooth is bound and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupted moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cautery of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is by frigidity, or in it is cold or wormy, or does not confer the cure with medicine, then cautery in that is according to two manners: or cautery with a cow's udder, or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with udder is that you take the udder of a cow and boil that in horn of iron, and then take hold and wrap that around the end of the tent, and then immerse that in boiled udder and pause that over the aching tooth quickly so that it is frigid.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or hold in the said udder above, and pause that over the aching tooth, and place upon that hot iron so that the iron reaches the bottom of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However the cautery with fire is that you attend to the needle of brass or iron, and let there be in it some thickness and the acuity of the fire not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery of which the form will come, and pause that over the tooth and have your hand so that the cautery is frigid; and do that several times because the pain still remains or on that day or on another day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And where by impress of that cautery that the patient fills his mouth with good udder and holds that for one hour and then spits it out; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize with which you wish extremity according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the needle:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cautery of hernia.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernia is of phlegm and of cold humors and they are not obeying digestion by medicines and you wish the digestion of those slightly, then you ignite the cautery which the form of which is this following, having two extremities bent so that the smoke of the cautery goes through the hernia from one side, and pause that ignited over the ulcer once, and if it does not discharge of that, then do that over the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the hernia is small, then pause the cautery according to the quantity of the hernia, and then let it be for three days and pause over that hold in udder so that what the fire has burned is softened.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment and poultices and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the needle or iron for cautery is as follows:
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cautery of wound and of contraction of Ale.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture comes upon the top of the lungs and especially when that is by frigidity of constitution, then where the patient is evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cautery that after the root of the gullet in the place which is pierced.
