E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful that you do not reach the cautery to his gullet, nor burn his throat, but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that with another cautery at the junction of the neck at his last vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let the cautery be a red-hot iron in the manner described previously.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat that with what has been described before, so that it may heal.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of the cautery for diseases of the lung and of coughing.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When coughing and lung disease come from moist humors infiltrating, and the patient does not have a fever or consumption and it is an old disease, then cauterize that with two cauteries above the furcula in the places just beneath the collar bones, and with another cautery in the middle of the chest between the two nipples; and let the cauteries be red-hot according to the form described previously.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cautery be puncturing with the cautery that is called puncta, the form of which is given in the puncturing for earache.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And let there be small punctures under those; and then treat that with what has been described before, so that it may heal.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And if you have the cautery with three spikes, this cautery is for that: with one view you can make three cauteries according to this form:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of the cautery for tics that are in the head of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated by moist and slippery humors that is not returned in its return hour due to his dislocation within so that it may be to him what usually happens, and if he has been displaced because of a slight movement as it should be, then first of all reduce the dislocation, and let the patient be turned onto his back or on his side; and then elevate the windpipe which is in the upper part of the tic into the upper parts by your left-hand fingers if the joint is dislocated at its upper part.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let the cautery have two heads; and this is the form of it:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the windpipe so that it penetrates to the other side; and then the figure of cautery will come when from two-headed cauteries.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And it is subtle according to the amount of tent; and this is the form of it:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is adjusted according to that count for which there are eight cauteries.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then place powdered salt on the cautery and then make the patient adhere to tranquillity, and let the limb not be disturbed for some time so that it may be comforted.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is at the upper parts and it is made thus, then cauterize over the muscle with a red-hot cautery or with pointed cauteries, for the joint is confirmed and the moisture is burnt up and the patient is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of cautery for the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there is movement and moisture infiltrates in the stomach so that it distends from its natural condition and they are multiplied within him, and if you continue the methods of treatment and do not agree with them, then let the patient be lying on his back with his arms stretched out and his head extended, and cauterize that with three cauteries: one cautery below the chest by the amount of a finger with a red-hot cautery, and two cauteries below the rib cage on both sides so that the figure of the cautery comes as a triangle; and lengthen them so that they are not close together and will make heat.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is the quantity of two-thirds of the thickness of the windpipe.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cautery be according to this form, and if you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; and this is a cautery according to the form of a circle according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be punctured to that which is frightened by this cautery: and it is that you sense on the stomach punctured according to the quantity that you wish with tent, and then cauterize that with a cautery in the punctures; and then treat that with the cure which is given before so that it may heal.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of cautery for a painful liver.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there is pain in the liver from coldness or moisture or from gross flatulence so that from its natural condition it is thrown by excessive egression, and it is treated with what has been said and does not agree, then let the patient be turned onto his back with his arms stretched out and his head extended, and sense on the liver punctured according to the quantity that you wish with tent, and cauterize that with three cauteries according to this form and this quantity pressed over the liver below the hypochondrium from which comes the decubitus of a man.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space between each cautery be according to the thickness of a finger, and let the cauteries be according to the length of the body right.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not press it with the cautery too much.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the quantity of what is burnt is equal to the thickness of the width of the windpipe, and it is not pushed too close together; and if the patient stands on his feet, let him then sit down, for he has already extended himself, and raise his arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a cautery-spoon when you have subtlety and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And beware that you do not go too far in the cauterization, and let the windpipe of all the chest be burnt so that it may reach into the intestines, for the windpipe here is subtle; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of piercing an abscess of the liver with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is inflammation or an abscess in the liver and you wish to know whether that abscess is in the flesh of the liver or in its tunic, then if it is in the flesh of the liver, the patient has heavy breath and the pain has become acute.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tunic of the liver, with the pain being made acute and when the doctors have become weary with the cure for him.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	So let the patient be turned onto his back, and then sense the location of the abscess with tent, and then heat the cautery which is formed like a needle, the form of which has been given on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that hot cautery so that all the chest may be burnt so that it may reach into the diaphragm, so that in it there is burning phlegm.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that by the cure for other abscesses so that it may heal.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not use this form of cautery except that from which the one who studies in the art of medicine has become experienced and in whose hands many diseases have been known; but however that is tried by us it should be burned on this operation, for it is better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of cautery for pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	Remove the old cauteries from the roots of the pleurisy by friction according to this way that you take them from the roots of the pleurisy a long dry root that is found, and let it be of the thickness of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then submerge it in oil and iron it with fire, and cauterize with a cautery at the location between the collarbone and the furcula; and with two small cauteries guided downward, one slightly inclining towards the area below the beard, and with two cauteries inclining towards the area between the fifth rib and the armpit, inclining slightly towards the back; and with another cautery in the middle of the foot; and another over the stomach; and with three cauteries on the back; and with a cautery in the location between the two shoulders; and with two cauteries on the sides of the foot, below the cautery between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not wrap your hand with the cautery, but let it be in the open air.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And some ancient people said that they used cauteries of iron similar to a spear, and heated it, and placed it in the location between the ribs, until we reached that ulcer and it became a healthy wound, just as we have said about the ulcer of the lung.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this piercing with a cautery, there is no fear, because it will happen immediately in the location of the fistula to which there is no cure.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of the cauterization of the melt.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you are treating the sickness of the melt with what we have said about treatment in division and do not apply your cure, then cauterization in it is according to three manners, all of which are correct, and one of them is that you make three or four lines according to the length of the melt according to the figure of the cauteries of the lung, the figure of which has preceded.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And the other way is that the cautery be round and not make a line around the melt but only cauterize the central location of the foot; so if the melt is made at the top of the foot, around the ankle, if the melt is made at the heel of the foot, at the bottom, if the melt is made in the middle, around the fascia, and if the melt is made at the neck of the foot, then cauterize with a round cautery according to the figure of the gout which we have said.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And the third way is that the cautery be in the shape of a sword, and if the melt is made at the heel of the foot or around the ankle, then cauterize according to the figure which we have said in the cauterization of the foot; so if the melt is made at the top or bottom of the foot, then cauterize according to the figure of the cautery of the neck of the foot.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And it is another way to cauterize, which is that you ignite the cautery having two garments, the cause of which we have said in the chapter on dislocation of the muscle, and elevate the tendon which is in the direction of the melt where the left side of the patient lies.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And then cauterize the location of the foot according to the way which we have said with the cautery of a sword, and if the melt is made around the ankle or at the heel of the foot, then cauterize according to the figure of the round cautery.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then immerse the two garments, heated up, into that end through which you penetrate the tendon from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then extract the cautery; and thus are made four cauteries.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three garments.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you cure the cautery when it has lain for many days, because the other causes precede in the cure.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	Of the cauterization of water-gout.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cautery does not cut in gout but properly in hernia.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you are treating the gout with the manners of cure which we have said in division and do not apply your cure, then cauterize it with four cauteries in the circuit of the hernia and with a cautery over the stomach, and with another cautery over the lung, and with another cautery over the melt, and with two cauteries between the spurs of the two shoulders, and with a cautery on the right side of the foot, and with another cautery over the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the quantity of the depth of the cautery should be proportionate to the thickness of the tendon.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then let the cautery lie open so that it lies for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient from cure when you are cauterizing him so that two tendons be added to it, and let him lie in it with help of cure.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The form of the cautery with which the belly is cauterized should be clave-shaped according to that which precedes it above, and that with which the back is cauterized should be olive-shaped according to that which precedes it.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	Of the cauterization of the lung and of its causes.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are pustules with gout and are filled with yellow water, then cauterize the feet above the heel of the foot in the location which is between the auricular and the ring finger, and elevate your hand with the cautery and do not twist it; and then elevate your hand and do not return it at all, because the yellow water will ooze out.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery is according to this form: and then make two cauteries on each thigh, and in each thigh let the cautery be made with the tip of the sword-shaped cautery.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And let the cautery be according to the length of the thigh: one below the groin and the other above the middle location of the thigh; and on each thigh two cauteries.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And let the wound lie open without cure for a long time so that some water oozes from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then cure the causes which we have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On cauterization of the abdomen.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the body is affected by cold and moisture which weaken the digestive and retentive faculties, which are located in the stomach and intestines, it is treated with healing remedies rather than bleeding, and sometimes the patient endures cauterization to restore the virtue of digestion, then cauterize that area with a large cautery over his stomach as has been described in the chapter on cauterization of the stomach, using the circular cautery and four cauteries around the omphalus with a slender cautery; or cauterize the alcatena over oiled cotton wool, or with two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if the moisture is excessive and the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize that area over the penis and intestines, and apply two cauteries near the groin on either side; this is a perfect cure for sexual dysfunction and you will not err.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On cauterization of ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When in nature there are ancient hemorrhoids from thick humors or corrupted moisture, and they are cured by the method we have described in the division without bleeding, then cauterize them with three cauteries on the lower part of the small spine of the coccyx in a small triangular shape, and with a cautery above the navel where two tendons cross.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if his stomach is swollen and his food undigested, and his face sometimes pustular, then cauterize that area over the stomach with a large cautery as has been described; and with one cautery on the anus, and another cautery on his navel with a slender cautery; let the cautery remain open for some time, then cure him until he is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On cauterization of athlete's foot near the incision.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you make an incision on athlete's foot, then ignite the cautery which is similar to a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then place that ignited cautery into the incision, and close your hand over it until the cautery reaches the orifice of the vein from which the blood comes.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Do this once or twice, for if they are too numerous, then cauterize each one according to what we have recounted, and cure them with that which you use for their wounds until it is healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery over oiled cotton wool, it is more effective in healing.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On cauterization of fistulas which are caused naturally in the parts of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the method we have described in its place, and the patient is terrified by that, let it be healed with cauterization.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when you see a fistula in nature which is ancient, and it emits foul matter and corrupted moisture, then probe that with a slender probe, and thus know the quantity of its depth with the aforementioned slender probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then ignite the cautery which is similar to a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	Then place that ignited cautery into this fistula according to the quantity where you inserted the probe.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And repeat the cautery on that area until those corrupted humors are burnt once or twice or three times according to the quantity of your need.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And beware of cauterizing nerve or vein; or if the fistula goes to the bladder or intestine, then beware of all those places; and do not do this unless the fistula is in a fleshy place and you are certain that it does not penetrate.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that area until it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed and those matters are discharged from him for a long time, then know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if those matters are not discharged from him, then know that they are penetrating into his bone or have corrupted it there, or that cause will return in that place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On cauterization of warts.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in warts there is pain from cold or from grossness of wind, and the skin of the patient is withered, then know that you should cauterize those warts with a cautery on each wart with a slender cautery of which you have the recollection.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And apply them very quickly with the second one small below, so that there will be three linear cauteries, and thus they will be more effective in healing.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is debility and softening of the bladder from cold and moisture so that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize that area in the lower part of the bladder, where the hairs of the penis begin, and cauterize with one cautery on the right side of him, and another on his left.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of the hairs; and cauterize that area with a cautery in the lowest part of the abdomen, or with two cauteries if it is necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And let the cautery be slender according to what has been described.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On cauterization of the mother's milk.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is cold and moisture in the mother, and she is prohibited from conceiving, and her menstruation is corrupted, and there is delay in provoking it, and pain comes from the retention of it, then let that area be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel as we have described in the cautery of the bladder; and with a cautery on the lowest part of the abdomen, or with two cauteries, and let the cautery be slender.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On cauterization of the dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist humors are infused into the ankle and are the cause of the displacement of its joint, and the sign of it is that the leg is prolonged over the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is pressed in where the bone juts out.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore let the patient be cauterized over the ankle of him with a circular cautery similar to a ring, more than you have probed with the probe in the circuit of that part as it is turned, and because the part falls the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And let the cautery be the same as the one described in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if that cautery is not at hand, then cauterize that area with three cauteries with a large olive-shaped cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And let the cautery be done according to the amount of the thickness of all the tendons; and cure that area until it is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On cauterization of the sciatic nerve.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain comes in the ankle and it is caused by cold and moisture, the patient is cured by that which we have described and does not bleed, and if it is ancient, then let the patient be bled from gross humors with suppurating pills or artificial ones similar to them; and cauterize that area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of the cautery in that place is according to two manners: or cautery with burning medicines, or cautery with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	There are two known ways to do this, one of which is to cauterize the area above the patient's hip with three triangular cauteries in this shape; and make sure to go deep enough with these cauteries.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the space between each cautery should be the width of the finger or thumb, depending on whether the cautery tool is small or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	In some cases, the cauteries are placed in a cross shape over the top of the hip, so there are four cauteries total.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, you can cauterize the circle of which the shape is preceded in the cauterization of the dislocation of the hip; and it should be a containing circle that burns away the sharpness of the entire tendon.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is how you cauterize a sciatica, when there is pain adherent to the hip that does not extend into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if the pain extends into the thigh, then you should cauterize it with two cauteries on the thigh, at the location where you direct the patient's gaze, which is where the pain resides; and also with one cautery on the ankle, four fingers' worth, on the wild side.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if you are using a knife for cauterization, then the depth of the cautery should be according to the thickness of the tendon.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if you direct the patient's gaze such that the pain extends down to the location between their toes, then cauterize this area with three or four cauteries, or more if necessary.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if you direct the patient's gaze such that the pain goes down the front of the thigh to the knee, then cauterize this area with a knife.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And in all cauterizations, be careful not to burn nerves or large arteries; and for this reason, you should place your hand over the patient's chest in order to prevent harm or contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And you have seen one or another of those who cauterize on the ankle and finish in cauterization, and then the fire inflames inside the foot, and the foot becomes perforated and rotten all throughout.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	Then he experiences a strong pain in his belly, and there he dies.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two places at once, then cauterize each one according to this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise say that in cauterization of the hip, this is how you should do it: make a circle out of iron whose circuit is half a palm; and its opening should be according to the thickness of a finger or less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And inside that circle, there should be another third; and the space between them should be the width of a finger joint; and those circles should open on two sides; and the length of the nails in those circles should be one or two joints, and make decently bent edges in the circles; and this is its shape:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	This is how you cauterize the hip when it is dislocated: first, ignite a fire inside that it becomes red-hot and gives off sparks; then place it on the top of the hip, with the patient lying on his side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And then cauterize that area with three round cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then let it rest for three days; and then dress that wound with a bandage and leave the plaster open for several days; and then heal that wound with ointment until it is well.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis says: O sons, we have used this type of cauterization sparingly out of fear for the life of the patient, and because few have been found who practice it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	But from those who suffer from these diseases, find out where they hurt him and examine that location.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	But when you administer cauteries with medicines that burn, make two circles with a tool that has a perforated door in which the handle of the iron door is placed; let the length of its sides be two joints or as much.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And let the space between each one be the width of a finger joint; and let them be open below and above, and let them contain themselves according to this shape:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then place the patient on his side, and press your hand against the top of the hip; and then take water-tail and dip it between the two circles, and let its quality be small by little with fire, and hold that for an hour, and let the patient suffer the biting and squeezing of it — for there will be biting as from fire — until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then lift your hand with the tool and wipe away the water-tail from the entire hip with warm water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then let it rest for three days and place a bandage over the bite mark until the blackness of the squeezed mark is removed, and let him rest like that for several days, and a swelling will go away.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that wound with ointment until it is well.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends into the thigh or the leg, make him stand in such a way that he contains water according to how it is done in the hip equally.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of water-tail, and I have already written that in the treatise on the refinement of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Take one part of alkali and one part of non-extinguished ash from both ends, and mix them together and place them in a new bowl whose bottom is perforated with a small hole, according to the amount that goes into him.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place the bottom of the other bowl on top of it upside down, and pour over that alkali and live ash from warm water which covers those by one finger, and then compress them with your hand, and let the bowl that hangs from him pour sharp water into the area below the bowl.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then adjust all that water and pour it over the other live ash and another renewed alkali, because that hour makes strong fire which is administered in many medical procedures and in cauterization of the other limbs, because that operation makes fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And some medicines are cauterized with broad tools, like tweezers and honey and ash with soap that have been mixed together.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Gualia recorded from an ancient man the operation and the cure by which is cured pain of hip and sciatic nerve, and magnifies much that body part because of it, and says that he did not need any other cure, and that it was healed by one method with a bath and ointment that he made himself.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And let it be pressed with a certain wine, and if it is not pressed, then take the fig juice; and let the body part be twisted by a little with grays, and let it be placed over the hip where there is pain, or in the thigh, or in the leg, and let it be bound.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And let it rest for the amount of three hours or for the quantity that the patient feels the biting of the squeeze.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then put him in a bath and then when his body is heated, put him in the sun, because the pain will cease and he will be well.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that it is not good for anyone to use cauterization with these medicines except after the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	But Ja Escorides says that when the vein is stretched with a goat's skin, it should be cauterized, he makes him go; and let the cautery be done according to this method: take wool and dip it in old oil, and place it between the toes of the foot and between the bone.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take dry goat skin and blow it with fire until it is made into charcoal; and then place it over the wool and let it hang until it is dry.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And repeat this, and do not stop doing this until the sensation of the bite reaches the elbow and the pain subsides.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cauterization is called cow's-tongue cautery.

De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On the cauterization for joint pain.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	At times, pain occurs in the back for various reasons, such as bruising or puncture, or excessive discharge, and due to similar causes, from the infiltration of moist and irritating matter.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And cauterization should not be performed except in this one case, which is caused by the infiltration of moist and irritating matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu. De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On cauterization for the beginning of gangrene.

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cauterization for gout and joint pain.

De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On the cauterization for fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a fracture occurs in the angles and joints, cutting through the skin to the soft tissue underneath, and this is evident immediately, then you must command the patient to stop eating for that day and to fast for several days so that the wound can heal.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Then return the patient to his bed and command him to keep his leg elevated so that it is either bent or straightened out at the hip.
