But if it oozes blood or pustules form, then let there be placed to him that which you have; or they are of the malignant pustules, then cut and cauterize that from which the blood has been discharged and all the cavities are completely open.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then let there be placed in the nose also after the incision oil and water or vinegar.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and from it proceeds humidity into the palate, then know that it is healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the humidity does not penetrate according as it should, then you know that within him there is swollen flesh in the nose bones of which there has been no discharge.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore let there be placed in the nose also after the incision oil of which there is some thickness, and rub in it hair of needles, and place between each joint the quantity of the finger or more, and open the sight and insert one end of the needle into the nose with the ray or other cause from which it is possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And once this is done, let them take their incense and hold it until it reaches the nostrils, and let it be burned over their throat; for many experienced soldiers do this action when they want to.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	Then pause the two ends of the gallbladder; one end comes out through the nose and the other goes into the nose. Administer cauterization of flesh with the nails that are in the gallbladder, and do this until you taste that the flesh is cauterized by the nails.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	Then remove the gallbladder and place in the nose a cauterization of blood, and do this for three days or more until the ointment corrode all that is rotten in the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of the cause, place a lead pipe in the nose for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if the wound starts to bleed again, use that one. [i.e., the cauterization]
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument for the head purging by which oils and medicines are distilled into the nose.
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And do this with silver or gold, which should be like a small open lamp, also with a small hole, and the wick similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed canal like a reed, and the canal of the instrument for head purging should be flat and open; to which there is a handle on it, with which you have that when you pour into it oil or water that you want from the juices and suction causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these head purges are precious: take a drachm of beaver castoreum, white balsam, ginger, long pepper, frankincense, myrrh, and spikenard in the amount of half an ounce. Take it with juice of nettle and cabbage, and let them be made into pills, and temper a pill with water of tebezia, and let it be given to the patient lying on his back facing up.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of holes in the ends of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times it happens that a hole occurs in the ends of the nose, and it becomes swollen and enlarged within several days if one does not observe the guard of it.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And because of this, insert that into the beginning of its appearance, and remove all that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place over it a cautery or burning medicine which stays in its place.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its eruption is delayed until it becomes swollen, then consider if it has become hard, of dusky color and with little feeling, then do not touch that with iron because it is a pustular abscess; for many times when you insert this abscess through it great harm comes to the one in whom it was.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is of a soft touch and not of dusky color, and it is possible to insert into it without fear, then empty out the patient and insert that without fear, and cure the place with something that corrode and constrict until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of suturing of the nose and lips and ears when their continuity is dissolved by ulcer or similar.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when there is a solution of continuity in one of these cartilages, few perform the operation except for some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, whenever because of some cause, you consider that it is a fresh ulcer with its blood, then adjust the two lips of the ulcer with a suture, and then cure it until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of solution of continuity are already separated, and each is made healthy, then cut off each part of its visible cord until blood comes out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then adjust the two lips with a suture and strengthen them, and over them pulverize dragon blood and sprinkle thrisat on it, and place over the powder a piece of emplaster of diafinicon, or of some other of the consolidating plasters, and let that be bound for two days or three, and then remove that plaster and change that emplaustre and let it be bound until the scabs are separated, and then cure it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the way of suturing is that you add the solution of continuity or with needles as we have recommended in the suturing of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with thread just as we have taught you.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of extraction of those causes that come in the two lips in their parts inside.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times in some men in the parts inside of their lips there are certain hard abscesses which resemble grit of err, and some of them are minor and some are major.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore cut open the lips and split each of those hard spots throughout its parts, then fill in the wound with sage thrisat until the blood is restricted, and then wash it out with wine vinegar and cure the spot with something that constricts it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incision of the flesh pressed against the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Great care should be taken over the gum of flesh pressed against it which the ancients called albulus, therefore suspend that with an incision or what you have it with forceps and insert it above its root, and let the pus flow out or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then place over it sage thrisat or other astringent or cauterizing powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then insert it secondly and cauterize it, for the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of extraction of teeth with iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth in the parts inside and outside and between the gums are adjusted rough scars, scabs, and some are blackened and are made citrines or green because of the gum coming through that corruption, and the teeth are bound.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore cut the patient between your fingers and let him hold his head down, and scrape the teeth in which appear those scars and causes looking like sand so that no root of any cause remains, and that will be made of the blackness and of the citrineness and of the others until they are cleansed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore if it is left over what is in those of the beginning of the root, well; and if not, then you iterate the root over those on another day and again and again until the final result that you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have need of many kinds of instruments, of diverse forms and figures according to the preparation for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And because the teeth that are pulled out of the gums have another shape than those that are cut between the teeth, and these shapes of instruments you should prepare right away, which you will see immediately:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of tooth extraction.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Because you should treat the tooth of its pain with every art and delay in any extraction of it, because there is no cause that prevents its growth when it is extracted, for it is a sublimated substance inside which is an obstacle to its extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the patient is forced to have that tooth extracted, you must be certain which is the painful tooth, because many times the pain deceives the patient and it appears in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and the pain does not cease until the sick and painful tooth is extracted, for we have seen this through the operation of the teeth.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore when you are certain which is the painful tooth and know it well, then you should scarify the gum around the tooth with a spatulum in which there is some virtue, until it is dissolved from the tooth of the gum of all division, and then masticate it with your teeth, or with fine forceps little by little as you concuss it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then hold it firmly with strong fingers by good speech or strong stupor, and place the head of the patient between your teeth which you hold well so that he does not bite you, and then treat the tooth according to rectitude in a way that you do not break it nor give the patient greater pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore if it is not forgotten, then take one of those instruments and place that underneath him from every part with facility and exert the removal of him as well as he can be done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is cracked or rotten, then you should cover that crack with a cloth and tighten that with the end of a fine thread so that it is not squeezed in the hour of your constriction upon that with your fingers.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And if you have any instrument which could be made of the root of a tree with the virtue of scarification, and it is necessary to extract the tooth by the head of the patient according to this way: And then open wide with scarification around the gum in every part and guard your strength that you do not break it and break a part from him, and return over the patient so that he is better than the first pain.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And if the tooth is extracted from the gum by the head of the patient and it cannot be done by the head of the patient, then it is necessary to extract it by another way which you will be certain by which it is extracted. And guard yourself that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their foolhardiness and audacity about extraction, without administering what we have recommended; for many times they bring upon men great sicknesses which are more difficult than they were squeezed, and the roots of them all wriggled, or some of those, or that you extract that with some bones of the jaw as we have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then the extraction of it is washed the mouth with warm wine or sour wine with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if blood flows from that, thus as it should, then take some quantity of vitriol and sprinkle over the wound, and if it does not work that vitriol, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and fine tweezers with which the tooth is masticated at the beginning are of long extremity, of short handle and thick, so that they are not bent when you work with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And be thus with handles of thick extremity so that when you stretch with those they are not bent, let them be short extremities.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And be made of iron of India descended from straight extremities, and in the extremities of those are teeth of which the one enters into the other and stretch by strong constriction, and some times the extremities of those are the form of a beak of a stork whose name is Ciconia, it is hooked, and are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of extraction of teeth and of dislocation of the bones of the jaws bitten.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you should extract a tooth which is bitten for some cause, then you should pause over the place cut with a bandage for one or two days until the place is softened; and then insert your finger or tweezers the extremities of which are like the beak of a stork called Ciconia or hooked, the form of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The extremities of them be made inside as with file or chisel.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey you by these forceps or tweezers, then you should dig over the root and remove all the flesh and insert the instrument which is called atalium, it is a little lever of which the form is thus:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And be of short extremity thick a little, and not be bent so that it is not squeezed.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Thus if the cause of this is forgotten by you, it is good; and if not, aid yourself with these other instruments of which these are the forms. The form of the first instrument is triangular with a pointed end in which there is some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it be triangular and of a very thin extremity.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you are aided by this instrument having two spikes, the shape of which is to follow:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which precede in tooth extraction; for there is made with this instrument which is assimilated to a large needle, and this is the shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the twisted or short triangular extremity, which has some thickness, and is not bent so that it is not snapped.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another thing to know about the instruments of moving teeth are similar and akin to the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the wise and subtle artisans in the art find for themselves many ways according to what they understand of the operation and the diverse illnesses; for there are diverse illnesses which the ancients did not name or put into proper instruments by their forms of diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or of the other bones of the mouth is cracked, then it must be cured on that in its place with what is convenient to him of the instruments and forceps which we have said in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and aid yourself by the gesture of which this is the shape:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And there must be some thickness in it little by little, and it must be bound or held by the mouth so that it does not escape or leak until all of the bone is forgotten; and then restore the place with appropriate medicines to that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small breaking in the bone, then scrape that of that breaking and of its blackness, and cure it within until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the cure of teeth which are prominent above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent not according to their natural form by those the shape is lacking, and especially when it happens in women, and especially in elderly women; therefore you must consider: if the tooth is next to another tooth, and it is not possible for there to be a lancing or lining of it, then remove that one; but if it is not attached to another tooth, then you insert that one with this instrument of which this is the shape; and it is similar to pig's tooth, and it must be made of Indian iron with an extremely sharp end.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And your incision should be such that you insert it into the tooth in several days because of the hardness of the tooth, and not cut another of the teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is a prominent tooth exposed to grinding, then you grind that one with an Indian iron file of which this is the shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it all be of Indian iron and the margin evenly; and let it have small points like a file with which needles are made, and with which the tooth is ground little by little in several days with facility, so that no other tooth is cut or broken.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then you line it at its end, and scrape it with a sharp razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth of which one part is cracked and cuts the tongue, then you must grind it within until the sharp edge of that fracture is worn down and flattened so that the tongue is not cut nor speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of broken teeth with gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When it happens to the teeth that there is concussion and removal by striking or falling, and the patient cannot hold onto what they chew, and you have cured them with astringent medicines, and your cure has not helped, then so that they do not rot, it is useful that they are bound with gold wire and not silver, for silver becomes black and soon rots after several days, but gold does not change at all.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the wire be of such thinness and thickness according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the shape of the binding is that you take the wire and place twice its length between two healthy teeth, and then let it grow with two tortuosities of the wire between two broken ones, or if one or more, within so that the thread comes to the healthy tooth from the other part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then repeat the binding within to the part from which you began, and strengthen your hand with facility and skill within so that it is not broken.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your binding be such that you bind the wire over the roots of the teeth so that it does not leak.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then you insert the wire’s excess ends with forceps or tweezers, and draw those to each other in every place with gestures, and convert them and hide them between the healthy tooth and the broken one, so that it does not harm the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then let her tightly close it thus with Roman wax.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or broken, strengthen that or those with another wire in the same way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the binding of two healthy teeth and two broken ones, thus with their threads bound:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it happens that one tooth or two return to their places of origin, and they are regrown thus as we have recommended, and that they rot again.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it does not do anything but good artisans and the wise.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it is apt for some cause of the bones of a cow, and it is made in the shape of teeth, and placed in the place where the tooth fails, and is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves with him for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter .xxxiv.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the thread which appears in the tongue and it prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which appears under the tongue some times, or is natural to him, or it happens accidentally and occurs because of a wound that is already consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on it is that you open the mouth of the patient, the jaw being held in your hand; and elevate the tongue, and then insert the nervous thread according to its length so that the tongue is released from its binding.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knottiness in it, and that is standing because of consolidation of the wound, then you cut a notch and split it according to its length so that you have split the thread and the knot is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And beware that there is not made a fissure in the lip of meat, and you split here the artery and blood flows out.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then it is washed with vinegar or wine or vinegar and water, and then the patient spits out; so that the tongue be not bound up by another wound.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if blood flows out, place on the spot vinegar triphled; but if blood vents, then cauterize the spot with a burning cautery appropriate to that.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then it is cured by the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of ranula under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes it happens under the tongue an apostema resembling a small nut which prohibits speech, and strong is enlarged within so that it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on it is that you open the mouth of the patient facing the sun and consider the apostema.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it of a dusky or black color, hard, to which the patient does not respond with feeling, then do not touch that because it is rotten.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is turned white and humid, then you put the ointment on it, and insert that subtle sponge, and insert the whole thing; and if blood comes out during your operation, then you stop above with a trussed bandage, so that the blood is restricted.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work while it is still wet with the ointment, and wash it with sweet wine and salt; and heal it with another healing until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of an abscess from both ears, and of that which is in the throat, and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess appears in the throat, it is like glands which are clustered together, which are cut open and are called both ears, which when you treat them with what we have said in the division, and they are not healed, then you should consider whether the abscess is hard, of a dusky color, with little feeling; then do not touch that with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of a red color and the root is thick, then do not touch that with iron for fear of bleeding; unless you let that one remain until it is ripe, and either you will cut it out or it will burst on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of a white color, soft, and the root of it is fine, then that one should be cut into.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it is that you consider, before your operation, whether the abscess has rested completely or has diminished by any diminution; and then have the patient lie down facing the sun, and his head be in your lap, and open the mouth of him, and the servant holding his hands press the tongue of him downward with a noble instrument, of which this is the shape:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or bronze, and be fine like a needle.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	And when you press with that the tongue and it is shown to you the abscess, and you put over that your thumb, then take ointment and insert that into the hollow, and draw that out to the outside parts as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another way is that you draw some cause from the membranes; then insert that with an instrument of which this is the shape:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It is like a pair of forceps, except that its ends are bent so that the aperture of each of those is in the direction of the other, very sharp, and it should be made of iron coated in wax.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then insert that with a sponge of which this is the shape: and it should be sharp on one side and blunt on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have inserted one hole, insert the other according to this method of insertion, and then let the patient gargle with water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if blood comes out, then gargle with water of cooking liquid from the rind of pomegranate or leaf of myrtle, and similar to that of the causes of constriction so that the flow of blood is restricted, and then heal that until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes in the throat there are other abscesses besides those two ears; and insert those according to what has been said about the insertion of two holes equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have once treated a woman of an abscess which was in her throat, and that abscess had turned dusky in color, with little feeling; it had closed up her throat, and the woman could breathe only through a narrow opening, and she had prohibited herself from eating and drinking water, and she was on the verge of death if she had not taken any food or drink for one or two days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And that abscess had pushed so much that it had made two bumps within which fluid would drip through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	So I cut her throat with a scalpel and put in one of them the ointment, and drew that out, and it came out from her a great portion; then I cut into where I understood was the other opening, and then I closed her mouth, pressed her tongue, and then I put the ointment on that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut off a great portion of it, and only a little blood flowed from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	So absolutely her throat was closed, and she began to drink water at once, and then took food; therefore I did not cease cutting that abscess many times for a long time, and the abscess returned in the place of it, which cut into it again and again as long as it was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	So I had iron and cauterized her throat, therefore she was in great distress; and then I walked around and did not know what God had done to that; therefore I believed.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of the incision of a hernia when it is abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When pus comes out of the hernia and it is abscessed and long, then that is called a perpendicular hernia; and if it is swollen and round at the bottom, then it is called a buba.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is healed with what has been said in the division and does not conform to your cure, and the abscess cauterized is already old and thin, then you should insert that which is swelled around and round; and if it is long and blood comes out of it, dusky or black in color, and there is no feeling in it, then beware of cutting into it, for fear over the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, that you make the patient lie down and press his tongue with an instrument of which you process its shape, then put ointment in the new one, and draw that out from above and insert it with one of the two instruments which I said about the insertion of two holes.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And beware that you do not insert that unless it is drawn up over the natural term by addition, for if you cut into it more, you will draw out its speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then after the incision, use that which we have recommended in the insertion of two holes, and heal that until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the incision of it, then use the iron in cauterizing it without fear, and the manner of cauterizing in it is not but with sharp water; and let the patient's head be in your lap, and then press his tongue with the instrument which we have said, and then take that water which we said in the chapter on cauterization, and conform to living cause, and put that not thick nor thin, and of that fill the hollow of the instrument of which this is the shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the end of it be hollow in which the medicine is paused as with the concavity of a spoon; and put the instrument over the hernia, and let the patient lie on his side so that saliva or spittle drips from the mouth of him due to the intrinsic medicine, so that nothing goes down into the throat of him and let it drip.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then hold your hand over the medicine, and express that onto the uvula for a space of half an hour until you see it blackened and soothed by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a cloth and wrap that over the end of the iron, and immerse the iron in the medicine, and insert the end into a tube of wax so that the iron adheres to that tube; and do that as many times until you accomplish what you want from cauterizing the grape, then let it dry and fall off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you feel that the medicine needs to be repeated, repeat it, and then cauterize the area around the ulcer with a cotton swab dipped in wine, and cleanse the area around the ulcer with the water from the medicine, and wash it with rubbing alcohol, and treat the inside of the ulcer with ointments until it heals.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this type of treatment is more safe than surgery and less painful and terrifying.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the ulcer is healed with a liquid that is thinner than cauterization and incision, for it is healed by sublimation in this way: take calamine, hyssop, oregano, rue, Arabic scordium, camomile, bruised plants and similar to these herbs, and put all those causes, or some of them, in a vessel, and let them be steeped in mild wine; and the vessel should be warm with decent heat, and there should be a hole in the middle of the vessel, on which an appropriate hollow instrument made of silver or bronze is placed; it should be made of silver or bronze.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the end of this instrument is inserted into the mouth of the patient so that the steam reaches the ulcer on the glottis, until the ulcer is very foggy.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat this several times until it is dry, and beware of performing this treatment at the beginning of an inflammation of an ulcer, for it would make the inflammation worse; rather, you should wait for the declaration of the ulcer's cautery.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument, then take a cane and attach a piece of holly at its end, so that the mouth of the patient is protected, for the holly's close prevents the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and of what adheres in the throat, and of other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Sometimes there is adhesion in the throat or a thorn in the foot or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you should extract what is visible from these, by looking at it with an instrument in front of the sun, so that you can see what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is hidden and concealed in the throat, you should make the patient vomit before the food has digested in the stomach, for often the cause of the throat lies hidden by vomiting; or let the patient swallow a piece of napkin or a leaf of lettuce or a piece of dry bread; or let him swallow a piece of dried sponge, and then apply vinegar to it strongly, and then let the patient swallow it, for when it reaches the place where the thorns are, they will be dislodged.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And if you take an eel and apply vinegar to it, and let it be inside and applied, it will be extracted; or take a needle and push it in and push it out.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not dislodged by those causes which we have mentioned, then use an instrument made of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be thicker than a small needle, and at its end there should be a hollow which you can insert into the patient's throat easily.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let the patient' head be elevated, and beware of touching his bones in the throat, so that he does not cough or vomit, or that the doctor holds his hand over his mouth.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But if the patient himself inserts it, because of his knowledge of the location of the cause and pulls the instrument upwards, all this according to the amount for which he is prepared until it is dislodged.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of blood-letting annexed to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When blood-letting has been administered with what we have said in the division of treatment by medicines, and it does not help, then consider the throat of the patient towards the sun, for you should have applied his tongue with an instrument which we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore if you see blood, extract it gently with a small needle or with decently thin tweezers.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if you are unable to extract it, then take a hollow tube and insert it into the throat of the patient, and then place a hot iron in the hollow of the tube, and do this as many times as necessary (until the blood-letting is stopped and it ceases from the throat), and let the patient abstain from water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a sponge saturated with rubbing alcohol, and open the patient's mouth with it, and wash his mouth with it; and do not let any cause enter into his throat, and do not let him drink anything for an hour or more with his hand, for the blood-letting will soon cease when he drinks.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not stopped by what we have recommended, then subliminate the throat with camphor or asafetida using the instrument which we have recommended for sublimination of the ulcer.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that in whatever way it falls.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way of operating in sublimination of it: take a vessel in which are burning coals and the vessel should be covered with a cover on top of which there is a hole, and the end of the instrument should be placed in that hole; then apply the sublimation; and let the patient open his mouth over the end of the tube, and close his mouth so that the sublimation is not wasted until you know that the sublimation has reached the blood-letting, for the blood-letting will soon cease.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not cease, then repeat the sublimation several times, and let the patient abstain from drinking, and eat salt and alder wood, and do not drink water, and so by this regimen it will be stopped.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which blood-letting from the throat is extracted when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps except for having some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is applied to the throat, and its end is similar to a wooden beak of a stork, which is smooth, in which there is a cut with lime, so that when it grasps something, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the tongue in perception of ulcers and in section of them.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Ulcers are of various kinds, from various causes, according to which we remember them, each in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in penetration and section of them by two ways: one is by the nature of ulcers themselves; and by what we perceive from humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is by the places in which they occur, for the accidental ulcer on the head is different from the accidental ulcer on the heel; and the ulcer in a fleshy place is different from the ulcer in a joint; and each of them has its own treatment by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are also some ulcers which do not need to be penetrated, but rather require maturation of the pus in them or completion of them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And there are other ulcers which are not cut but rather have成熟(maturation) of the pus in them or completion of them. And there are also some ulcers which are near joints, for when there is an ulcer on a joint, its matter is prolonged to the parts around it, and very often the ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted, for this is the cause of contraction of that member; or it is near a main member, and if you delay penetration of it until it becomes mature, it will corrupt the main member; or it is near the anus, so penetrate it when it is not mature; and do not cut into a crux, unless there is complete digestion, but rather that which is near the anus, so that it does not corrupt the front of it and is prolonged to the parts around it, and there has been made a fistula, or that which is at the end of it and has not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	You should know when to pierce the pustule, and that time is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	You should know that it has matured when there is a decrease in pain and fever, as well as a decrease in redness and pulsation, and the head of the pustule becomes pointed, along with other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	You should also know that piercing should be done in the lowest part of the pustule and where pus is coming from the healing of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And piercing should always be done through the length of the skin or body, if the pustules are on the hands or feet, and in the places of the veins, nerves, and arteries; and in all places alike where there is no reflection; for in those where there is a reflection, use piercing according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the pustule is in a fleshy place, it is better to pierce it after digestion has been confirmed according to what we have said; for if you pierce it before that, the body of the pus and dirt are prolonged, as well as the lips of it being hardened and its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some pustules are pierced according to the width of the skin or body due to necessity, or according to that of which the member is in need.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer a small piercing for small pustules, a large and ample piercing for large pustules, or many piercings according to the diversity of the size of the pustules.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And there are others of pustules in which the membrane is hollowed out and cut, when it is done so that bread is made, as it happens with those on the scrotum and testicles.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And there are those that are cut with a section having three angles; and there is one that is cut in the shape of a leaf of bay laurel, as are the pustules on the elbows.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And there are those in which round and lunar sections are administered, and similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that which is not tipped as are superficial pustules, you should pierce it with a superficial piercing, or simply a flat one.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the pustule is large and has collected a lot of pus, you should pierce it and not be afraid to extract all the pus at that time; having extracted a part of it, then plug the pustule again on the next day, then extract a larger portion, and do this repeatedly until it is completely drained.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of a cold nature, or a woman in labor, or a small child, or an old person in decline; for the animal spirit is often resolved by the discharge of pus, and it rarely harms them, and you should operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore take great care with this chapter, and when you pierce these pustules, cleanse the wounds and consider if the wound of the pustule is small or a flat section, then you should administer the cauterizations of old wine or vinegar; but if the pustule is large and the fissures of the piercing are many, then you should place a plug in each crack as they appear.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if a part of the membrane is torn off or you have hollowed it out in the circuit, then you should complete it with old wine or a thread made of linen cloth, just as when you treat wounds or roots, without moisture; and strengthen it on the third day; and then process and cure it as you would any other wound.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if bleeding occurs at the time of your operation, then you should administer water mixed with vinegar and wine in which a linen cloth has been soaked, and place it over the site of the bleeding many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then you should administer regimens and curettages, and powders which I have recommended in other places of this book.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the winter time, and the site of the pustule is a place of many nerves, then you should soak cotton in wine and oil mixed with cauterizations, and apply them to those places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the sites are fleshy, then you should place cotton soaked in water and oil or wine and oil, and let it be for three days as we have said; then pierce the pustule, cleanse it, and administer whatever suits it according to what has been said until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary to know about the cure of pustules universally, but according to the way of distinction I have said before, so I have spoken particularly about each pustule in its own chapter.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of pustules that come in the membrane of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the membrane of the head there are small pustules, and they contain nodules which are formed from them; and their species are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them are blisters, and from those containing moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from those there are which contain moisture similar to ash, and also similar to them; and from those there are which are scaly and hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all of them, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, although you should be careful not to cut the arteries.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you express them with an instrument the form of which you will see below, the one which is called a probe, so that you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what is contained is moisture, then you should split it with a section according to its length by a superficial section in this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And you should begin the section from line .B to line .G; so that when the moisture is evacuated, then you should scrape off that in which the moisture was contained, and not leave any of it behind, for repeatedly returning, if there is any cause remaining.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse the wound in Egyptian ointment, if it is available, or else in water and salt; and fill it with that, and let it sit overnight, for by that you will corrode everything that remains of that membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply ointment to it again secondly and thirdly if it needs it, while you are confident that no cause of that membrane remains; then cure the wound with ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the pustule contains a nodule of fat, then you should split it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	by making a section having the shape of a cross, and cut the edges between the two lips of the section and scrape it entirely from every part, and use your strength in extracting the membrane which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if an artery causes a contradiction to you, then do what I have told you primarily.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the pustule which is lapidified by section and cure as I have said to you; and section on a lapidified pustule is pus-like, for it is of little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes some of these pustules are in the head in some people in whom there is not moisture at all; that cause is that they split one on the head of an old woman and plug up the pustule with a piece of hard, rough, white pebble, which could not be moved, and if anyone hit it, it bled.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other pustules which are accidental in the head, this is not that chapter; except for those which come on the heads of children and from the roots of the ears, but the section of all of them should be a superficial section.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make the incision at the lower end of them, so that the body is relieved from illness to its lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then cure these with what you consider appropriate for healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the cutting of scrofula which happens in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These bumps often appear on the neck, armpits and angles of the joints, and sometimes elsewhere in the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that happen in the neck are some that are engendered among them and all scrofula of these is within its own envelope, as we have already described, as well as with nodes and bumps on the head.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And there are different kinds of scrofula: some are hard, some contain moisture and some are malignant and resistant to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.
