Therefore in one where you see a good disposition in the touch, of which the color that is apparent approaches the color of the skin, and it is swollen to all parts, and is not annexed to the nerves of the neck, or to the veins, or to the arteries, and is not deep, you ought to cut into this with a superficial incision from above the body to below the line of 10 between the lines of GI and GB and scrape off all around it, and extend two lips of the skin with pincers or with small forceps if you have need of those, as we have said in the bumps on the head, and extract this little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more important that the vein or nerve not be cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And the spatula must not be sharp, so that you do not touch with it or hurt the patient, and you ought to cut only what is necessary to cut, for if you cut a vein or artery and stop your operation, then put on the wound vitriol in powder or other powders that stop blood flow, close the wound, and leave there that which causes the acuity of the bump to cease and the wound to soften and begin to be suppurative.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is abstained.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore return to your operation until you have finished it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your finger if there is any cause of the other small scrofula, therefore cut into those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if in the root of the large scrofula there is a vein, then you ought not to cut that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	And so that it falls by itself without harm, you ought to press this with a folded cloth and let it drop until it falls down of itself.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old wine in which you have already soaked Egyptian ointment and cure this.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut the scrofula entirely then you ought to press together the two lips of the wound and stop immediately any pus that has not run out.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is pus running out due to the size of the scrofula then you ought to understand cutting into its root and opening it up and administering cauterization and what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those of the scrofula which contain moisture, pierce this with a superficial incision where you see the site of maturation of it to be, and make an incision so that the pus runs out from the bottom of the body as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer an incision, apply a cautery and plasters to these that the suppuration is stopped.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound already cleaned, cure this with ointment of generative flesh until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the cutting of the pus of bumps in the gullet.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients wrote about this incision in the pilhot and I have not seen any person in our land who has had it done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their language.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men who have a constriction, if the extraction of the pilhot is avoided for fear that all the veins and the major nerves of the patient are there.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have bumps cauterized in the mouth or gullet or two ears, when the patient is not in the throat, then it is useful to do the incision of the pilhot to avoid the harm that happens by piercing.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore when we want this then let us cut the pilhot below three circles of the circles of the pilhot or four with small incision for the breadth in that which is between two circles for quantity, and the incision should be in pharynx not in the cartilage and that place is convenient to incision because it is deprived of flesh and the vessels of blood are there.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is fearful then let him extend the skin of the gullet with pincers and then split the skin so that it reaches the canal but avoid the vessels of blood if you see any cause for that.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the larynx according to what we have described, and it is indicated about the incision of the canal by the flame which is of that which has exited from that which is of him broken apart and by the piercing of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound remain open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore when the time is healed in which the piercing is feared, draw together two lips of the skin of the wound and split only that which is the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines which make flesh grow so that it may be healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Abucasis said that the sum of their language, the exposure is only that some of these bumps have been cauterized in the gullet of the patient and the patient has come to death and his throat is cut through and some go to cut the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe through the site of the wound by any breathing and he is saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for that they commanded to leave the wound open until the malice of the illness is consumed and the malice of it is for three days then afterwards he commanded to close the wound and cure this so that it may be healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And that which I have seen by my doctors is that it serves for a woman to press one breast and moisten it in the gullet of the patient and cut into there one part of the canal of the lung, and he was called to the cure of him and discovered the wound and found the blood which had run out from the wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore he confessed that this had not cut vein nor artery and the wound bled out from it and he cured this so that the fire was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And did not consent to the servant unless she had applied in the voice and then after some days he returned to the examination of his dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the incision of the pilhot there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the cutting on bumps which happen in the gullet outward and is called hernia of the gullet.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This hernia of the gullet is a great hernia according to the color of the body and it happens in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is according to two manners because either it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And the natural one is not difficult to cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental is according to two manners of which one is like nodal bumps and the other manner is like a hernia which is caused by piercing of an artery and in that one there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And do not let anyone touch him with an iron except for a small one.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you investigate him and if you find anything like a nodule of fat that is not suspended by any vein then you cut into it with something that contains the fat and pus; and if not then examine all of his body, and treat the area with something for healing until he is cured.
Capitol .xlv.	De le podrague e de los podraguers.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the gout and gouty nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many types of nodes, and I have already described them all in the division above.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And whoever wishes to know the difference between a node and an ulcer, let him ponder this.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	And I say that with an ulcer there is heat and fever and violent pains until the ebullition of the superfluous matter is stopped; and there is a completed putrefaction when the fever, pain and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But if there are pains and heat without it being necessary to call it gout then it should be cauterized in order to be cured.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body and the origin of it is like a cyst and it happens in this way with a vacuole, whether it is greater or smaller, and they are according to two species, either fatty or containing humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, as I described in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	And whoever, when he comes to the cure of a nodule, cuts it and probes it at the beginning with an instrument called an intromens, according to its form which will come in the chapter which is next.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the way of examining pustules and all nodes, and it is that you take this instrument and put it into the moist place which you find in the pustule, and turn your fingers with it little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then close your hand according to the size of the pustule and take out the instrument and consider what has come out through its orifice.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the humidity has drained away of whatever color it is then you cut into it superficially as I have said in other pustules.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no humidity coming out through the orifice of the instrument then you know it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry over it by cutting into it in the form of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	And you cut into it as I have taught you and suspend it by pins and excise the membrane from all sides with ease and keep the skin or sac over it and draw out that pus with the nodule.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation and it is not possible to draw out that pus then you take it away by pieces so that nothing remains within it that could cause its rupture again.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if something remains within it then the nodule will return according to the more or less.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that a small part remains within it then complete the poultice with some sharp and corrosive powders and strengthen the poultice and put it over where the pustule is cauterized and cure it with another cure until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large nodule then you split its two lips and cure it with that which it incarnates.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if there is no pulse or a weak pulse then you cut and fill the place with ground vitriol which is powdered and let it rest for two days or three until the poultice hardens, and then return to cutting what has broken of the nodule.
Capitol .xlvi.	De le podrague e de los podraguers.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	Of the gout and of the gouty nodes. Of the forms of the instruments necessary for cutting and piercing.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	And it is not necessary for anyone to touch him with an iron except for a small one. And there are three species of them, some of which are great and some medium and some small.
La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:	The form of the large intromens is this:
La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The form of the medium intromens is this:
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The form of the small intromens is this:
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	And let them be made of iron, of alfuld, of extreme tips cut decently, so that they are sharp for use in pustules.
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the forms of the experiments and one of them is called albered and another berid.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And they are of three species, some of which are great, medium and small.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	It is a great experiment, and it happens to him:
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	It is a great experiment, and it happens to him:
La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:	It is a small experiment, and it happens to him:
Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	These are caused by apoplexy, effusions, fistulas, and tumors, among other causes, and they occur between the bones and from other causes as well.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they make round, large, and pointed ones, with great needles with which the membranes are sewn, and they are made of copper, or of iron, or of silver, and the best ones are when they are made of copper.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	And they make the experiment with black feathers, which are used to open up the fistulas in the cavity where they are reflected, that they may be reflected by their lightness with those reflections.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	And they are of three types: some are long, others are small, and others are short, according to the amount of the width of the fistula and its constriction.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	The form of the great experiment with lead:
Forma del experient migier de plom:	The form of the small experiment with lead:
Forma del experient petit de plom:	The form of the small experiment with lead:
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	The forms of the hunchbacks are of many types, for some are simple, having only one curve, and they are of three types: large, small, and medium.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And their bodies are curved, and they are of three types.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And some are curved with two curvatures, and they are of three types.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And some have three curvatures, and they are of three types.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all of these are necessary in their place.

Forma de unci simple migier:	The form of a simple hunchback, small, is:
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	The form of a simple hunchback, small, is:
Forma de unci orp gran:	The form of a curved body, large, is:
Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	The form of a curved body, medium, is:
Forma de unci orp pauc, forma de lu:	The form of a curved body, small, is:
Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:	The form of a large hunchback with two curvatures is:
Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	The form of a medium hunchback with two curvatures is:
Forma de unci pauc havent dos curvaturas:	The form of a small hunchback with two curvatures is:

Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	The form of a medium hunchback with three curvatures is:

And these are the forms of the scalpel with which they are dried and cut, the nodes and the apoplexy, and they are of three types: large, medium, and small.
Forma de scapel gran:	The form of a large scalpel is:
Forma del scapel migier:	The form of a medium scalpel is:
Forma de scapel pauc:	The form of a small scalpel is:
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The ends of those with which the incision is made are sharp, and the other ends are not sharp, but it is done gently in the excising of the nodes to avoid the fear of cutting a vein or nerve, and for that one should cure the patient and return tranquility a little by the burning of which the excoriation of the apoplexy.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the forms of poultices, and they are of three types: large, medium, and small, with verities.

Forma de magda migier:	The form of a medium poultice is:
Forma de magda pauc:	The form of a small poultice is:
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made of wax and they are similar to a needle with which it is made alcohol.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And its end is pointed with a hollow point and in the other it is pointed to the sides, inside and out, whenever you want, also as needed.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The forms of the spatulas, which are hidden between the fingers due to the puncturing of the apoplexy and do not perceive the patients, and they are of three types: large, medium, and small.
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	And these are the forms of those:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The forms of syringes with which the flow of blood is stopped, and they are of three types: large, medium, and small; their forms are:
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made of citron wax, round with no length, and are thin.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And so that these types of syringes may be great, medium, and small, so that through them you may stop the flow of blood with swiftness in necessity, and also when at first there is no medicine.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to stop blood in any part of the body, and do not use them except in fleshy parts, just like the joints of the limbs, and of the hips, and of the elbows, and of the breasts and of the abdomen and armpits, and similar to the fleshy joints.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And some are made of those instruments also small, similar to the scours of phlegmon, through which blood is stopped when it is done by phlebotomy, or because of an incision of a vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And some are made round like this:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of the breasts of men which are resembling those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some men's breasts are inflated because of the accompaniment of sleep as they begin to be covered in skin, and also the breasts are inflated, and they resemble women's breasts, and Roman apoplexy, leeches.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And to that which you pour it in, see that you incise those with lunar section according to this form, from the line of B. into the line of G., and then excise the thickness entirely, and then fill the wound with medicated ointment, and then stitch together the two lips of the wound, and cure what is inside that is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast declines to the sides and is softened by its weight also like women's breasts, then cut it in two edges down, with two sections resembling a lunar figure, of which each one is contained in the other according to the end of the major line into the minor line according to this form from the line of B. into the line of G. And then excise the codicil which is between the two lips of the wound, and remove the pus, and administer what we have said about the suture and the powders that are necessary in the cure until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of that which see to be incised by the inquietude of the patient, and by the flow of blood, then see that you fill the wound with a cut piece of wood submerged in corrosive ointment, and let it lie there until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the puncturing of apoplexy that comes from below, the twitching.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	Apoplexy that comes from below, the twitching is of the species of scrophulas, tough, which contain a membrane that is dry.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And of those some contain moisture; and of those which contain moisture see that they are incised with lunar section according to this figure: from the line of G. into the line of B. And when it is all evacuated what is in the apoplexy of the phlegm, then you fill it with a cut piece of wood, and let it lie there during the day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then the cut is dried up and healed with appropriate ointment, until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the apoplexy of the species of the joints and of the scrophulas is, then you cut above that just as we have said in the section about the scrophulas engualment.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	If the wound is extended so that it causes bleeding, then administer cautery to him as we have already said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the cutting of abscesses that happen through an artery or a vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	And the signs by which you can tell that inflammation and abscess are caused by an artery or vein: and when an abscess is caused by an artery it occurs deep inside the body; and when you press on the abscess, if you feel a pulse in it, this indicates a stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is caused by a vein is round at the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And cutting into this abscess is dangerous, especially in those that are beneath the armpits, and in the angles, and on the neck, and in many other parts of the body; and it is very great, so it should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But if they are caused by inflammation of the opening of an artery, cut into the artery in the long axis; and once you have opened the artery with pincers, and have uncovered the tunics inside,
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then put an awl into it and force it to penetrate to the other side, and constrict the artery with a double thread in two places — which will cause you to tie it off in extraction of two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then plug up the place between the two ligaments with sputum so that all the blood in it is dried up and the abscess is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer treatment so that pus is produced inside it until the ligaments fall away, and then cure that with a suitable ointment until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess caused by cutting of a vein, then you must hold what is above the abscess with your hand as firmly as you can, and then thrust in the awl underneath that place which you are holding with your hand, and force it to penetrate; and let there be a double thread in it so that you extract it from the other side, and then tie off the abscess with a good ligament according to what I have told you before about the ligament of the grape in two parts with two ends of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will be extracted, then put in the awl underneath the whole abscess behind the first incision of the awl and constrict your double threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry up the abscess in its middle place so that when it has drained out what is inside it, you insert your instrument into the superfluity of the artery and leave behind what is tied to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place on it a powder which you have submerged in wine and oil, and then administer the treatment which is made with leeches and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 50: Of the abscess which happens from the twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as abscesses can happen in arteries and veins, so also can they happen in nerves when they happen from a blow or happen because of some other similar thing.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is most often done in the places of the auxiliaries or of the talus, or in any place where there are joints in the body.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a grave abscess and is the same colour as the rest of the body, and there are many veins in it, and when it is constricted with violence, the patient feels a stupor throughout his body.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess located in the cavity of the body, and therefore it is beneath the artery, and it is beaten at all parts and does not go to the parts in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	So it is not necessary for those which are in the joints to be cauterized with iron, because they will quickly develop a contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But that which is on the head or forehead, open the artery with sputum.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then cut it out with forceps and cut off its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if it is large, then suspend it with a hook and cut it out, and then put a patch over it; and stitch together the wound, and cure that until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the cutting of an abscess which happens in the jaw which happens in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Many people experience in their bellies and in other parts of their bodies a certain kind of abscesses which are called by a likeness to mushrooms because their roots are thin but the top is large; and they have twisted lips, and they are either small or very large.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I myself have seen one, and in his belly were two which were like mushroom-like, and there was no difference between them white, of very thin roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of these were turned inside out and torn, and moisture ran from it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	So I cut into them and found in one of them stones weighing 15 ounces. And the other 6 ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation at the incision of these is that you should consider whether the patient is moist, and if the colour of the wound is white, moist, of thin roots, then you cut into it with sputum lengthwise, and they will be cauterized in the fire, because many times blood is expelled from the incision; and if you see blood, cauterize that.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is timid and fearful, be careful not to cut into him with iron; but take some new lead wire and constrict that wound, in the manner which we have said before; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then tighten the lead wire in the constriction; so do not cease to constrict it with the large lead, until it is cut off and falls away by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the wound is of thick roots, then in its incision there is some cause for fear and horror, especially in that which is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you cut out the matrix of it, and then cauterize that so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then cure that until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to assume that you will cut out a wound which is of dusky colour, of little feeling, of regular guard, because that is an abscess.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I came by memory to the skull.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment of an abscess in the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Abscess in the navel is caused by many causes; or by fissures of the diaphragm which is above the belly, and from it the membrane or bowels slip inside according to other ruptures; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery as has been said before, or by constriction of the intestines.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is from a fissure of the diaphragm and a slip of the membrane, then the colour of the abscess is like that of the body; and there is little pain in it, and it appears in various places.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is from a rupture of the bowels, then its location according to what we have said before, with more violent diversity, and when you press that with your fingers, it is concealed, and then returns; and it is very large inside, and is magnified by the taking in of food and violent labour.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is from moisture, then it is easy to feel and is not concealed when you press with your hand, nor constricted, nor cut.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then with these signs the abscess will decline towards blackness.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is due to flesh, then the abscess is heavy, large and hard, and it is located according to a certain amount.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is due to windiness, then its touch is leonine.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you consider whether the prominence of the navel is due to arterial blood, or venous blood, or windiness; then you must abstain from the cure of it, for in that there is fear and dread as I instructed in the chapter where I discussed abscesses from arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to the intestine or hernia, then you must command the patient to hold his breath and be standing extended; and then sign with your hand around the entire navel, and then command him to breathe in towards your palm on his chest, and then circle with your finger around the navel over the area which you have marked with your hand; and then extend the majority of the abscess upwards with a large needle; and then bind around the area with strong thread or twine, and the manner of binding decent.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then open the middle of the extended abscess over the ligament and insert your finger into that opening and seek out the intestine; and if you have caught it or retained it by the ligament, then you extract it and push the intestine back inside the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have caught the hernia, then take that with a needle; and incise the excess of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then surround that mark, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put on them strong threads, and insert the two needles into the circuit which you have made around the abscess in a crosswise manner, so that they may penetrate; and then tighten the abscess in four places over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want, remove the needles and allow the extended flesh to fall back in and heal by itself; or incise what is sottile and will heal, and then cure that with water which is good for wounds.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to flesh in it or humidity, then you must hollow out the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or humidity which you find in it, and then cure that with water which covers it and consolidates the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53:
De curacio de cranc.	On the cure of a hernia.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, about the kind of hernia and in what way there is a path to its cure by medicines, and that it is different in it the cure by iron so that it not be ulcerated; and we have said about hernias engendered in the mother and caution in the cure of them.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that in some cases hernias are in a place where their eradication is possible, as with those in the breasts or the groin and their similar parts assigned to be extracted from, especially when they begin small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, you must not approach it, for I have not seen that any such one has healed from it nor that one has come to that.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on it when it is allocated as we have said, is that you precede and let the patient and purge from black bile in some cases, and then bleed that one if a manifest fullness is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with preparation in which he will be located for operation, and then prohibit in the wound hooked tools which go there; and then hollow out all parts with good cutting until no cause of the hernia remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow, and do not cut that loosely, and squeeze out the places, and wipe away all the clotted blood with your hand or with an instrument by which it is possible for you from among instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it causes contrary from clotted blood flowing from a vein or artery, then cauterize that one until the flow of blood is ceased, and then cure that with the other cure until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54:
De curacio de ydropici.	On the cure of hydropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended, in the division, about the kinds of hydropsy from water, and the signs of each kind, about the cure of it by medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that one which is cured by iron is only the kind of solitus, and it is not approached by iron to the kind of tympany or to the kind of hiposarca, for that one is deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this kind of hydropsy tympany with medicines and it does not respond to your medicine, then consider, for if the patient already has acquired debility, or is with another malady, another hydropsy, as if it is in him coughing or an ache in the belly and similar to those, then guard yourself that you do not treat him with iron, for fear is over that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient of healthy exuberance, and with him there is not another malady but hydropsy only, and not a child or old person, then the manner of the operation on him is that you elevate the patient between your palms, and then he will press his belly with his palm, pushing the water to the part below the navel, and then take spatha spiny according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It should have two acute parts long, with an acute extremity as spatha; but nevertheless it must be in him some shortness little by little, so that in the operation with it you do not pass into the intestine, and lead that one.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of hydropsy is from parts of the intestines, for then you must with the section lengthen the navel to the amount of three fingers to the parts below, in the right of him over the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydropsy is from malady of the liver, then your section must be left of the navel by three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of it is from the spleen, then your section must be in the right.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not let your section be over the side over which the patient wants to lie so that the excesses do not flow to that place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce with the instrument all of that one, and insert into that section, and elevate your palm with spatha between the navel and the diaphragm, and you squeeze that one; and if the amount of a fingernail or more.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the diaphragm until the spatha reaches the desired place, and it is a location of water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that one and insert an instrument of which this is the form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and is similar to a cannula of subtle silver; it is made of silver or of ram or of lion horn, and in the low end of it there is a small opening, and on its sides are three openings: two from one end and one from the other end; and its end is split according to the manner of a feather, as follows:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And in the superior end of it is a ring, for when the instrument reaches the water, then that one immediately comes off from the instrument, therefore it evacuates from the water in an immediate quantity, for if you evacuate from that one more than you should at once, strongly harm the patient by resolution of his animal spirit, or approach him to death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate from that one according to the quantity of his virtue and according to what signify to you the dispositions of the patient's pulse and of its goodness.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then remove the instrument and release the water which is causing the pain; it will be retained by the cord that binds the wound on the head, and you should pierce it in that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then return the instrument on the next day if the patient can tolerate it, and release a small amount of water each day for fear of errors, and be careful not to break the water except in small amounts.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you are afraid for the patient and release a great quantity of water, then treat it with a poultice in sand, move him to a bath, and expose him to the sun for a long time; and treat it with drying medicines until it is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize the stomach, and the wound and the vein from which the water is being released, according to what I have related before.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.

Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 57.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of children and the cure for those who are circumcised.

De extraccio de peyra.	Of stone extraction.

E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And I will now describe it with clear exposition and summary.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore I say that stone generated in the bladder mostly affects infants; and its signs are that the urine which exits from the bladder is like water in its thinness, and there is sand in it; and the patient rubs his urethra, and hurts many times, and then it is relieved; and with this there is a hole in the glans of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And its cure is easier for infants who have reached 14 years, and it is difficult to cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young, it is milder because of that which exists among them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And if the stone is larger and its cure is easier, then it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of that, let us first begin by cleansing the patient with an enema which extracts all the humors which are in his intestines; because that fathom sometimes prohibits the expulsion of stone through inquiry.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	Then let the patient stand on his feet and be pressed and squeezed from behind so that the stone descends to the bottom of the bladder, or that he jumps up in place.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	Then do this procedure between your hands, and let his arms be behind him, so that the bladder is completely bent downward.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	Then push it out entirely.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in that space, then you cut him immediately with incision on him.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if it does not come out with your touch at all, then put your left index finger into the urethra of an infant, or the middle finger of a young person who is complete, and insert that into his urethra.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	Then push out the stone so that it goes down your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	Then gradually push that into the bottom of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	Then press on that with your finger, and expel that out through the hole which you made with your incision.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the assistant to press the bladder with his hand; and command another assistant that with his right hand extends the scrotum upwards, and with his other hand squeeze the chord which is below the scrotum in the part where you made the incision.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then insert the probe bent into which this is the form of it:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and cut into him whatever is between the anus and the scrotum, not in the middle location, but towards the left side of the scrotum; and let the incision be made across, so that the opening be wide and the cut narrow according to the quantity by which the stone can exit to him, and not more, because you strongly press his finger which is in the anus from where the stone exits through the incision, and it is pushed out.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that there is some stone which has angles and margins, so that its exit from him is made difficult by that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that there is some like a glans, and it is round, and it makes easy exit.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is that to which there are angles and margins, then adjust in the crack.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not so hole-gotten, then let you push on that or squeeze it with decent gesture, the end of which be like file with which you squeeze on the stone, and do not loosen from him; or insert below him subtle instrument bent at the end.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot on that, then let you increase the cut a little, and if you see flow of blood, bind it tightly on that with vitriol.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the stone is more than one, then at the beginning push your hand to the mouth of the bladder, and then insert it; and then push a little, and do similarly if there are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, then it is ignorance that you insert that with great incision, because it happens to the patient two causes: or that he is slow or that there occurs to him continuous distillation of urine, because that place is not completely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	May they administer an expulsion from him while he is unconscious, or use forceps on the fracture to extract it in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, when you have completed your operation, fill the wound with aloe and dragon's blood, and bind it tightly.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place over that a cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in rosewater and water, so that the boil is reduced.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	Then return the patient to their back, and do not loosen the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when you have loosened it, wash the area with water and warm oil, and treat that place daily with ointment of diafenicon and ointment of diabasilicum until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound there is a boil, and it is hot and swollen, and it looks like the blood is congealed in the bladder, and because of this the urination is prohibited (and this is known as the exit of blood with urine), then cut into the wound and draw out that blood, for if the bladder is damaged it will cause decay in the bladder and the patient will rot.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then wash the wound with sour wine, water and salt, and apply any ointment that is suitable for it, until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	During the course of the treatment, you must wash both thighs and apply the medicines that are placed on the area.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and it is in the middle of the penis, and urination is prohibited, then treat that with what you learned before coming to this section; for many have been accused of causing gangrene through this treatment. And now I will explain it to you, and it is that you take an iron tool wrapped in felt, of which this is its shape:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	It has a pointed triangular end, inserted into the shaft.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	Then take some pitch, and apply it to the penis under the stone with a piece of wool, so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	Then insert the iron into the penis, piercing easily until the tool reaches the stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And turn the tool with your hand on that stone little by little, and you pierce it from the other side; for the urine is immediately expelled.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	Then press your hand over where the stone was broken off from the shaft of the penis, for that is closed, and it is blocked by urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this treatment is not prepared for any reason which prohibits it, then apply pitch under the stone, and another piece of pitch above the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	Then tighten around the stone in that shaft between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	Then pull it out.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	Then loosen the ligature and cleanse the congealed blood which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to have pitch under the stone, except so that it does not return to the bladder; and the other ligature above, except that when the pitch is loosened the exit of the stone is caused, the urethra returns to its place and the wound heals.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for that it is necessary when you tie the pitch above that you lift the urethra to the parts above, or that it returns after your treatment, and the wound heals in this way as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter .lxi.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the extraction of a stone from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in women is rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if you see a stone in any of them, then the treatment for it is difficult, and is prohibited by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is because the woman is very young.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is because you do not find a wise woman who discovers if the midwife told the truth when she was chaste, or it is of women who have been married.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is because you do not find a woman who is skilled in this art, especially the operation with the hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of the incision on a stone in women is distant from the place of the stone, because it causes deep gangrene, and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity compels you to do this, then take a woman midwife who is wise, and she is rarely found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that, then seek a midwife who is astute and subtle, or present a woman midwife who is experienced in the nature of women, or a woman who has given birth to children in this art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore let her present, and command her to do everything you instruct, from the inquiry into the stone at the beginning; the cause is that she guards whether the woman is chaste, then place your finger in her vulva and seek the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore if she finds it, seize that beneath your finger, and then command her to press on that.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not chaste, then command the midwife to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and seek the stone, for she places her left hand over the bladder, and seize that with a good grip.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore if she finds it, then gradually press that beneath the opening of the bladder to the parts below with the force of her hand until it comes to the root of the vagina.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	Then insert the tip of the instrument into the opening of the vagina beyond the root of the vagina from whatever side it is stopped at and hold the stone in that place; and the patient's finger should not be twisted by the stone, blocking it.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the incision should be small at the beginning; and then insert the knife over that incision, and if she feels the stone, then make another incision according to the amount she knows the stone is extended from there.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the species of stones are many; for some are small and great, sharp and smooth, long and round, and having horns.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore you know how many species there are according to what you intend to say about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see blood flow, bind it in the place with triturated vitriol and hold that for an hour until the blood is expelled, then return to your operation until the stone is extracted.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And prepare with you tools which are used in the extraction of stones in men, so that you are helped by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see blood flow and know that the expulsion of blood is from the urethra which is broken, then you place powder on the spot and tighten it with a bandage and do not loosen it; and let go of the stone and do not extract it, for certainly the patient will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	Then treat the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Then when the flow of blood is stopped and the place becomes quiet, then return to your operation until the stone is extracted.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter lxii.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On incision on a hernia that is acute.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia that is not except for the accumulation of moisture in the white fold which is beneath the diaphragm containing the bowels, and it is called diaphragm.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And some are in the proper membrane which naturally prepares in the part of the bowels, so that it is seen that there is another bowels; and it is the diaphragm between the white fold which we have said, and it is not that except for the skin.
