E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is through weakness which occurs to the bowels, for it is poured out to those bowels; and some occur due to pressure made on the bowels.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this moisture having various colours, for the colour of it either inclines towards citron-yellow or to blood-red, or red, or is black and fetid, or watery white, and that is what is most common.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which one can tell that this accumulation of water exists are these: for if it is in the white head which we have described, then the pustule is round, declining a little in length like a fig, and the genitals become visible, because the moisture contains them on all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the moisture is in the skin itself, then the pustule is round with a split in the middle and one assumes that it is another hole.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the skin of the genitals and the white head, then cut below the feeling.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And when you wish to know the colour of the moisture, then you probe the colour of the moisture in the pustule with a cautery of which the tip is made red-hot; and according to what comes out on the trail of the cautery, judge of what exists within it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore when we come to the cure of it with iron, then we command that the patient be made phlebotomized if this is possible for you, and see the body of him full.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And let him be reclined on his back on account of some cause a little higher, and place under him several folded cloths.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And let you sit on the left side of him, and command the assistant to stand on the right side of him, and let him extend his finger on one side to the area of the genitals and at the end of the navel.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And take a broad spatula and split the skin of the genitals in that middle place for the length between the two testicles.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And let the incision be made according to a straight line equally distant from the hairline which divides the hair of the genitals, arriving at the white head encompassing it.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And cut that, and observe it, and guard against it so that you do not cut yourself; and your incision with which you cut it by the hole let it be suspended by the most red and thin part and scrutinize carefully through the incision according to how much is possible for you.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And pierce the head full of water with a broad piercing, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And separate between the two lips of the incision with your nails, and extend the head upwards to the parts above; and do not touch the skin of the genitals encompassing it, and cut the head in that manner which is possible for you.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And cut it with its entirety or in pieces, and especially its side very thinly, for if you do not scrutinize the incision of it exquisite ly, there is not certainty that the water will not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the blood proceeds from that hole in the skin at the time of your operation, then when you have finished the incision of the head return it within, and let the two lips of the skin of the genitals be joined with a suture, and cure that just as the other wounds, until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the blood corrupted on account of another illness, then let the vessels which are sore on the suspender be tied, and extract the blood, and cure that just as we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is accumulated in two places, then know that there are two hernias; therefore cut that part just as you have done in the other similarly; and if it is seen to be one operation, then do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And you shall wash the wound and insert into the incisions wool dipped in oil or rose oil; and place outside another wool which you have dipped in wine and oil, and spread it over the two genitals and the navel; and place on top folded cloths and apply to them a poultice made according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	and let two cloths be pressed and filled with wool coloured according to this resemblance; and let the extremities by which it is pressed be made of linen or of dampened wool, and let them be tied with tightness around the waistband of the breeches, and one extremity press the anus into the two, and the second press at the end of the foreskin, and two extremities over two thighs and two other extremities on two angles, and all tightness be tied in the waistband of the breeches.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes this hernia is treated artificially by cauterisation instead of incision with iron; and it is that you take a thin cutlass and cut with it the skin of the genitals, and it is ignited according to what we have recommended until the white head containing the water is uncovered, and then you take cautery according to this form:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	and is arranged like Greek letters.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And pierce with that head, and it is ignited until all the moisture is driven out.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And extend the head with your nails, and cut it with hot cautery, and scrutinize it carefully until you have eradicated all of it; and guard against the blood not being touched by the fire.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And know that this operation is much safer and much further removed from bleeding of blood, and better than operation with incision.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if you find that cautery is applied in the hour of incision or in the hour of cautery, or bleeding of blood, then let you cure which contradiction it does to you according to what it is said by that cure.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the patient is fearful and does not expect the second operation on account of his horror, then administer piercing according to that which we have said, and it is when you are certain through the signs that we have said that the hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then let you raise the patient on some high support, then pierce the pustule in its lowest part with a broad spatula, and make the piercing according to the length of his body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And let the piercing be broad so that all the water is driven out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	And let the cut be tied and the poultice applied and left on so that it drives out the remainder of the water.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And cure that just as the poultice is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if contradiction is to the egress of the water in that hour you pierce that: and this is not done except because the white skin around the wound makes contradiction and prohibits the egress of the water, then let you put into the wound a pebble or instrument by which the water is extracted from the pustules, the shape of which is preceded; or tighten in the oppression of the wound a small pebble.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that the water returns and is retained for several months or around that time; and when it is accumulated, then let him be pierced according to that same manner mentioned, for the patient will thus pass his days.
Capitol .lxiii.	Chapter .lxxxiii.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of incision upon fleshy hernia and its cure.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in incision upon this hernia is lost fear for the greater dispositions; for it has seemed to me that there was discharge of it and saved by that better.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And you shall remember the operation in that and the spices of the pustules.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, we say that the pustules are born in the parts of which the genitals are composed and it is done by many causes: or by acute acute superfluity, which is poured out upon the genitals, or by percussion.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And its color follows that of the body, and there is no pain in it, and it is a hard pustule.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And soon after is the pustule lapidified, whose color is dark, and there is no feeling in it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes it is caused by a nodule in the arteries, and by inflammation of those through which the memory of pain is perceived, or by inflammation of the veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But that which is caused by inflammation of the arteries is known by the dispersion of the pustule when one presses it with his fingers; and it does not hurt if one touches it.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which is caused by inflammation of a vein is not dispersed by pressure with the fingers for any reason.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible that in this species section is performed and on the other meats; and you should insert the needle into the genitals, and stretch out the tissue above them, and extract that of the white head, and loosen the suspensory of the vessels, and tie them, and loosen the suspensory after you have extracted it from all parts of the head.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore, if the head is already consolidated with those meats, then it is necessary to extract the head and insert that.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is adhesion for some reason between the head and that which is between the vessels, then it is necessary to loosen all of that adhesion and insert it by a circular incision.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if there is meat growing in the place of the adhesion which is at the back, then it is necessary to insert all that is in it and extract the head as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when your operation is completed, then fill the wound with wool dipped in rose oil and wine; and then treat it with the other treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter .lxiv.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Of the treatment of hernia that is from the bowels.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	It is a pustule wrapped in some wrapper like a bud with moistening of the testicles, and it makes difficult movement exercise and walking for the patient.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the treatment of this disease, there is fear from that from which memory precedes.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, we should act according to what they do first.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	And he says that you should lift the patient up on a high bed; and then tighten the suspensory of the testicles at the lower parts; and insert the needle into the genitals with the fingers at the veins which are proven to be connected to the scrotum; and hold those others with your hand, and stretch them with violent extension.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And then insert the needle with a sharp, wide point through a transversal incision in the right of the vessels so that the vessels are uncovered.
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And then scrape off all the tissue as we have said in extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	And then insert a needle into those in which there is a double fold, and bind that in the first of the places in which the hernia occurs, and bind that other again in the last of them.
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	And then insert those in the middle place by a straight incision according to the length of the body, and extract that which is aggregated from the putrid and corrupt humors.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And then cure the wound with the treatment of other wounds in which you want sanative to be generated so that they fall the vessels which blackened one or both testicles, for that is not bad for it.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	But if the hernia occurs in all the vessels, then either extract the testicles or that the testicles are privated from their food by the incision of the vessels so that there is no benefit to them, or that they are withered because of it.
Capitol .lxv.	Chapter .lxv.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Of the cure of intestinal hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The occurrence of this hernia is from an incision that extends into the head over the belly from the parts of the angles of the navel of the belly so that the intestines are pushed out through that rupture in some intestines.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And this rupture is either of the head or from an incision there, and both species occur for many causes: either from a blow, or from saucing, or from crying, or from the elevation of some heavy cause, or from the like.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And the sign of this, when it is from an extension of the head, is that it occurs little by little over a long time and does not occur suddenly, and it is a hard pustule between the veil and the skin because the head compresses the intestine.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And the sign of it is when it is from an incision in the head, for at the beginning it causes violent pain suddenly; and there are divers appearances beneath the skin near the genitals, and that is from thrusting out of the intestine, and the body of it appears at the parts below the navel of the belly.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	And sometimes the membrane is thrust out with the intestine, and this hernia is called intestinal hernia of the bowels.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	And sometimes it is caused by windiness, and sometimes there is a fissure in the intestine, and here it is retained, and it is very harmful for the patient, and sometimes it causes bad pain and most when it is pressed.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the treatment of these species of this disease with iron there is fear, for it is necessary to avoid the cautery in that.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	And the manner of the operation for this is to command the patient to reduce the intestine with his hand at its parts inside its cavity if he obeys its returnment, and then have him bent over so that his chest is between your hands, and lift his legs.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	And then tighten the one which covers the genitals at its parts above, and insert the needle of the genitals all through its length; and then fix in two lips of the incision hooks according to how you open it with those.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if the incision according to the amount that for you is possible, then from that the head is pushed out.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	And then scrape those chaps which are beneath the genitals, so that the white head of the head is uncovered in all its parts.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then you insert your finger in that which covers the testicle, where there is between the white head and the head according to the second one, and release with that the adhesion which is behind the head.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And then hold with your hand the one which covers the genitals at its parts outside, and extend the white head in him with your left hand, and lift up the head with the head at the place of the incision; and command the servant to extend the intestine within you and you dissolve that adhesion behind with completed solucio.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And approach with your fingers so that there is no cause of the intestine being wrapped in the white head.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you press on it for any cause, then you insert that into the belly below.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then take a needle in which there is a large fold made of x fields, and insert that behind the head where there are four fields, and then compress all of them over any figure in the shape of a cross; and bind with that the head from which we have said that it is beneath the genitals with strong binding of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then wrap the ends of the fields and bind those with violent binding so that some of the vessels which blackened them cannot transmit any cause from here so that from there no hernia occurs.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And let there be another wound made according to the first wound, long by three fingers; and these two wounds leave out of the scrotum which is below the testicles the quantity of the size of a finger, and incise all the rest according to roundness, and tie it up.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then incise in the part below the scrotum by section, of which blood and pus will flow out just as we have commanded in what we have said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer wool submerged in oil and place it on the wound; and administer the bandage which we have commanded (and some times the scrotum is cauterized, which we have said near the incision of it they fear from a flow of blood, for many times this happens) and let the bandage fall within so that by itself it may drop.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the healing of it is delayed, then let there be applied warm water, and place it over that within which falls according to what we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the wound with the other healing of wounds until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter 66:
De hernia ventosa.	Of the hernial hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia I have not seen anyone who has been burned on the cure of it with iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first said that it is done thus as we have commanded in the hernia which is with wine; which is that you tie the vessels near the section over that with ease of it; and then dry up the middle place around the abscess with that which caused it, while the vessels fall.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And heal the wound according to what we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter 67:
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the disruption which is made in the angles.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes there is a rupture in the angles as we have said and the place protrudes.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And the genitalia should not be any cause of the intestines to the genitalia; and if they are, that is few; and return to it in all hours.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time of that is prolonged, a fissure is made in the scrotum from which the intestine descends into the scrotum; and this happens by the extension of the scrotum which is in the angles as we have said, the cause being that the scrotum is stretched, and then it softens and the place is abscessed and protrudes.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the cure of it is with cauterization thus as is preceded by the narration of it.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured with iron thus: and the patient hangs over his head between your hands, and then dries up the place of the rupture of the abscesses protrude by section to the breadth according to the quantity of three fingers.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then strengthen the white scrotum which is below the scrotum so that it is uncovered.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the thread and place it over the prominent place of the scrotum, and press it to the pressure of the belly.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then sew together the two prominent places on the end of the thread of the scrotum and join them with each other.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then pull out the end of the thread and do not incise of the scrotum at all, nor extend the heat, nor other cause just as you will know in the cure of intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then heal that with the healing of wounds and when you have incised the testicles, cleanse it and restore the wound so that it is consolidated; for the scrotum is contracted and the eminence of the rupture is not adjusted.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cauterization is better in this place because it is closer to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68:
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of the softening of the scrotum of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many times the scrotum of the testicles in some men is softened because the flesh that is between it is softened and the guarding of it is lost.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Therefore it is necessary that he who is practiced in the cure of it makes the patient lie according to his head and incise all the scrotum which is softened over the natural scrotum, and then sew two lips together.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you wish, cut off in the beginning the superfluity of the softened scrotum with three or four cuts and with firm suturing.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And then incise between the sutures, and then heal by the healing of the other wounds until it is healed and the testicles fall down.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69:
De castracio.	Of castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration in our law is excommunicated, but for the cause it is read to me that I remember it in this book; and the remembrance of it is not necessary except by two ways, of which one is that it be in the science of the doctor when he is questioned about it, so that he knows the cure of it from which happens; and the other way is that we many times have had the necessity of castration of other beasts for our young ones because of them, just as of horses, and of oxen, and of pigs, and of beasts similar to the beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: or by tearing, or by incision to section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is done by tearing, the way of the operation is that we cause the beast to lie in warm water so that its testicles are softened and hang down and that they are cut off.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take them with your hand so that they are resolved and do not appear underneath the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by incision and section, see that you have the beast and press the scrotum of its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then ligate the suspensory ligament, and incise over each eye with one section so that two eyes are processed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then incise those which you will have bled.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not cause over those of the scrotum any cause except the subtle scrotum which is over the veins.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this way of castration is better which is done by tearing because tearing leaves no cause of the testicles so that the beast desires coitus.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then heal the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter 70:
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	Of the cure of hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men is according to two ways: one is when or appears the space between the scrotum of the testicles, in that which is between two testicles figure that clitoris of woman in which there are hairs.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes from it urine the one which is in the scrotum of the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	But in women it is one species: and it is that the clitoris of woman over the penis is like two testicles of man a little bit of all and foreskin of man and two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is of three species: of two of men and of one species of women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is that see that you incise those tightened flesh so that the impression of it flow out, and then heal those with the healing of the other wounds.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second species of men of which it flows urine which is in the scrotum of the testicles there is no cure or operation in it.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 71:
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Of hernia and of prominent flesh by causes of women.
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	Strong hernia is tightened over natural causes so that it is stressed and made tight the guarding, and sometimes it is enlarged in some women so that it is split just as in men and pierces during coitus.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	And then you who have the superfluity of linen with your hand or with a cloth and insert it.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	And do not finish the incision, especially in the root of the vein, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	Then cure with ointment the wounds inside until they are healed.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	Meat born from the orifice of the mother's womb and filling it, and quickly exit outside according to the appearance of a tail (and therefore some call this "tailed disease"); therefore we should cut in such a way as we do with linen, and cure it inside until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter 72:
De curacio de alratica.	On the cure of an inguinal hernia.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	A hernia is when the vagina of a woman is not perforated or the hole is small.
E es o natural o accidental.	It can be natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	An accidental hernia is caused by gout which preceded it, and it is made either by a membrane that is too tight or by a thin or hard cyst.
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	And it happens either in the opening of the mother's womb, or in her ribs, or in the upper part of her belly, or in the lower part, and it prohibits coitus and pregnancy, and strongly prohibits menstruation.
E la cognicio de aquela es fayta per reguardament de la metrona, si la oppilacio es apparent, propdana; mays si no es apparent, lahoras tu cerqua aquela am les tieus ditz o am le ray.	And the knowledge of it is gained by observation of the midwife, if the pregnancy is apparent, it is a premature delivery; but if not apparent, then you examine it with your fingers or with your hand.
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	But if the pregnancy is by a thin cyst and it is close to both labia, then you cut and rupture it.
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	And you place on both labia some powder, and you place your fingers indicating in both hands.
E la femna sia sobre le sieu dos, las sieuas coyssas extendudas, e aprop exten las doas labias am forsa entro que aquel ciphac subtil sia romput e la oppilacio sia uberta.	And the woman should be on her back, with her thighs stretched out, and you stretch both labia with force so that the thin cyst is broken and the pregnancy is opened.
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	And then take wool and dip it in oil and place it on the wound, and let him go for a walk during the day so that the cut is not healed closed.
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	But if the cyst is large and thick, then you should cut it with a spatule or with a blade of myrrh.
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	But if the pregnancy is by membrane, then suspend it with oil and cut it.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	And you should have the medicines that stop bleeding without biting, such as aconite, dragon's blood, and gum arabic, adjusted with egg white of an eagle owl.
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	And then administer a wide lead cane so that the wound is not closed too quickly.
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	And hold it for several days and administer cold water.
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	And then it should be cured with the other cure of consolidation until it is healed.
E alcunas vetz accideys en la mayre nativitat de autres carns, e lahoras cove que inscidas segon aquesta manieyra.	And sometimes accidents happen in the mother's birth of other meats, and then you should cut according to this manner.
Mays si aysso es per apostema crancos, a l’apostema crancos le qual es en la mayre no sia fayta contrarietat am ferr en deguna manieyra.	But if it is by a crust, then there should be no contradiction to the crust with iron in any way.
Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter 73:
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	On the cure of hemorrhoids, and of tail, and of red botch that happens in the vagina of women.
Emorroydas so apprecio dels orificis de motas venas entro que de aquelas corro mot sanc continuadament; e cum so antiquadas emorroydas e son fayts theyls.	Hemorrhoids are an appearance of openings of many veins from which flow much blood continuously; and when they are old hemorrhoids and are swollen.
E ja yeu he dit en la divisio las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e diyre ayssi aquelas que recebo curacio e aquelas que no recebo curacio.	And I have already said in the division of these their kinds and their signs, and say thus those that receive cure and those that do not receive cure.
Donc dic que emorroydas e theyls quan so en le preon de la mayre e no apparo al sentiment, lahoras en aquelas no sia fayta curacio am ferr.	Therefore I say that hemorrhoids and theyls when they are in the opening of the mother's womb and do not appear in sensation, then in those there should be no cure with iron.
Mays aquelas las quals so en le orrifici de la mayre sobre las quals catz sentiment, so aquelas que so curadas.	But those which are in the opening of the mother's womb over which there is sensation, these are the ones that are cured.
E cove que tu metas la femna en mayso frega e aprop exten atheyl am les forfexs, o am drap aspre, e inscideys aquelas am las razitz.	And you should put the woman in a bath and stretch them with tweezers or with rough cloth, and cut them with blades.
E aprop pulveriza sobre aquelas deves le fluxs del sanc de una de las polveras insciscivas ses mordicacio, ayssi cum acassia e semblant ad aquels.	And then sprinkle over them the flow of blood of one of the powdery medicines without biting, thus with aconite and similar to these.
E aprop enpellesca les sieus pes per una hora, e aprop pausa aquela en aygua freja.	And then let her walk for an hour, and then place her in cold water.
E si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras fay aquela sezer en decoccio de sumat e de scorsas de milgranas e de gualas e de semblantz.	And if the flow of blood persists, then do it again with a poultice made of sumac and husks of pomegranates and walnut shells and similar.
E aprop pren farina de ordi e comfiys aquela am miel e vi agre e fay emplastre am aquo sobre le dos de lu.	And then take flour of wheat and cook it in a bath with honey and sour wine and make a poultice with this over its back.
E si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, fay adherir am dos ventozas, e a las mamilhas ses escarificatio.	And if the blood is dried up, it is good; and if not, do the sticking with two leeches, and to the nipples its escarification.
E aprop pren lana e submergeys aquela am suc de coliandre o am suc de arnagloza o am suc de guarravier am vi pentit e fay adherir al loc; e aprop cura le loc am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then take wool and soak it in juice of colander or in juice of wild basil or in juice of wild garlic with red wine and place it on the wound; and then cure the wound with ointments until it is healed.
Mays athyl rog le qual es de aspre reguardament, cove que tu inscidas aquo que a tu appar de aquel segon que he dit en theyl engualment.	But hard tail which is of rough guard, you should cut it according to what appears to you from that according to what I have said in its opening.
E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxiv.	Chapter 74:
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	On the accidental piercing of the eardrum in the mother's womb.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Many kinds of crusts happen in the mother's womb, thus with crust and crusty ulcer and suppuration and red botch and fistula and hemorrhoids and rattle and tail and other crusts.
E yeu ja he dit aquestas malautias e las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e las curacios de lor en la divisio.	And I have already said these diseases and their kinds and their signs, and their cures in the division.
E cove que yeu digua en aquest tractat de apostema caut le qual ve en la mayre quan es dels apostemas que collegeysso sania, e si vols saber en qual manieyra se fa la opperacio de lu am ferr.	And you should know in this treatment of crust cauterization which appears in the mother's womb when it is of the crusts that are connected to the blood vessels, and if you want to know in what manner its cauterization is done with iron.
Adonc cove que tu consideres si la dolor de la apostema en le sieu comensament es aguda am percussio e flecma e febre, e vezes aquel enrogezir e si catz sobre aquel le sentiment, lahoras no·t coytes am perforacio de lu, e cura aquel am aquo que ajuda sobre la maturacio entro que cesse la acuitat dels accidentz.	Therefore you should consider if the pain of the crust in its origin is acute with percussion and phlegm and fever, and it throbbs and there is sensation over it, then do not cauterize it, and cure it with that which helps over the maturity until the acuteness of the accidents cease.
E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	And then you should make the woman to lie on her back over a board that has two boards; and recline on its back and adjust her feet at the bottom of the belly, and let her thighs be spread out, and place her arms under her ears, and lie each one on what is convenient.
E aprop la matrona segua del latz dreyt e aministre le instrument am le qual es ubert le orrifici de la mayre, la forma del qual vindra en aquelas causas que·s faran aprop.	And then the midwife should hold the instrument straight and administer it to open the opening of the mother's womb, the form of which will come into those causes that are fitting.
E cove quan vols ministrar aquest instrument que tu fiques am lo ray le preon de la mayre de la femna, e aquo que del instrument es intrat en la mayre no sia mays que·l preon de la mayre e leda le malaute.	And when you want to administer this instrument, you should dip it in the water of the mother's womb, and that which is entered into the mother's womb is not more than the opening of the mother's womb and lead the patient.
Mays si l’estrument es major que·l preon de la mayre, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils sobre la textura del preon de la mayre per sso que sia prohibit l’intrament de tot instrument en le preon de la mayre.	But if the instrument is larger than the opening of the mother's womb, then you should place powder over the texture of the opening of the mother's womb so that there is prohibited entry of any instrument into the opening of the mother's womb.
E cove que tu pauses le vertitge que corr en le strument del latz pus desus e que le ministre tengua le strument e revolva le vertitge entro que sia ubert le orrifici de la mayre.	And you should place the water that runs in the instrument of the womb above, and let the midwife hold the instrument and rotate the water inside so that it is opened the opening of the mother's womb.
E cum appar la excitura, e es tocada am la ma e es leon e molh, lahoras cove que tu secces aquela deves le cap de lu am spatum lat.	And when there appears the effusion and it is touched by the hand and is cold and moist, then you should dry it with a spatule.
E cum la sania es evacuada, lahoras cove que tu pauses en la plagua una meca submersa en oli rozat o oli vert en le qual sia alcuna stiptisitat; e pausa la calca7 en la seccio en le preon de la mayre.	And when the blood is drained, then you should apply to the wound a sponge soaked in rose oil or green oil with some styptic in it; and place the bandage on the incision over the vein of the arm.
E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	And place wool, clean and soaked in water with malva flowers, outside the arm and over the elbow.
E aprop sia curada aprop dos dias am enguent le qual conveneys ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then it should be healed within two days by applying a ointment suitable for this purpose.
E alcunas veguadas es lavada la mayre e la plagua enayssi que es cristerisat am aygua e mel, e aprop am aygua en la qual es bulhida razit de liri o de aristologia longua, e aprop retorna al enguent.	And sometimes the arm and wound are washed with water in which is dissolved honey, and then with water in which is ground rhubarb or long pepper, and then return to the ointment.
E si la plagua es dedintz en la mayre ameguada, lahoras cove que tu sias prohibit de la curacio de lu am ferr, habantz cura aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio.	And if the wound is inside the arm which has been cut, then you should abstain from treating it with iron, but treat that one as we have said in the previous section.
Capitol .lxxv.	Chapter 75:
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To instruct midwives on how to treat stillborn children, when their shape is not natural.
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	It is necessary that the midwife recognize in the beginning the shape of a natural childbirth by its signs, and it is when you see the woman expressing her breasts, and desiring to breathe the air, and feeling relaxed over what is above her, and hastening the birth of the child, then you know that this position is according to a natural shape, and it is the delivery of it over their head, and the second one with it suspended or hanging from the umbilical cord.
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	Therefore, when you see those signs, then the belly should be compressed so that the embryo descends gently, and when it is over their head, they deliver the second one, and the placenta is removed with a good cleansing.
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu .i., o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	But when this childbirth is not natural and laudable, because the child is born on its feet, and their body comes out before their head and their feet, or when one of their hands or feet is born first, or when their head and hand are born, or when the belly is delivered first, and very soon it is returned to their neck, and resembling one of these non-laudable shapes.
Don necessaria causa es a la matrona que sia savia e subtil en totas aquelas causas, e que·s guarde de error e de decepcio.	It is necessary that the midwife be wise and subtle in all those causes, and guard against error and deception.
E yeu so mostrant tota figura de aquelas, e qual engen es en aquelas per so que sia significat per aquo e sia stat sobre aquo.	And I will show you all the figures of them, and what cunning is in them so that it may be understood by this and be established upon it.
Quan le feyt es eyssit sobre le sieu cap per egrecio natural, e aquel es vehement sobre la femna e es fayt a lu part dificil, e vezes la vertut de lu ja debelitada, lahoras fay aquela sezer , o que las femnas tenguan lu, e evapora le conh de lu am fenugrec coyt e am olis humitz.	When the child is born over their head through natural exertion, and it is violent on the woman and a difficult delivery for them, and you see the strength of her already weakened, then make that incision, or if the women are holding onto it, evaporate their grip with fenugreek powder and with oiled rags.
E aprop entrometa la metrona entre les sieus ditz espatum petit e fenda am aquel la segondina, o secce aquela am la sua ungla entro que corro aquo que es en ela de humiditat.	And the midwife should insert her finger between their teeth gently and push with it the second one, or dry it up with her fingernail in between so that she removes what is inside it of moisture.
E preme le ventre de la femna entro que deyssenda le fet.	And press the woman's belly so that the child goes down.
Mays si no deyssen, lahoras cove que la femna sia cristirizada de mucellage de ptilli e mucellage de fenugrec am cizami.	But if it does not come out, then the woman should be anointed with a mixture of styrax and fenugreek with honey.
E aprop comanda a lu, aprop le cristeri, que sia compremuda e fay aquela stornudar am condisi; e te la boca de lu e·l nas de lu per huna hora, quar le fet sira foro-getat tantost.	And the midwife, who is anointing it, should compress and make that sneeze with seasoning; and hold their mouth and nose for an hour, because the child will be forced out immediately.
E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	And if both of the child' hands are born first at the beginning, then you should draw them back little by little gently.
Mays si no obezeys al intrament, lahoras pausa la femna sobre una cezelha e leva les pes de lu sus, e aprop concuceys la cezelha sobre la terra; e la femna sia tenguda que no caia deves la concussio.	But if she does not obey the instrument, then place the woman on a plank and raise their feet up, and the plank should be tilted towards the ground; and the woman should be held so that she does not fall from the tilt.
E si las mas no son dedintz tornadas e morr le fet, lahoras inscideys aquelas e extratz le romament del fet o lia le cors a la ma de lu am drap e extratz aquel am equalitat, quar aquel sira foro-getat.	And if the hands are not turned inside out and the child is stillborn, then insert those and pull the child's arm or tie the body to their hand with a cloth and pull it equally, because that will be forced out.
De eyssiment del embrio sobre les sieus pes.	Of delivery of the embryo on their feet.
Quan le fet yeys sobre les sieus pes, lahoras cove que tu impelliscas aquels en sus, e aprop convertas le fet petit, e aprop que engualhes aquel, e aprop que prenguas un pe de lu e extendas aquels petit a petit.	When the child is born on their feet, then you should push those up, and the child will turn little by little, and when you have taken one of their feet, extend those little by little.
Mays cum son eyssit entro a las coyssas, lahoras tu comanda a lu que se exprema, e fay aquela extornudar am condizi, quar sira foro-getat si Deus lo vol.	But when it is born between their thighs, then you command them to push out, and make that sneeze with seasoning, because it will be forced out if God wills it.
E si no es foro-getat am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras tu retorna le fet petit a petit entro que pauses aquel segon figura natural, quar aquel sira lahoras foro-getat am leugier eyssiment.	And if it is not forced out with what we have recommended, then return the child little by little to where they should be according to the natural shape, because it will be forced out later with easier delivery.
E si es prohibit am tot aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras pren de musellage de altea e de goma dissolvuda, e percuteys tot en le mortier per bona percussio, e aprop linieys am aquo le conh de la femna, el pus bas del ventre de lu.	And if it is prohibited by all that we have recommended, then take of a mixture of aloe and dissolved gum, and beat them both in the mortar with good beating, and line with that the inside of the woman' vagina, the lowest part of the belly.
E aprop fay aquela cezer en aygua tebeza, entro que consegua les ypocondias.	And then make her sweat in lukewarm water, so that she gets rid of phlegm.
E cum vezes que las partidas dejos de lu so lenificadas, lahoras fay a lu subfumiguacio de mirta e sub-pausa aquela a lu.	And when you see that the breasts are softened, then make fumigation of myrrh and apply to it what is below.
E quan te la sub-fumiguacio per una hora, lahoras tu la fay sezer sobre una cezelha, e aprop fay aquela stornudar e extrenh la boca de lu, e levas de aquela, e prem la partida pus bassa del ventre de lu am leugiera compressio, quar le fet sira tantost foro-getat.	And when you have made fumigation for an hour, then make her sneeze on a plank, and then make that sneeze and open the mouth of it, and lift up from there, and press the lowest part of the belly gently, because the child will be forced out immediately.
Eyssiment del fet sobre les sieus denols e las suas mas.	Delivery of the child on their hands and feet.
Quan le fet eyssira segon aquesta forma, lahoras tu engenies en entrometen las suas mas petit a petit; e aprop la femna stia evessada sobre le sieu col, e les pes de lu pengo en jos, e aquelas sia jasent sobre le lieyt, e complegua las suas mas.	When the child is born in this shape, then you should insert their hands little by little; and the woman will be bent over, and their feet pointing down, and those will be resting on the bed, and close their hands.
E aprop prem sobre le ventre de lu petit a petit, e aprop extratz aquo que es dejos les pes de lu de las aurelhas entro que sia preparada en la partida pus dejos.	And then press on the belly little by little, and pull what is below their feet from the armpits so that it is prepared in the lowest part.
E si le fet no es fora-getat, lahoras pren les pes de lu e mau aquels am movement vehement, e aprop prem aquo que es sobre les ypocondres petit a petit entro que le fet puege a las partidas desus.	And if the child is not forced out, then take their feet and hold them with violent movement, and then press what is above the armpits little by little so that the child can come to the parts above.
E aprop entrometa las suas mas e engualhe le fet petit a petit, e comanda a la femna que se exprema entro que le fet sia foro-getat.	And then insert their hands and turn the child little by little, and command the woman to push out so that the child is forced out.
Eyssiment del fet latutidinalment pendent una de las suas mas.	Delivery of the child hanging from one of their hands.
Sia engeniat en reduccio de la ma de lu, mays si no podes aquela reduzir, lahoras eleva la femna e fe aquela anar.	It should be understood as reduction of the hand, but if you cannot reduce it, then lift the woman and make her bend.
E si anar no pot, lahoras fay la jazer sobre le lieyt, e concuteys las coyssas de lu am concussio vehement, e aprop aministra liamentz les quals yeu e recomtatz de mucillages.	And if she cannot bend, then make her lie on the bed, and press their thighs with violent pressing, and administer to them what they have been prescribed of mucilages.
E si es vengut le enfantament, lahoras fay aquela sezer sobre cezelha, e aprop studia sobre la reduccio de la ma, e enguala le fet segon figura natural, e fay stornudar la femna e comanda a lu que comprema a si entro que sia foro-getat.	And if the delivery has come, then make her sneeze on the plank, and then study on reduction of the hand, and turn the child according to the natural shape, and make the woman sneeze and command them to push so that it is forced out.
Eyssiment del fet sobre·l col expandudas las suas mas e la fassia de lu es al dos de la sua mayre.	Delivery of the child on their neck with their arms and belly expanded towards their mother's back.
Cove que la matrona tengua la ma del fet e aprop revolva aquel petit a petit, e eque aquel am facilitat.	It should be that the midwife holds the hand of the child and then turns it little by little, and it will be with ease.
E cum es e quant so es engualhat, e lahoras pausa sobre le conh de lu aquo que havem recomtat de oli e de mucellages.	And when it is out and the umbilical cord is cut, then apply to it what we have recommended of oil and mucilages.
E aprop comandas a lu que·s maugua petit a petit, e quan auras feyt aquo, lahoras fay aquela cezer sobre una cezelha e comanda li que sia inclinada sobre le latz dreyt, e aprop comanda a lu que sia compremuda; e fay aquela stornudar am condizi.	And then command the mother to suckle it little by little, and when she has done that, then make her sneeze on a plank and command them to be tilted to the right side, and then command them to compress it; and make that sneeze with seasoning.
Exitus foetus praeparati super latus.	The preparation of the fetus is placed on its side.
Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	When you see that the mother is giving birth according to this manner, consider and then insert your finger inside so that the humidity is evacuated.
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	And if the child is suspended above its face and neck, then insert that of the umbilical cord, so that it is not retained and dies.
E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	Then pull the child to its limbs inside so that you pause that according to what covers it, and command the woman to compress herself in several places, and let it be extracted easily if God wills it.
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	The exit of twins or multiple fetuses.
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	Know that twins are often born in many places, and sometimes three or four, but this is strange and rare; but there are several causes of nature, and not life.
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And count those, that they may be multiplied, a second one, and are separated by the umbilical cord, distinguish those within the ligament in the umbilical of each of them. And sometimes they are extracted like a single fetus with a natural easy delivery, and sometimes some are delivered with an un-laudable delivery as we have mentioned above.
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	And if they are difficult to deliver and reach that which we have said about the unnatural shapes, then you cure those as we have related.
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	And if the midwife acts sutilly and does that which she does with facilitaion and subtlety, and delay, and is ingenious according to every shape according to how it is prepared in her womb leading to health.
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	The remembrance of that which forms in the matrix from embryos and abortions.
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	Sometimes they are formed in the womb one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and up to ten, and I have indeed seen a woman miscarry six times, while another had ten, all formed, due to the wise men measuring them out.
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	And all that is hidden from that which is in the science of the midwife how powerful she goes to that small one resembling it and therefore pause over there.
Capitol .lxxvi.	Chapter .lxxvi.
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	Of the extraction of the child when it is dead.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When you cure the dead child with that which we have said in the division of medicine and is not extracted out, and you are forced to use cauterization with your hand, then consider if the woman is of healthy nature and does not have any of the accidents by which over her there is feared loss.
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Then let the woman be laid down on her back, and her head be inclined downward and her thighs elevated.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the attendant hold that of two parts or be laid in bed so that the body of it does not extend due to the extraction of the fetus.
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	And then you moisten the mouth of the mother with oiled water and with mucilage of alder and fenugreek and of linseed.
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	And then the midwife apply her hand with those oils and mucilage, and then insert her hand with facilitation in the mother, and then surround with her hand the place where the claws are in the fetus.
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	And convenient places in that: then consider if the fetus is prepared to descend over its head, and then insert the claws in the hollows of it, or in the neck, or in the mouth, or on the palate, or below the beard, or in the armpit of it, or in the close places of the ribs, or below the hypochondrium.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	But if the descent is over its feet, then in the instep, or in the middle of the ribs.
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	And let it have the claw with its right hand, and pause the curvature of it in that place which is between the fingers of the left hand, and insert the hand with facilitation and insert the claw in some of those places which we have mentioned, until it reaches the desired cause.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	And then pause and place in the opposition of it another claw, or the third if necessary, so that there is an attraction together, and not an extension according to its rectitude only.
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	And let the hand be bent in every part, so that the extraction of it is separated as it is done in teeth due to its removal.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	And let that in it which is between them that the extension be softened; and if any part of it is retained, then let the midwife anoint some of its fingers with oil and insert those expertment and revolve that which is retained.
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	Therefore if the part of the fetus is extracted, then the claws be moved into the place which is most out; and do this so that all the fetus is extracted.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	But if the hand is extracted in front of the other and it is not possible to reduce that by the contraction of it, then let cloth be wrapped around that; and then extract that until all is extracted, and insert that or in the joint of the hand or in the elbow.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	And do the same with the other hand and with the two feet.
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	But if the head of the fetus is large, or it happens to it contraction in the extraction, or there is water in its head tightly attached, then let the midwife insert between the fingers spatula with thorns and split the head and extract the water, or uncover that with an instrument which is named “alundat”, the shape of which will come with the shapes of other instruments in the chapter which is next to this.
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	And do likewise if the fetus is of a large head by nature: and then insert that with compression, or grasp it with forceps as we have said above; and then extract the bones with forceps.
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	And if the head is extracted and is contracted due to the armpit, then let it be split so that the humidity which is in its feet is poured out.
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	But if it is not complicated or resistant to extraction, then you insert the head as much as possible to you.
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	And if the abdomen is swollen or there is water in it, then let you pierce that so that the humidity that is in it runs out.
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	But if the fetus is over its feet, then the attraction of it is easier and the direction of it to the mouth of the mother is easier.
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	But if it is contracted due to the abdomen and feet, then let you extract that with cloth which you have wrapped around your hand and split the abdomen and feet so that that which is in them runs out.
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	But if the other members stand out and turn the head, then let the midwife insert the left hand; but if the mouth of the mother is opened, then insert the hand in the pubis, and surround with that the head, and draw it with those fingers into the mouth of the mother, and then insert into it a claw or two claws, and draw it with those.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	And if the mouth of the mother is contracted by an ulcer which happens to the u, then let it not be pressed upon it; rather let there be administered a diffusion of causes of moist heat.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And administer poultices; and follow the patient with waters which soften and moisten.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	And if the fetus is on its side, then if possible it should be turned over; and let that which we have said about the living fetus be administered.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	If this is not possible, then it should be cut into pieces and extracted.
