E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And whoever leaves any cause inside the second stomach,
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	And when you have completed all your operations, then administer what we have said about the cure of ulcers caused by cold humors.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if there is bleeding, let it flow into astringent waters and administer the other cure.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I have seen a woman whose belly was pregnant with a dead fetus; and on that fire another fire was lit, and the dead child fell out.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happened to her that for a long time an ulcer developed on her navel; and when the fire opened, she began to spit up fire.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called to cure him, and I treated him for a long time, but the plague did not heal.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	Then I placed on him some plaster with strong attraction, and a bone came out of him, and after a few days another bone; and I was very amazed because there were bones in his belly.
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then I thought that they were the bones of the dead fetus.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	Then I opened the wound and pulled out many bones; the woman was in the same condition for a long time and had a small fire coming out of her.
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And I did not fear anything strange, but only that in this there is science and help to what the doctor does with his hand for curing.
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	Of the forms of instruments which are necessary to extract the fetus.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	Form of the incision by which the uterus is opened:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of the string with which the ligaments are tied, with a knot at each end of two threads.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	But this thread must be very thin and made of linen or cotton.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And the thickness of each rod is two fingers and the margin on both sides is one finger, and the length of each is half a palm; and in the middle of the two rods are two fastenings of that same rod, whose length is about half a palm and their thickness is about two fingers.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two attachments are inserted into the mouth of the uterus so that when you turn those two threads, it opens.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Other form resembling that one but thinner and longer:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	It is made of linen or cotton according to the likeness of a pair of tongs.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	But at the end of it are two attachments like a pair of pliers; and the length of those attachments is about half a palm, and the thickness of each is two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And when you want to open the uterus with those, then let the woman lie on her back, opening that which is between her thighs.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	And open your hand with the instrument as you do with tongs, according to how much of the mouth of the uterus the midwife wants to do what you want.
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The form of incision which the ancients said:
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	Form of incision by which the fetus is pushed out:
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	Form of incision by which the large head is contained:
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	And it is like tongs whose ends are in the extreme, and some times it is made long like tongs, whose ends are like a pair of pliers, with which it is cut and contained.
Forma de amesidat pauc:	Form of incision few:
Forma de unci havent una spina:	Form of an inch having a spine:
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	Form of an inch having two spines:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	Form of tongs whose ends close, by which the head of the fetus is contained:
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	Form of spatula having two extremities by which the head is cut:
Forma de dos espatums latz:	Form of two wide spatulas:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All those instruments are practiced, and when they are more refined and prepared by the artisans, then it is easier for the operator and better for men because of its quantity.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And if there are not any instruments, then you must prepare them, for the need of them is inexcusable.
De extraccio de la segondina.	Of extraction of the secundine.
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the secundine is retained after childbirth, then let the midwife retain her own milk, and then let her vomit with herbs, and strengthen your hand over the mouth and nose of it, and if through that it is expelled, good.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then take a woolen cloth and pierce it in the covering with a hole, and put into that herbs which open the mouth of the uterus, like hellebore and rue and anise and camomile and scachola arabica and cassia lignea and santal wood.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All those herbs or some of them are to be soaked in water in the cloth, and then let that hang over the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And then place a hollow reed in the mouth of the uterus, and hold it so that the vapor goes to the cavity of the uterus.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And then let her vomit as we have said, and the secundine will be expelled very quickly.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if this cure is applied and the secundine is not expelled, then let the midwife soak her left hand in sesame oil or in mallow milk, and then insert that into the uterus and seek out the secundine with it, and when it has been found, pull it out little by little according to its length so that the uterus does not receive violent force.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	Before let it be turned right and left with ease.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And then let the uterus be reduced in amount of tension, for it will obey and be released from adhesion.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mouth of the uterus is constricted, we have already recommended the cure with a syringe and herbs soaked in water.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	But if it is not expelled with all the causes we have recommended, then beware that you do not tire on it with too much force, but rather let what comes out of the mouth of the uterus flow to the woman's thigh, and then strengthen that with ointment and tetrafarmacon; for it will make it boil in a few days and be dissolved and expelled.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But when it boils, there is a bad smell to the head and stomach, and then let the medicines be administered according to that.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	But some of the Ancients have already tried sub-fuming with hellebore and dry figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	Form of an instrument by which the woman is sub-smoked because of the retention of menstruation and secundine:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It is made of brass or iron.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And the end be made thin in the cavity and the end wide over the fire, and the sub-fuming be done over the embers of the fire.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And hold that so that the sub-fuming is consumed and alternate it with another.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	Of cure of the child's anus not perforated.
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Infants who are not yet weaned and whose anuses are not perforated, for whom the tongue is very thin and swollen.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	And then let the midwife pierce with her finger that swelling; and if not, pierce it with a sharp spatula, and beware that it does not touch the tendon.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	And then apply wool soaked in wine and oil over that area; and let that wound heal naturally.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you fear it has become infected, then insert a cannula into the wound for several days and leave it in place until the patient feels the urge to urinate.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And it sometimes happens that the anus becomes obstructed by a blood clot or abscess; then when this obstruction has been removed, let it be treated with the medicine and lead plaster as we have said above.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	Regarding the treatment of fistulas which develop subsequently:
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	Fistulas which occur near the anus and produce pus and a thick discharge are found near the anus or in the space between the buttocks.
E es una fistula o motas.	There is either one fistula or several.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when this nodule becomes old and discharges thick, white or yellow pus, sometimes these fistulas penetrate deep into the body.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And those that penetrate are known by what comes out of them through the exit and by their flatulence; and sometimes the patient suffers from an exit, and often worms come out of them.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And sometimes these fistulas penetrate into the bladder and into the vagina; and sometimes they penetrate into the joint of the thigh and into the knee.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And the way to know whether a fistula has penetrated into the anus or not is to put your finger into the anus and try to gently push a needle or piece of iron into the fistula when there is no pain.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if it hurts when you do this, then gently push in a needle or a piece of lead or horsehair until you feel the needle or hair against your finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you don't feel anything at all and there is no discharge of pus or worms or flatulence as we have said, then know that it has not penetrated, and then proceed with the treatment.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula has penetrated into the bladder or vagina, then the sign of this is the discharge of urine from it and the prohibition of this from that, so that the wound is allowed to heal.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it has penetrated into the joint of the thigh or into the bone and causes pain in that area, then the sign is that when you push a needle into it, there is no pain in the bone, but pain in the circuit of the joint; and that pus comes out of it occasionally; and that this is not helped by medicine nor healed by ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all these penetrating fistulas, there is no cure at all, and their treatment is a laborious and vain task for foolish doctors who talk about it.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in the one that is not penetrating and not ancient, healing with iron is expected according to what I have told you and what has already happened.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And it is that the patient should lie on his back with his head elevated and his legs raised up against him, with his thighs bent towards his stomach, and then gently push a needle or piece of iron into the fistula until you feel where the needle goes in.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if he feels pain around his neck, then gently put your finger into his neck.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel the needle going in by itself without pain, or you feel something soft under your finger, then know for certain that it is penetrating; so do not work on this, because there is no healing in this as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	But some say that it is healed in some people with vinegar.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And the medicine by which this is expected to heal quickly is that you apply a gentle cautery according to the size of the fistula, as it was preceded, and insert that hot iron into the fistula until it comes out around the neck; then repeat this two or three times until you know for sure that all those flesh-colored, fistula-like tissues which resemble a feather cane have been dried up.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	Then cure that with water wrapped in wool until all those dried-up tissues are healed, and then cure it with medicines that generate and consolidate flesh, and if it is healed, well; but if not, then it will never be healed by any other treatment.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the needle goes in and doesn't penetrate your finger which is in the anus, and between that and the needle there is a hard, flesh-like substance or swelling, and you see the fistula where it breaks through the surface of the skin, then dry up the skin from the beginning of the fistula, and you will see that it dries up as the needle goes in and out at the place where the tip of the needle comes out; and so the flesh is freed and cut.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	Then cleanse those flesh-like tissues which are similar to a goose feather cane, from which nothing comes out.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if blood flows out of it when you press on those tissues, then the millstone that is and the pus that comes out should be cauterized with fire or sharp medicine, for cautery with fire dries up those flesh-like tissues and stops the flow of blood by drying up the humors.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	Then cure that with water wrapped in wool or in clean linen until the spot turns black, and then cure the wound with a hard ointment that generates and consolidates tough flesh.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And so are medicines which have astringency and drying power; when it is restored, it is healed and you need not fear relapse.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula has already broken through into the perineum and is prolonged from there across the surface of the body, then put your finger in the anus and examine it.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And so if you feel the needle and between you and it there is a hard substance or flesh, and it is close to penetration, then it is not an operation on it but according to the way of trust and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	This can be done in one of three ways: by cauterizing it as we have said; by drying it up so that you can make the opening in the anus smaller and the cure more effective; or by not cutting into the rectum so that you do not pierce the membrane containing the rectum, but let the patient go about his business naturally; then cure him with what we have said for the wound will surely heal quickly; or by prolonging the swelling and draining out the pus which has accumulated under the skin as we have said, or with a needle or another sharp instrument, then cleanse those flesh-like tissues which are in the incision near where you can pierce it with pressure; then force open the wound so that the entire wound is healed, and if the fistula which breaks through into the anus has not been consolidated, and the pus drains out of the anus, and the patient suffers from a discharge, let him be cured with what we have said.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula ends like this: when you insert the needle into the fistula, it is on the side of the anus around the surface of the body with the skin and at the margin of the anus, then take a needle of piercing extremity which is prepared in the shape of a needle as follows:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert it into that with its wrapper or around it; and then insert the needle into the fistula until you reach the opening in him.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it has penetrated into the margin of the anus near inside, then pull out the needle from that hole as you put your finger in the anus; and when you have pulled out the end of the needle, press both ends together, and tie them together for a day or two, and when you have also inserted the needle into the flesh, press it until those flesh-like tissues are pressed in between the two ends of the needle which are tied together.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then treat the wound until it is healed and closed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate in any way you have prepared, unless there is motion in the wound, for it is not up to you to do so as not to injure the skin; and then treat it until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the spathe is spiny where the fistula is split: its curvature is very acute and the other side is not acute, so as not to injure anything that is not necessary, as well as the skin.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	On the stitching of hemorrhoids in which blood runs in the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are of two types, for some are between the anus like charcoal, or others that are like fat with hair.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And those are small and large, and the blood runs from them constantly and is one, and some are inside, and outside the anus, and at its ends.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But those that are outside the anus are according to the months of little humidity, of which yellow water or a little blood runs with a continuous body, and they are according to the color of the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment of that which is inside the anus is that you command the patient to sit and be compressed until the anus dries and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you cut and suspend them with your nails or what you have those by your fingernail, and then cut those according to their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	But if the nails are not held in those by their moisture and softening of them, then take those with rough cloth or a stick or woolen thread, and extract those with your fingers, and then cut those and powder some powders over them near the incision so that they are like cautery; or cauterize those according to what is preceded in the chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then treat those with the other treatment until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey defecation, then anoint the patient with ointment in which there is a little biting, and let him be washed with that water that is in the anus and let him be compressed gently when he excretes.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then the cause of them is slight, and it is that you take those with your nail or that you take them with a stick and cut those, and then treat those as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And whoever does the incision, keep in mind that you administer suturing of them according to this way: take wax wrapped and insert that into a needle and then extract the hemorrhoids at their tops, and make the needle penetrate with the other part of the wax into the root of the other part, and wrap both ends of the wax in the part lower than the needle and tightly; and narrow the hemorrhoid with a strong compression, and tie off the wax and extract the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do that to all, and leave one and not sew it, so that the excess of blood runs from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then place over the anus cloth soaked in rose oil or cerate; and place that on the anus and command the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it until it scabs; and when it is healed, treat those with ointment or other treatment until they are healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	Of the treatment of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many times they happen due to dryness of the wound or due to constriction by nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And if they are old and not healed with that medicine, then you should cut those with the point of a spathe or your nail until they become moist and let the scabs be above, which prevents them from healing; and then treat those until they are healed.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you wound them more violently than the first time so that blood flows and they become excoriated; and then treat those until they are healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	Of the treatment of ulcers, it is a key.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that an ulcer, it is a key, and it is not unless there is a round spot according to the color of the body resembling a head of a nail, and it occurs all over the body and mainly in the parts below the feet and on the fingers, and from there you should have pain.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then let it be cut what is in the circuit of the nail, and let it be held with forceps or a stick, and let it be uprooted from its root; and then treat that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you want, cauterize the second as is preceded in its own chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	But a wart is a small, rough, round, fistulated eminence on the surface of the body, and many times it comes in the hands of children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And its treatment is that you stretch and cut it, or narrow it with wax or hair so that it falls off.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you want, cauterize it as we have said, with fire or acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And they are uprooted forward and backward with the instrument which I will tell you.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	But a mole is a small, felted or fistulated eminence on the surface of the body, which occurs around the anus, and when it is rubbed, it is centered in it like a bite of an ant, and it is made all over the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And its treatment is that you take a reed of peacock feather or of bird of prey, and let it be strong, and place it on the mole so that it contains the circle of the reed from the parts around it; and then turn your hand with the reed so that you cut what is in the circuit of the mole, and let him narrow the mole at its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, do it with an eraser or iron according to this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	Let the part above the reed be drawn out to thinness, soft (so that it is not perforated), wrapped so that over the finger the appearance of it is abraded and the revolution of it.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you want to cauterize the mole according to what is said before in the cauterization of atoms in the chapter on cautery.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	Of the form of the instruments that are administered to give cautery.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Some are made of silver or brass or melted lead or hammered, and some are made from those instruments small and large according to the ones that are administered, for that which is administered in the treatment of small children is small; and of those whose anuses are sore or painful, their cauteries are small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of a large and few cautery:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The tip of the reed above in which the pouch is tied be wide according to this way; and let the distinction where the pouch is tied as well, thus many times.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the tip below it, which is inserted into the anus, be soft  (so that it is not open), drawing out to thinness; and in one side of it there are two slits, and in the other side a slit, and let the width of the slit according to the thickness of the veins and more thick a little.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	Let there be a bag in which are placed the medicines of animal bladder or sheep's wool, and its size should be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And let it be pierced with small holes as it is rolled up; and if the space between the threads, make it the thickness of the said finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those threads strong gall of raw gall which is of the galls; and apply with that bag to it; and when the bag is applied to it, let it be tightly bound at the top of the chest between two fingers with a strong constriction, and then cauterize each thread with it: But the quality of cauterizing with it is that you fill the bag with medicine, which should be warmed according to the amount of the patient's tolerance; and beware that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient should be reclined on his back, and his legs raised up and place under them a board on which there are men or a plank; and then anoint the end of the cautery with oil or egg white or mucilage of fenugreek or similar; and then insert that into the anus with ease, and the minister should squeeze the bag and press with two fingers and empty with force into the intestine everything that is in the chest; and then pull out the cautery and let the patient raise his legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces that to come out, let it as much as possible; and if it sleeps with that for a whole night, it is better for healing.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you cauterize that in the illnesses of a swollen belly and its output is bloody, then repeat the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the anus there are hemorrhoids or painful sores, then let the cautery be very subtle and thin, of those cauteries with which children are cauterized.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of treatment of sores:
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already said in the division of the treatment of sores what was convenient for the book, and I say thus the treatment of those with hand and medicines according to their kind.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that sores are varied according to that by which the sores were made and according to the place on which they occurred.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which many times sores are made are thus with stone, or incision of a sword or dagger, or blow from a spear, or staff, or arrow, or similar to those of many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the sores that are in parts of the body are thus with sore which falls on the head, or neck, or feet, or belly, or thigh, and similar to those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I have recounted the treatment of some sores so that you pause on that reasoning and rule for other sores.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple sores of the head, because the recollection of the composite ones will come to the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when it happens in the head a simple sore and there is no fracture, then consider: if it is by blow of stone or similar, and the nerve has only slightly been struck and it is a large wound and you fear on that patient development of an ulcer, cauterize and flebotomize the cephalic vein immediately, and do not delay that; and draw from that blood according to the amount of the strength of him if there is no other prohibiting cause of phlebotomy, especially if the blood which comes out of the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let the phlebotomy be on the opposite side from the wounded part; and keep the patient from repletion and from wine and heavy foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if any cause of diminishment prohibits you, then let it be diminished in food and not come near to meat nor wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And apply over the wound, if it happens on him ulceration, cut garlic infusing it in rose oil or wine in which it is made stiff.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if he is certain of ulceration, then apply over the wound, if it is fresh with its blood and the air has not changed that powder which I will soon recount below.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then apply some ointment until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large or it is from incision of sword or similar, and its lips are not brought together by pus, then bring those together with suture according to that which I will recount about their suture.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound is already uncovered of bone and pen, and there is no retention in it except for a little suspension, then insert into that and treat the wound with medicines and restore the flesh by applying on the nerve, and command the patient to abstain from foods in which there is heaviness: garlic and leeks and similar to them, until he is healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you see in the nerve putrefaction and it does not adhere to the bone, then insert all that rotten thing and cut it out, and treat that.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these sores there is an artery or vein from which blood might flow and it has not been stopped by medicines, then press on the artery; and if you find that not-incised, then insert into it with spatum or ligature; and if necessity compels you that what we have said does not suffice, then cauterize until the blood is stopped.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these sores are simple and small, then the cause of them is a wound; therefore you powder over those this powder, because it solidifies that before the air changes those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of unripe dates one part, blood of dragon tree two parts, gum not-extinguished three parts; let all be pounded and sifted, and of that let the wound be filled up, and let it be bound with good constriction so that it adheres to that, and let the blood coagulate.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then bind that above with powders and let it be licked by the tongue, and do not loosen it while it is thus until it is ulcerated, because the medicine does not work for it to be healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes you make that alone with cautery when there is no dragon tree at hand or its blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And you make this operation on large sores when it seems that it should be applied to them and they are bound up, and they are recent wounds with their blood which the air has not changed.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has changed them, and especially when it is in summer time, then there is no need for the position of this powder, but then treat those with what we have said, therefore you apply over those some ointments that are digested, or you apply over those poultices made of flour of the seed of wheat with water and honey until they are soft; and then treat those with the other treatment until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if it happens with a wound of fracture in bone, and it is small, then you draw that out with a probe.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will say the treatment for fractures of the head where it is pierced.
De las plaguas del col.	Of sores in the neck:
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound happens in the neck, then there is no difference in treatment, and it is between the wounds of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves of the neck are cut or an artery, then if it is nerve let it not be bound tightly with anything that makes vehement strictness, as with cinchona and cinchona-tree which is verjuice and similar to them because they hurt the nerves and contract that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not put any pressure on the plague at all, because the substance of the nerves is fragile and its continuation goes to the brain, which is the source of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is healed by light medicines, such as when the wound is washed with warm water, or when there is an infusion of red or white oil, and when it is washed with warm water and the other stones are applied according to this manner, then let it be moistened.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the plague is large, then administer a suture or a bandage, and let it be cured with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if there is a depth or an abscess in the lowest part of the pus, then pierce it in the most depressed location.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if an artery is cut in the plague and bleeding ensues, then ligate or coagulate it, or cauterize it if need demands it.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the vertebrae of the neck or all of it is cut, and the veins of the throat are spared, then you adjust the wound of the neck with a suture over the cane of the neck and do not touch it; before doing this, equalize that and reduce it to its natural figure, and then tightly bind it with a decent bandage; let it be treated with ointments in which there is stiffness and excitation until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the bone has been fractured, then pierce it and extract all of the fragments that you can; let what is not apparent heal within, and separate it and the efflux from it be alleviated.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the plague is recent, then powder it with a powder for which you have been prescribed.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if a fistula is formed in the plague, then cure it with that which its recollection will come to you in due time.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the plagues of the neck or similar, when they are done between the shoulders and are done with a spear or lance or similar:
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a blow from a lance or spear, and you see the depth of it, then consider that if there is windiness from the wound, then know that the plague is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if there is no depth to it and the plague is recent with its blood, then you put on a powder for the first hour and do not bind it so that the blood is not retained in the depth of it and that it returns to the heart and the patient is saved; instead, put on an attractive ointment twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the ointment is not available to you, then put on the orifice of the plague a piece of wool so that it sucks up what there is of humidity; and let the patient sleep on the plague so that what is in it flows out.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed and no spasms or tremors of the heart nor mal-stricture occur to him, and you see the other dispositions as good, then know that the plague is saved; then cure it with cauterization and with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if its healing is delayed and the wound stays open for a long time, then know that a fistula has been done; cure it therefore according to its chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the plague is done by a spear or lance and is simple on the surface of the foot or leg, then cure it with that which is preceded by a suture if it is large, or powder if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if the bone has been fractured and there are only a few fragments in it, then you twist the wound and cut to extract those fragments, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then let them be until the plague is healed, for their extraction is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other plagues of accidents in the other members the cure is the same as that which we have said before.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of plagues of the belly:
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disposition by which it happens in the belly is either great or small or middling.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great, some times there is intrusion of the intestine or nerve of the intestine, for which it is done and the suture of them is more vehement and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is done difficultly in another way, and you see that the reduction of them is more difficult if you do not cut off the intrusion of them to their place at once, for it opens and is swollen because the insertion of it is made difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is middling, for in it the reduction of the intestine is not difficult, as it is difficult in both species mentioned before.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that the suture of the belly is according to four manners, but two sutures are common which are used in sutures of the other plagues of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other sutures are proper to the other plagues, but indeed more proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I will count for you each one with exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the plague is small and some cause of the intestine comes out through it, and it is made difficult to reduce it, then it is in one of two manners: or by smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when there is inflation of the intestine by the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when that is so, then you must warm it so that you soak a sponge or cloth in tepid water only by itself, or boil in squinant water, and cyperum, and spic, and embrocations with it the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it does this in the thing which has been made stiff, and it is better than water only in resolution of the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see the inflammation resolved, then you moisten the intestine with water in which is mixed honey and mallows, for it eases the insertion of it with a little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the insertion of it is excused by this cure, then split the disruption a little with an instrument by which the hemorrhoids are split.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the primary cure is better when it is proper and not dry, and there is no occupation to dry near necessity and defalimentation.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, know its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it is crooked acute, and the other part not-acute, and its extremity subtle, and may not be with the subtlety of a spatula, but rather obtuse a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the plague is enlarged and goes out of the intestine, then you must make its reduction according to the form of it natural, in its proper place, if it is possible, for it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is ample and it is in the lower part of the belly, then let the patient lie on his back, and put his feet above; and if it is in the upper part, then let him lie on his stomach and raise his head and feet.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And likewise if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then pay your attention and your consideration equally on both sides so that the part in which there is the plague be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus you must administer this in great plagues and middling plagues.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small wounds, apply what you have prepared, and ensure that the surgeon is between your thighs, holding the wound with his hand and closing its lips, and uncover from one to another any cause of the wound, or other.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common manner of suturing: you take the needle, or count of needles according to the quantity of the amplitude of the wound; and leave from the extremity of the disruption of the ring finger, and tighten the needle one, other that you put thread in both ends of the cord, with both ends of the thong which is below the cord of the parts within, so that you make it penetrate from that part; and you have already tied both ends of the cord and two ends of the thong, and there are four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then tighten with double thread around the needle, and some times from two parts together, and then tie both lips and the wound by decent tying; and leave the thickness of the finger, and take another needle in that, and tie that with thread as is tied with the first needle; and do not cease to do this if it is necessary with needles until you have completed all the contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be between thickness and thinness, because thin needles easily pierce the flesh; and thick ones are difficult to enter into the cord, and therefore that they may be easier in subtlety and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it should not be that the needle is tied in two ends of the cord near to each other, because the flesh would be pierced easily and the wound would open before its healing.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And they should not be prolonged so that the wound is not prohibited from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then pierce the ends of the needles so that they do not hurt the patient while sleeping; and you shall put over the sutures powdered herbs spread from all parts, which have the ends of the needles; and leave them until you know that the wound is healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these species of suturing with needles in whatever manner are more convenient for small wounds, because they have in their suturing one needle or two or around them.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second suturing is common: and it is that you administer suturing with the four ends, of the cord and two ends of the thong, in one go, with a needle in which thread is wrapped equal in thinness and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when with the needle you have penetrated these four ends, reduce the needle from that meting part from which you started, so that the thread drawn box of the uppermost part to the wound, so that the suturing is according to suturing of cloth with which the cloths are tied tightly.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And put between each suturing the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suturing is known to men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with such suturing I healed the wound which was inflicted on a man in his belly, and it was wounded with a dagger, and the rupture of the wound was more than a palm, and it had come out from the intestines around two palms from the intestine of the middle place, and it was the disruption in the middle of the member; and then I reduced it after the intestine had been pierced by the wound for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was healed in the space of fifteen days or around, and he recovered and is well; and then he lived for many years, and is in his dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle it was healed, because I did not cure him with ointment, but put on the wound cut wine twice a day and frequent washing with honey water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will say two kinds of suturing proper according to the account of the Word.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you start with suturing of the cord, and interlace needle from the outside part to the inside part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And so when the needle penetrates in the cord and in that part within according to straightness and in length of all the body, leave the end of the thong in which you have interlaced the needle; and make the needle penetrate in the other end from the inside part to the outside in the other end of the finger.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And when you have done that penetration, then do it another time in that meting end of the finger from the outside part to the inside; and leave the end of the thong which is in this side, and make the needle penetrate in the other end of the inside part to the outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make the needle penetrate with which you are making it penetrate in the thong in the end of the finger which is in the part of him so that all that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then start from that meting side and sew it with the end which is of the thong in the other side, and pull out the needle of the cord which penetrates, and then reduce it to that cord and sew the end of the thong which is in the other side with this end of the finger; and pull out it of the cord which is on the part of him.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do that once and another time, and do it one time after the other so that you sew all that is outside according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suturing is that you sew with suturing of hides with which hide is sewn, so that you sew the thong one time from the end of the cord, and leave it another time so that you have completed it.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second proper species which I say is the command of him and for him recomposed, is that you sew it according to semilitude with which all medicines are sewn, so that the ends of him are joined to each other in convenient nature; and apply the end of another of him and the end of the finger to the other end of him, and that is done according as I have recomposed it.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Because you put the needle in the end of the finger at your side from the outside part, and make it penetrate to the inside in that sole, and leave two ends of the thong; and then turn the needle and make it penetrate from the outside to the inside in two ends of the thong.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then turn those ones, and make some of the inside part penetrate to the outside in two ends of the finger which are in the contrary side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suturing is better than common suturing, and it is suturing of which prior memory precedes.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the command of Gualia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And then they said some one, the suturing of the belly is straightened with two needles, so that you interlace in these ones a thread, and start with penetration of needle from what is on you, and make it penetrate within to the other side according to suturing of those whom hide is sewn equally.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when rupture is in the middle place of the belly, then the suturing of it is more difficult than in other places of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of medicine of wound is judgment of other wounds.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	The which cause is that when you know the wound recent with its blood before that air alters it, and reduce the intestine and sew it and adapt it decently, then put over it powdery incarnative.
