E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the wound, then apply some alum to that area so that it makes a hard stone and traps the bile, and let it solidify and heal; and treat it as you would any other wound until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines with you, then apply it immediately as soon as the wound starts to discharge pus, and change the poultice twice a day, morning and evening, as I have taught you, until it is healed, for you need no other treatment in various conditions when wounds are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the wound might spread to the main limbs, then soak lamb's wool in warm oil of good quality, or rose oil, and apply it around the areas between the angles and below the ankles.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if he feels pain or putrefaction in his intestines, where many times it happens, then anoint that with black styptic vinegar, especially if the putrefaction is in the intestine and there is an open wound inside its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that a wound in the large intestine has a slower healing process than one in the small intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the intestine called "gut" does not receive healing from a wound that occurs in it at all; and this is due to the great multitude of veins that are in it, and because of its size compared to those, and because of the subtlety of that organ, and because of its proximity to nerve nature.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what proceeds from the wound is the intestine, and you manage to get it out, return that according to your skill by which you reduce the intestines with equal measure.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has passed into space and is already green or black, then that you strengthen that with bile on the spot where it has turned black, so that a flow of blood comes out, for there are veins and arteries in the tissue.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Then insert what is the other end of that intestine, and apply two ends of the bile hanging from the opening below the wound, so that on your side is relieved the attraction of it due to the cutting of the tissue and the emission of pus from the wound.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Remembrance of wounds when they happen in the intestine.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When disruption happens in the intestine and it is small, then it is possible that it be restored in some people; thus I saw a man who had been wounded in his belly with a spear thrust, and the wound was on the right side of the stomach, and the wound was old and had become a fistula, and he vomited and belched.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then I followed his treatment so that he was not confident in his healing, but continued to apply it gently until it was healed and the spot consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I saw the spot already consolidated, and I directed that he eat on top of it foods suitable for him who had suffered an injury in his belly; and he did not suffer from any ill effects and remained in good health eating and drinking, and he bathed and exercised his limbs.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced people have said that when a wound occurs in the intestine and it is small, then it should be bound according to this manner: you take the leaves of large pods; and then close both lips of the wound and place one of those leaves whose mouth is open over both lips of the wound; then when he takes hold of those and tightens his mouth, cut off the pod, for it will adhere and not dissolve.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	Then place another pod next to the first one, and do not cease to do this with pods one after another according to the quantity of the whole wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	Then return that and close the wound; and let those pods remain in the intestine until it is healed; and do not hurt the patient at all.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible that the intestine be bound with thin bile which is made from the intestine of an animal tied to it, since it is more flexible; and you take the end of those intestines and it is somewhat stripped, and then bind the end of it with bile, wrapped around, and insert that bile into needles and sew up the intestine with it, and return that disruption.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this manner of sewing with pods is not anything other than according to way of trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the wound is large and wide, especially if it is in one of the small intestines, for then it is only a subtlety and not its complete healing.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the healing of ulcer and fistula.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that any wound and abscess when it becomes infected and is old, and an ulcer forms, and is not consolidated and discharges pus all the time and is not healed, then in whatever part of the body it may be, universally it is named fistula and we call it a ulcer.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And fistula according to truth is nodulated, hard, white with which there is no pain and to which is cavity as it is cavity of bone; and for that reason we name that some knob, i.e. nodule.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is in some people moist, which discharges pus; and strongly the moisture is discharged in some hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this humidity is increased, and it is little, and it is thick, and it is subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already mentioned in the division that when I discuss wounds, that any ulcer which is not healed or is not naked flesh, it is due to one of nine causes: the first is due to lack of blood in the body; the second is due to malice of it; or because between it and its lips there is hard flesh preventing growth of flesh; or because it is caused by excessive leges; or because that ulcer within itself is infected, and the matter which comes from it is of poor quality; or because the medicine is unsuitable in its healing; or when corruption happens in the region, and it is pestilential; or due to property of the region, thus it happens at Saragossa, where digestion of illnesses is difficult, and that healing of apostema is delayed by nature; or because there is bone in it, or bones.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	And I have shown all those causes, and their signs and the healing of them with medicines in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And thus it is necessary that I make you know the healing of fistula which is made by way of operation with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	Know that fistula happens in all the parts of the body; for from them there are fistulas which come to large veins and arteries, or nerves, or the brain, or the intestine, or the bladder, or any of the ribs, or some of the joints of the hand, or foot; and they give proximity to the main member and its likes.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And thus those of these fistulas which are according to this manner are of illnesses of difficult healing, and do not receive healing, and occupation with it is labor and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if there is any fistula whose depth does not come to these spots which I have said, and you wait for it and believe in its healing, and wish to come to knowledge of it, then take a test of lead or iron, and if the fistula goes according to skill, then examine it with him.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is tortuous, then investigate it with a test of subtle lead, for lead by the lightness of its body is drawn away and bent from the tortuosity.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	If the fistula has horrifying words, it is not possible for you to say anything about it with a tent.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Therefore, christen the horrifying orifices for them, as the moisture by which you cleanse that one comes from the others and flows from them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then inquire closely, according to whatever manner it is possible for you to know whether here you have bones or nerves, and whether the fistula's cavity is distant or near, or whether it is a fistula whose horrifying words are above all at the top of your strength, with your tenting, and the invention of the pain comes from your compression with your hand over the place, and of the significants and of the accidental causes.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all those causes with true knowledge, then go to the cure according to confidence: and it is that you consider if the fistula appears nearby or in a salty place, distant from a joint, or of nerves, or of an artery, or of a vein, or of one of the places which you know.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then dry the fistula according to what is said before of its description, and stop up that which is in that filtration and of rotten flesh, and that which is born in the orifice of the flesh, or of thorns and of resemblance, and cure that within which is to be healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is of great depth and is according to rectitude, then you must understand that you immerse it in the preon as much as you can, and then cleanse it of all its rotten flesh; and then administer hot waters wrapped in sharp medicines, and insert them into the cavity of the fistula which you have understood with iron.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this several times until the sharp medicine corrodes all that is rotten in the cavity of the fistula.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with ointments which beget healthy flesh within that is to be healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by that, then you cauterize it according to what we have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bones and you have certified that, then you inquire and dry it according to what we have recommended, unless you prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or main member as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is revealed to you and there is corruption and blackness in it, then cut that away until all the corruption is stopped; and then cure that with that which will cause flesh to grow within that is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and the flesh grows as it did before, then know that you have not attained to the total eradication of the corruption; and then uncover it again and do the reason for it and the purification of it with your greatest strength, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so if it is healed, well then; but if not, then know that the corruption is in the distant depth of the body, which has not been conquered, and then to you it is not possible to do anything with that.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the rotten bone is small or it is possible for you to pull it out, then you pull it out with subtle forceps which are suitable for that.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then you do the extraction of all of them with your greatest strength and of none do you leave any cause.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if you are opposed by any cause of the moistures and in them there is no fear nor error, then cut away those limbs or flesh if they are here, and release the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to stop the bones of your hour, then pause over the wound that it may suppurate, and leave that within so that it is in the environment of those bones of flesh and of limbs, and keep the wound from being consolidated, and the section which you have cut in your operation be constricted.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Habbants, if you fear, pause over it a cloth dipped in oil, or a cloth dipped in Egyptian ointment, or in one of the green ointments, for when those limbs suppurate and the bones are separated from their cavity, and from that attraction is driven away.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone like the bone of the leg or the thigh or like that, and that which is rotten is only its face, then cut away that only behind so that the blackness and corruption are stopped, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if that which is rotten is a great part and the corruption has already conquered the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and to cut all into that place where the corruption has come, and then cure that within so that it is consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I have recommended to you that one who lies on his back so that he pauses as an example and helper over your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man about 30 years of age, to whom happened pain in his head, and from the parts within maugula is upon the matter within the body within which the matter has come to the head, and it is matter of pustule with great pustule, and there was not to him extrinsic cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the time was extended by that through the error of the doctors until the pustule was opened, and many matters arose from it, and his cure was then paused within so that the leg was fistulated, and he had in him many orifices which all discharged pus and the moistures of the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then he was cured by many doctors for about two years, and there was not in those wisdom but in the art within which I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw his leg and the matters which ran from him those orifices through great pain; and indeed that man's body was totally emaciated and his color was yellow.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted the tent into one of those orifices and it came to the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I probed all the orifices and found that they came from all parts of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I cut and entered into one of those orifices within which I discovered a part of the bone, and found it rotten, and indeed it was earthy and rotten and black; and a part of the leg was already rotten where it had penetrated within the membrane.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I stopped that which to me was revealed and prepared of the uncovered bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I found that it was not in the bone but that corruption which I had cut and stopped, and indeed I had already removed it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I paused the restoration of the wound with consolidaing medicine for a long time, and it was not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I iterated and discovered upon the bone secondarily over the first discovery, and found continued corruption with the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I stopped that which to me appeared from that corruption, and indeed I had performed the cure of it and restoration, and it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I discovered upon him another time and did not cease to enter the bone little by little particularly and to probe the restoration of it, and it was not restored until I had cut around a palm from it, and that extracted with its marrow, and then I restored it with medicines, and it was lightly consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it was not necessary to iterate in the operation of it and section of it except for the disposition of its fever and because of the scantiness of his toleration and fear of death, for he suffered at all times from excess of evacuation and syncope ill.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And so he is healed completely, and there is nothing in place of his hard flesh; and the disposition of him in his body is made good and the virtue of him returned; and he is conversed in his dispositions and does not make contrary to him in walking nor harm in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bones prominent in the place of the body are drawn out, then it is necessary that you succeed according to this manner: and it is that you take a ligament and strengthen that at the extremity of that prominent bone, and command someone to extend that upon him; and pause that ligament of wool thicker than the first ligament; and apply that upon the flesh which is below the bone, and extend the extremity of it so as to draw the flesh to the parts below, and you uncover the flesh over the place which you wish to sew up so that the needle does not harm the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And pause the wood or table below the bone decently, for when you do that it is not prohibited that the needle does not cut the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And it is necessary that the sewing be over the corrupted place little by little, for if there is corruption in the cavity of the bone and does not appear in its appearance to sensation, and force to sew another way.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and not prominent, before it is one party continued with the other, and the corruption is in all of its place or in part of it, then you uncover the flesh from all parts entirely; and then pause wood below, and then sew that of the first party where the corruption is so that the sewing of the other party be continued.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And the sewing be according to the place of the corruption small, according as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut that corrupted joint, and sew the bone where it is continued from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in it reason but skill.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or the foot, it is very difficult; however it is necessary that you inquire into the corruption in what manner it appears to you, and that you open that, and mend that according to every disposition which is possible to you, and with every skill be rectified to you, when not doing to you contrary coming or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the cutters and the saws to cut these bones are very according to the situation of the bones, and the preparation of those, and the thickness of those, and the subtlety and the greatness and the smallness of those, and the hardness and their rarity; so that you prepare for every kind of operation convenient instrument for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that that operation signifies to you on the kind of instrument of which you were in need; when with you is great study and long and knowledge of the ways of this art, and witness of ways of illnesses, for then you already had through your methods that which is convenient to it of the instruments to every illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you see to you forming at the end of this chapter the number of the instruments which you will pause with simples with which you will proceed to your prohibition which you will experiment upon the others.

E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not convenient except that with that are rubbed the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or is the great mouth ample.

E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and of acute extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly let all the causes which we have said of razors and of incisioners and of saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incisioning extremities and of the sewing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be affected by either an intrinsic or extrinsic cause, or after you have treated that corruption with cure of those medicines and the cure does not confer, or when the corruption is in the member which does not bear any cause, then let you incise that member within where lies the corruption so that the patient may escape from it by death or by evil which is greater defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that to which it happens is that the member is made black within as though fire had burned it, or it becomes black within as though that burning had entered that member and had entered all the body; and therefore cut at it with incision of that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if the cause of the corruption is percussion from certain venomous causes such as from sea scorpion or from viper or from adder or from similar.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the percussion is in the extremity of the finger, then let you incise the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it has accessed the hand, then let you incise that of the joint of the fire-stick and do not give space to the corruption so that it enter into the fire-stick of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you have it, then let you incise the arm within in the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another the corruption and it turns around the head, then in that is the death of the patient; and administer other cause in cure is quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly make of the foot when corruption instead of the finger of the foot, then let you incise that within one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes in the sole of the foot, then let you incise all the foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it enters into the tooth, then let you incise the gum within at the joint of the tooth.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	If corruption has already occurred in the brain, then there is no remedy but to release the patient and let him die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of cutting off a limb or of tying it is that you should tighten the ligament in the area where it is desired to be cut, and tighten another ligament above the site; and extend one ligament towards the lower parts, and extend the other over it; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments so that it may be completely exposed, and then let it be cut or tied.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And make sure that a cloth is placed under all parts so that it does not touch the wound, and that the patient receives an appropriate bandage and poultice.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if blood flows from the wound, then cauterize the site with cautery, or apply some powders which will constrict the flow of blood; and return to your treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the infected limb with a bandage in a suitable way, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And then he told you that once a man had a dark spot on his foot, and you and he agreed to treat it with a burn which resembled the charred remains of a fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this corruption first occurred in his toe, then spread to the rest of his foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared remedies himself as the treatment progressed and his foot became more swollen with pain and the burn, so he cut off the foot at the joint, and it healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	A long time ago that man had that corruptive disease in his left toe.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it came to me and I was forced to remove that surplus with the medicine which I applied to his hand, so that the cleansing of his body would occur; but the surplus was not reduced and started to go to the other toe as it began in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to cut off his hand, but I did not want to do this hoping for the reduction of that surplus, and fearing the cutting off of his hand which would result in death, because the strength of the patient was great.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And when he lost hope in me, he returned to his land and found that this man prepared and cut off his entire hand, and it healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not written this narrative except to be an aid for those who suffer from this disease, and that it be a sign by which it is understood and according to which it occurs.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the treatment of ulcers and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an ulcer occurs in the fleshy parts and the space of the ulcer is prolonged so that it makes a collection of pus, and then it is broken and perforated, and the pus is discharged from it, and the site becomes hollow as if it were a vessel, and the cord which is above it is like a veil with a thin cloth, and there has been no subsequent corruption, and it does not impress upon the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called an ulcer, and is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if the space is prolonged so that corruption occurs in some member, then it is called a fistula and not an ulcer.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment of it is that you cut off the whole cord as it is turned over and most especially when it is thinned out and made with a cloth, and bandages which do not adhere to the site by its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you expect the cord to adhere and that corruption has not been accomplished by subsequent consequence, and there is passage in the cord of pus, then you should treat it with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And consider the ulcer, and if it is great and the arm which you see gives off a fetid odor, then enema that with an Egyptian medicine which is of oil and sharp wine and linseed received in parts equalized in a vessel, and let them be heated over fire until the medicine becomes thick as honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take from it that which is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and enema with it the ulcer, and tighten the orifice of it, and let the medicine remain in it for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then remove that with discretion; and do this for so many days until the ulcer is cleansed and the pain abated.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And in some cases it is enema with water of ashes when that medicine is not available to you; and take the ashes of wood and put on it water, and then boil that and strain it, and enema that with it until you are certain that the ulcer has been relieved.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient has no tolerance for the Egyptian medicine or water of ashes, then enema that with water and honey mixed with linseed pounded into powder, and enema that with wine and honey mixed because of the nature of honey is to cleanse and wash, and wine makes the ulcer adhere especially when in the wine there is surplus of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this several times and you are certain that the ulcer has abated, then enema that with that which makes the flesh grow on it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And take the ointment of daphnoides and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine, or enema that with some other medicines and unguents which I have written about in the treatise on unguents.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the ulcer is narrow so that the cannula of the enema cannot be received, then you should enlarge it with a small iron little by little, and put on it cotton wrapped in Egyptian ointment or in balsamic ointment until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And likewise if the orifice is wide, then you should close it with a stitch and put on it quantity in which between the enema is added.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice from which the arm hangs is elevated to the parts above, then dry that in the pus base of it so that the arm does not run into it below because when the arm is constricted in the depth of the ulcer the flesh engendered in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the ulcer in the surrounding of the bone of pus base according as you wish, then be assured that you prepare the member with preparation so that from it the arm runs longer according as it appears to you and that there is no cause for the arm in it.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines which are placed over the ulcer conveniently according to what you wish, they are extended on cloth of linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth be of such great quantity as makes the communication of all the ulcer, and then cut with the forceps in the right of the orifice of the ulcer a wound more ample than the orifice of the ulcer; and then extend over another cloth of linen of the unguents lion’s according to the quantity of the wound, and put on it that for position distant from the orifice of the ulcer so that it is drawn away the running of the arm from it and do not touch the cloth great unless after some days once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is on the orifice of the ulcer, which abates in every hour because it draws what is constricted in it of the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know whether what runs from it of the arm is pus or little, or is digested, or is undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And you consider the site of that ulcer if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if there is pus in it.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that has exuded through the orifices of the sinus already adhered, or with its own adhesion, then on the third day, loosen it with a poultice, and when you loosen the plague, then change the dressing with another one and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus there exudes a subtle humor, then do not despair of its adhesion, because its healing is proper, for there are some men in whom the generation of flesh occurs in their plagues, and of those in whom the contrary occurs as well.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if a bad indigestion has exited from the sinus for several days, then know that the sinus is not adhered; and if its adhesion is delayed and its cause prolonged, then you should reduce the quantity of medicines, and if the medicines are wet in their substance and in their efficacy, they are dried as well as a defying poultice when there is excess addition of zegi.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the most posterior one that is treated is to take a defying poultice and dissolve it in rose oil, and over it apply honey wine equal in its substance, and then comfort him with that and use it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And already make a demonstration in that action when there is no humor, by taking a defying poultice and honey when it is cut into that it becomes thickened, and use it; or take myrrh and aloe and mix them together, and grind everything and pulverize it over the honey as it is over the fire, and then line it over the fabric and press that over the sinus; and line with the honey which you have cut into so that it becomes thickened, and pulverize it over the fabric and press that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes they are administered with it a long aristology and roots of the heavenly lily (and that is the heavenly lily) and farina of err and centaurea, and use those simples or adjust them, grind them and sift them and pulverize them over the honey I have recommended; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged and not healed by this cure, then know that the corruption is in its preon, and already make inquiry into the bones or other hard members or into the ligaments; then you should cure it with a fistular cure as has been said above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the cure of panaricus and nail abrasion and digit addition incision and section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panaricus is an apostema that occurs under the nail of the toe of the hand or foot, and seldom under the other toes, and as it is prolonged and its cure is less valued, it becomes apostematized from cauterization, or it becomes corrupted, and it exudes humor within that corrodes the roots of the nail, and it corrupts all of that, and its corruption very much pervades the bone within which has a fetid odor, and its extremity becomes lumpy, and its color becomes dusky.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore when you have that from which we have spoken in the division and do not comfort your cure, then know that you must cut away with iron all of the excess that is rotted from the nail and then cauterize the wound accordingly, for the cautery is beneficial in this.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail are pushing inwards on the flesh between the parts of the nails, and it begins to sting and irritate that, then know that you should pause a fine needle beneath the angle of the nail which is pricking the flesh, and dislodge that upwards and insert that flesh with ease, and apply upon that which rises from the flesh medicaments that burn and corrode within so that everything is cleaned; and then cure it with ointments once it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption is already within the bone, then know that you must cut out the bone and extract it, for it will not be healed as long as the rotten bone remains in it.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corruption and rot extend into the finger, then you should insert it into one of the knuckles according to which is preselected by its memory, and then cure that once it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if there is percussion or abrasion upon the nail and subsequently violent pain in that, then know that you must at the beginning bleed the patient, and then dry the nail with a pointed spatula with a transversal section above it, and beware that the section does not pervade into the flesh that is beneath the nail, for you will cause violent pain to the patient, and its cause will be the generation of excess flesh in the place; and then cure that place with what relieves the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But a finger that is born in the hands of some men is very seldom all flesh, and rarely within it bones, or rarely within it nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of it are born from the root of the joint, or its generation is from some knuckles of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is born in some knuckles of the finger does not become sick, and that which is born from the joints is very much sickened.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those which are born fleshy, its section is easier, and you should insert that behind its roots with a broad spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But of that which is born from the root of the joint, its cure is difficult; and therefore beware of its incision.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But in that which is born in a finger from the knuckles, know that you must at the beginning insert the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and then cut with one of those convenient saws for that, and then cure it once it is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But consolidation which occurs in the fingers between their motions many times or from generation of the person who has it, or from consolidation of plague, or from burn of fire, or from similar things, therefore know that you should dry that consolidation so that the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between their bands of them soaks in rose oil so that they are not consolidated too easily, and separate those or place between them a thin sheet of lead within which is consolidated according to what it should be.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation occurs in some fingers with the palm, then you should dry that consolidation according to how it is prepared and convenient for the form of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incision of veins, these are varicose.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose are veins, and they are grossly rolled vessels full of melancholy humors which flow in the motions of the members of the body, and their greatest occurrence is in the legs, and mostly in the legs of travelers and laborers and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore know that you should administer purgation of the body from black cholera several times with strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But their cure by iron is according to two methods: one is that it be cut and that the black blood be drawn out, and the other method is that the vein be raised up and all of it drawn out.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	Its incision is according to this method: at the beginning moisten the leg with warm water so that the gross blood is dissolved which is feculent of the leg, and then press the leg from above on the part pus uppermost of the thigh into the part below the groin with a bandage, and then dry the vein in one place, or two, or three with broad incision, and then raise up the black blood with the sole of the hand from the part below the leg within upwards so that of the blood is expelled the quantity which you desire and which the strength of the patient will bear.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then lead them away, and command that they abstain from foods engendering black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are full and this is noticed in the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the elevation of them is according to this manner: you raise the leg of the patient if in it there are veins, and then put him into a bath and rub his leg with warm water until it reddens and the veins are dilated; or he be exercised by vigorous exercise, if a bath is not available, so that the limb is heated.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the tendon in the direction of the vein either along its length or behind him below the pain, or at the very bottom of him near the ankle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the tendon with nails and gouge out the vein in every part where it appears to the sense, and one must observe the appearance of it that turns black at times.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And so when you have evacuated and from the tendon you see it white like a cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then put that under the leg so that it is elevated and is supported by the tendon, and suspend it with a silk thread from an iron hook.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section just above that section by three fingers, and gouge out the tendon from the part above the vein where it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then elevate that and insert it into the posterior section below the ankle, and then extract it from the second section above it, and then extract it from the section above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract it from the section that is most superior or highest of all the sections, so that all is evacuated; and then insert it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if he does not obey you and does not allow himself to be extracted and elevated, then insert a strong bent needle into him and ligature it, or put under him the edge of your hand and move your hand around to every part where there is an abundance.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And beware that it is not incised; for if it is cut then it has become difficult for you to elevate the part and it has come upon the patient through that injury.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all of it has been evacuated out, then place on the site of the wound wool soaked in wine and rose oil, and cure it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is contracted having tortuosity in which there is an envelope of its parts, and it is not according to rectitude as we have said, then you must split that at every part of its tortuosity and the sites of its envelope, and then suspend it with nails so that you elevate all of it.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And beware that you do not incision the vein and that you do not harm it, for it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and exercise your prudence in that.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incision with which the vein is dried:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of a nail hook:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not made of iron nor is it of acute extremity so that it does not harm the vein; and it has great flexibility of the thread, for if it were subtle it would cut the vein through its subtlety; there is in it superfluous thickness just as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of extraction of the leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is engendered in the legs in hot lands just like Al-Ateji in the land of the Arabs and in hot and arid lands of little tenderness, and in which there is no herb or grass.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is engendered strongly in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its gestation is from putrefaction that comes beneath the tendon just as venomous snakes and worms and insects and worms engendered between the tendon and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And sign of the occurrence of its coming is that vein which inflames violently in the leg, and then the site becomes blistered; and then the vein begins to emerge from the site of that blister as if cut from a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then when you see the end of it coming out, you must wrap around it a piece of lead weighing two drachmas, and hang it suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as you see it go forth for some cause to its parts, wrap that around it in lead and suspend it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the vein is prolonged, then you insert a part of it and wrap around the remainder; and do not incision that from cut so that it is drawn out, for if you incision it it is contracted and goes into the flesh and causes an abscess and swelling in the site and bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Because it must be drawn out slowly and extracted little by little so that it is evacuated from its end and does not draw back into the body for any cause.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein it emerges in some men who are in its length of five or ten palms, and I have seen one emerge twenty-palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised at the hour of its treatment then insert your finger into the hole in him and bore it with a long hole through his body so that everything that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction of the site for several days with medicines; and then cure that by the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has wounds, and especially when it appears at the junction of the leg or in the leg, and comes to him wounds of orifices, and is emerged from each orifice.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And so cure that as we have said in the division and with what is above it.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section of worms generated under the skin, and it is called bovinine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is named in some land due to bovine disease because it sometimes attacks oxen and is a worm few of which is born between the tendon and flesh, and goes throughout all the body pushing and pulling and is revealed to the sense due to its movement from member to member so that it tears the tendon and goes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is by putrefaction of some humor just as occurs to worms and snakes and roundworms and tapeworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is dreaded for its malice, for when it goes through the body and is elevated to the head, then it strongly pierces him and goes inside and destroys the brain, and this while it moves many times.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And so when you want to cure it and extract it, then it is not done if there is no movement of him and appearance to the sense, and then you must tighten what is above it and what is below it with ligature and strong constriction, and then cut what is above it and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is sunken in the flesh and not open then you must pause cautery with fire over the site where it remains, and the main cause that is dreaded is putrefaction of him by which he corrupts the site as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see him pervening to the head near the brain then tighten around the forehead with a strong constriction and cut what is above it, and extract that; and let the patient use cleansing of his body with medicines evacuating putrid bad humors, and beware of foods engendering putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section for the disease of children.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is named in our land nafir, and it is pain that comes in some members, and then is transferred from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you know well and see that according as you relate.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I discovered her arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the arm, and since it was broken for an hour, I saw that inflammation go like worms pushing towards this, but more lightly than being afraid, as if it were living silver when it flows from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then he went into the pain of that place and pierced in the muscle, and there he stayed for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it ran through the rest of the body until it reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And I was astonished that it was winding through all her body, as I saw; and I was very amazed at its change and the speed from member to member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had seen this before in my own eyes, although I have seen pains which cause the pain to be transferred from limb to limb.
