And if the phlebotomist makes a mistake in the first attempt, then repeat the phlebotomy in another vein, for the site is salty; and do not worry about maliciousness in him, but rather be careful of nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do with the other foot, identically.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And of the sciatic vein, the site as we have said is due below the ankle of the wild party.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the youth of phlebotomy to him is to pain in the hip when it is from blood cauterization.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of phlebotomy to him is that the patient enters a bath, and hastens and stretches his neck from the side of the broad space above the ankle above four fingers in one long slender bandage, for it does not appear except through it.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore when it appears, then you phlebotomize that according to each device that is possible to you and according to the cross, and it is better; or insert that through incision or cut that through section, for the site of him is salty.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in most men very hidden; and if you find that, and it does not appear to the sense of touch at all, then phlebotomize some ram of him, and it is he who appears on the back of the foot opposite the little finger and the ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of nerves, and let run of blood the quantity that you wish.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then loosen the tightness and place a bandage over the site of phlebotomy tightly and strengthen the site, for quickly it is healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of wind-making and of the qualities of use of those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Vents are of horns, or of ram, or of skin.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And wind-making is done according to two methods: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is wind-making without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this wind-making which is without scarification is according to two methods, for it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the vents which are administered with scarification and extraction of blood are xii sites of the body, of which one in which vents are paused is alnocrati, and it is the hinder part of the head; and the middle location of him from two parts of the neck together; and vents of the chin below the mandible further down from the mouth; and vents of two spatulas; and vents of alo-hoster, and it is upon the end of the breastbone; and vents of two little holes, and they are of two arms; and vents of two ankles; and vents of two buttocks.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And wind-making does not extract blood except from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and for that it does not have the virtue through them as cauterization through phlebotomy; nor believe that wind-making be done with fire or without fire upon any sickness made by repletion within which the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity prompts to wind-making for sickness or for continued, administer that in every hour at the beginning of the month and in its end, and in the middle location of it and in whatever time it is.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The which cause is because of men it is in those in whom there is blood multiplied within that indigestion from extraction of him through wind-making and thickening in his head and heat; and of those it is who have repletion and heat in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and of those who have prolapse in the face and front and darkness and fainting in their eyes; and of those whose risings are multiplied; and of those whose sleep is increased, and of those who see blood in sleep heat and age and ulcers and other causes to them similarly.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when you see any cause of those, and particularly if it is in the third or middle of the month, then command wind-making be done after that two or three hours have passed of the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And youth of wind-making at the nape is that when it confers weight in the head and to that which is bent down into the eyes; but beware that that be proper evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this wind-making is at the site of phlebotomy at the head.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not lawful to use that which is of sharp complexation, or in whom there is catarrh, for it gives to him great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for that do not use that by the elderly, and in the heads of which there are cool sicknesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to him upon whom that is continually done there is made oblivion; and for that do not command the wind-maker that he pause his hand a little with the ventouse at the parts below, fearing the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But wind-making of alkehel is at the site of phlebotomy of the vein fusca and of the basilica: and for that it confers asthma, and to the constriction of ale and to the splitting of ale-making instrument, and to coughing, and to repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	But beware that the ventouse of alkehel be wrapped a little, for if it is paused below it breeds weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And wind-making of alhagdahan confers accidental pains in the head and to ophthalmia, and hemorrhoidal bleeding, and prepuce, and to pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is at the site of phlebotomy of the basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	But command the wind-maker that he not press his hand with scarification so that it does not insert the artery and ignite blood flow.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And wind-making below the chin confers halitosis in the mouth, and corruption of the gums, and similarly to them of the sicknesses that are in the mouth, and they stand in the site of phlebotomy of aliheric which is in the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But wind-making that is done upon the two spatulas confers caps, which is made by repletion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And wind-making of the two parts within the little holes of the fingers confers youth of phlebotomy of three veins, namely of the basilica, fusca and cephalica, for it draws blood from all those veins more slender than are in the flesh, and those veins more slender from the other veins more gross within which comes attraction to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the wind-maker that he does not overdo in scarification, for the site is stripped of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a wind-making with which is wound around the hip and confers to hemorrhoids of the anus and to ulcers further below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	But command the wind-maker that it be a large wind-making, and that it is of ram, for the site indigests of strong section; and strongly he has had wound wind-makings slender and let him be scarified by scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But wind-makings of the thighs are made smaller by diminished manifestation, for they draw blood from all the body, and confer to ancient pains in the hips and in the uterus, and in the bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and confer to bothors and ademils; and they stand at the site of phlebotomy of two sophenas, and armpits, and of two ankles.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	Nevertheless, they weaken the whole body and cause fainting in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And from the armpits to the groin is near to the groin to the armpits on both sides.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the wounds is that you stop the wound at the beginning bleeding and sucking by a tempered suction, and do not prolong the position of the wounds, but rather pause them lightly, and let those remain tightly, and let the humors come to the place by accident equally.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to iterate this and continue until you see the place already reddened and inflated, and that the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scrape and iterate the suction little by little, and then consider in the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because that man who is of tender flesh of few parts, beware that you scrape him once and not more, so that the place is not ulcers.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the wound-maker to enlarge the incision and take a little, and temper the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if in the blood there is thickness, then beware that you scrape twice, because in the first incision the way of subtlety to the blood and its moisture is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second one, to the examination acquired from the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very foul, then let the third incision be done so that the dregs are achieved.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a little, it is enough for us with one incision.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a lot of blood, we scarify with a shallow incision; and if we know that the blood is thick, then beware that we scarify with a deep incision.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which is the depth of the vein just so much.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the one of whom the vein is thick, tough, dark and its parts are tight, let the places of the wounds be anointed gently, widely, liberally; if it is in the summer season, like so with oil of aloe or violet oil, or almond oil, or camphor oil; and if it is in the winter season, then oil of nard, or lily oil, or camomile oil, or blood, and to those similar.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, rough, then let the oil be of myrrh, or oil of balsam, or oil of aloe, or oil of anise, and to their similar.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the wound-maker is of ample parts of tender flesh, then beware that there be no oil, and beware that to them the places of wounds of their woundings are washed with water or with warm water of salt, or with water of camphor, or with water of aloes, or with similar.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And that one of whom the blood is of great humidity, wash his wounds with sharp wine, or with water of myrtle and sumach, and similar to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And of that one of whom the superfluities are thick, wash his wounds with old wine, or with water of sage, which is marjoram, or of fennel, or of camomile, and similar to those.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And beware that the wound is guarded against bathing; have beware that it be administered close to bathing for one hour or for two, and beware that he sleeps close to the wound.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is necessary in order to be bled after being bled before bleeding?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Beware that you consider at the beginning: if the wound-maker or one who is to be bled is choleric and his blood hot and inflammation, then beware that he take causes of frigidity, thus with milky acetic milk thistles, and endivia in sharp wine and leeks, and sesamum, and juice, and similar.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And let him eat foods thus with pulses, and meats of birds served, and seasoned foods with acids, and to them similar.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And of that one of whom the complexion is rough, let him take in drinking essarabon of mallow, or essarabon of sesame seeds, and sumach, and very odorous wine between Viel and Noel; and that he be commanded to use little in drinking and eating, and let his foods be pulses and cabbage, and pigeons, and small birds and colombat.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And beware that in the day of bleeding and phlebotomy his drink is greater than his food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And beware that he be given in drinking at certain hours to some men theriaca alpharac, or medicines of musk, so it is muscade, or alcelita before bleeding or phlebotomy or afterwards, so that the principal members are comforted and that the blood is subtilized; and let no one take those scalds.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the wounds that are after scarification let them be wounds that are paused on the liver, and on the navel and the podagra, and on the umbilical area, and on the areas of the joints, and the pixida of the broad one, because these members do not suffer scarification on themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired by those but attraction of blood of member, thus with pause wound on the breast in flux of blood from the nose; and use that to dissolve thick roughness of member, thus with pause over belly and navel; for that rarifies the member and scrapes it and eases the pain as it resolves the thickness.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And then it is paused over the eyelids when they happen in their opening or poultice, because by force of attraction strong their eye is opened and eradicates the poultice from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is paused over the liver and navel if there is need of wound in those inclosed.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these wounds are administered seen with suction just so; and some wounds are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some wounds are administered full of tepid water in the illnesses of the navel.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is why the wound is filled and pus great, so it is water tail alone or water in which herbs are boiled to that which is convenient.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of wound administered with fire: let the aperture of two fingers, according to that which we have formed; and the quantity of the cup be the measure of a palm; and be in its breadth, in the place that it is in the circuit, the measure of him, the burn be small according to the quantity that enters into him an awl.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of oil of rose or citron, of thick margins, lion, galls and thorns so that it does not lead the member let its position over him.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And be at the middle of him a crossbar of oils or of iron, on which is paused candle with fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this wound be great major of that which we have recommended; and the small less of that according to the illnesses and the condition of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the wounds of children and exhausted others be different from the wounds of youths and great bodied ones.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of pausing that wound with fire over the member is that it extends the arm with fire of wood decently before a little candle of wax, and pause that over the middle of the crossbar in the middle place of the wound, so that the fire be kindled around the bottom of the member so that the body of him not be burnt.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then be paused over the member of him, and the finger be over that trauc which we have said, between that when we hold the wounds and do not touch the finger and that the vapor rises over that trauc, then the wound melts so fast dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then light the candle according to its nature, and repeat that if you need to.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	However, in cupping therapy which is administered for the illness of pleurisy, with water, there is no cross vein or wound, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the affected part only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the shape of it: And this cupping vessel, the larger it is, the better, so that it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeching is not administered on small parts of the body unless it is possible to place cupping vessels there due to their size, as well as on the tongue, gums, and similar areas; or on bare flesh, such as the fingers, nose, and similar areas.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And you shall use those leeches that are found in clean water ponds.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And they shall be left in the water for one day and night, until they become hungry, and nothing else shall happen to them in that time; and the body shall be evacuated at the beginning through phlebotomy and cupping; and then the affected parts of the patient shall be rubbed until they turn red; and then they shall be placed on him.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are filled, and it is done.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suction the affected area with cupping vessels, it is better to do so afterwards in order to draw out the humor.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the affected area with pleasant wine and then with warm water; and it shall be rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the flow of blood is prolonged due to the action of the leeches, and it sweats, then you shall dip a cloth in warm water and place it over the affected area so that the sweating is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is profuse, then you shall sprinkle powdered vitriol, or gallnuts and similar astringent substances over the affected area so that the bleeding stops; or place cooked broad beans over the wound and leave them there until the beans adhere to the wound, thus stopping the bleeding.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And indeed, if it is necessary to repeat the use of leeches, when possible change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from being suspended, then rub the affected area with fresh blood or insert a needle into the affected areas so that it draws out blood; and then they shall be placed over those areas, for when they feel some blood they will immediately adhere.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall off, sprinkle a little powdered aloe, or salt, or ashes over them, and they will soon do so.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the third part: on restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is many times necessary in the art of medicine; and it is about the restoration of fractures and accidental dislocations of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, you will understand that this chapter is mocked by foolish doctors and the vulgar, and those who have not read the works of the Ancients nor understood a letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, the manner of science in our land is hidden; and I have not been obliged to do so at any time up until now; and I have not used what I learned, but rather through long study of the works of the Ancients and understanding their wisdom, from which I extracted their knowledge.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And indeed, I have added to it through experimentation and study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter everything that my knowledge and experience have taught me, and I have shortened it for you as much as possible so that it does not tire you out; and I have simplified it at the end of its explanation; and shown it at the end of its demonstration; and formed many forms of instruments which are administered in it, as has been done through the addition of explanations, just as I did in two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from the existence of fractures of bones, from which their premise is necessary, before we begin to address the healing of broken and diverse members.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	And therefore, we shall begin this chapter with summaries of speech; and the chapters at the understanding of which in the beginning are perhaps the artisans, and they stand on the truth of those who speak them; so may you and those who understand or learn this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when there is a fracture or dislocation or twist or hernia, then you shall first apply phlebotomy or poultice to it, or any other treatment if no counterindication exists, as well as in debility of strength, or if it happens to an infant, or elderly person, or during hot weather or excessive rubbing.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And indeed, let them eat a meal of fresh herbs and poultry and crab, and avoid fatty meats and anything that fills the veins with blood, so as to guard against the occurrence of pus in the affected member; and if you do not fear effusion of matter into the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their usual diet.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And indeed, when the broken bone begins to be restored, then let the patient eat nourishing foods that are light and easy to digest, such as meals made from wheat cooked with water, rice, and peas, and fish, and fresh meat, and gross foods, and anything similar which is easy to digest; and with this diet, the healing of fractures occurs more easily and gently.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And indeed, you shall know that broken bones when they are in elderly or weakened men, it is not possible for them to be continued and consolidated according to their nature due to the drying of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature at all times due to the drying of those members; and indeed they are continued and consolidated according to their nature at the end of their fragility, just as the bones of young children are.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But indeed nature adjusts and connects the broken bone of any part, similar to glue which adheres and binds together, until it comes to an end in strength and firmness, just as fire does at the beginning, so that no counterindication exists for it from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to restrict the patient's diet, and let them eat foods which are heavy and viscous and fatty, just as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many varieties of fractures according to the variety of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And indeed you shall know that the species of fractures are diverse according to the variety of members, for a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and a fracture of the bone of the foot is different from a fracture of the bone of the toe; and likewise all other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And indeed I have remembered all species of fractures, explained in their own distinct chapters from others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many varieties of fractures within themselves.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fractures of bones are diverse in their joints; for an arched fracture is different from one which occurs in the stars; and some times there are fractures according to the length of the bone: and indeed they are fractures of the satagium and astragali and adjacent parts, just as it happens when writing is prepared, and a fracture is fissure small.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And indeed each species has its own pain or discomfort in its healing according to the distinctness of its location.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	This indicates a fracture in the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this it is known that there is a fracture of the bone; namely, when you feel its crookedness and appearance with your hand and when you press on it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And if there is no crookedness evident in the spot, nor any discomfort when you touch it with your hand and move it, and the patient does not feel much pain, then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	Sometimes it is possible that there is crookedness or a slight crack, but you should not worry about this if when you press on it with your hand and move it, the patient does not feel much pain; instead, place over it some medicines of which you have a reminder that is appropriate for the spot; and then it will be tight because of a subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that if the spot is bent and not split in two or otherwise affected so that it does not become gangrenous throughout its entire surface, then you should begin to correct it with cauterization after an hour has passed; and if anything happens to it, then a cautery should be used.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if gangrene does occur, then let it remain for several days until the gangrene subsides; and then heal it in whatever manner you can that is suitable and effective.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration and piercing of it is more dangerous than the bone in which gangrene occurs.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And strengthen it according to what will be remembered about it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone gangrene occurs, then extension of the broken member from two parts is necessary: if it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two cords or one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And hold the member in its natural position while the broken parts are extended, then you will have to return them by artifice and in whatever manner you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And beware according to your strength that you do not cause pain or injury to the patient through your operation; and according to your ability apply one bone to another in their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And so that in that hour you may beneficially touch it with your hand, and if you see any different cause, correct it and heal it according to the amount of your skill.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid violent extension and compression, for there are foolish doctors who often cause gangrene cauterization through their operation or cause contraction in the member as we have seen it many times because of their operation.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then attach it, and equaling and decent operation and constriction of that member, and rest and tranquillity; admonish the patient about this and make him avoid hurting himself in the hour of his vigils and sleeping, and observe his revolution and agitation, and attend to his excretion, and attend to all his movements with all your skill; and beware that the position of the member be a position by which he is secured from pain, for its cause is when there is disposition towards that position in the member's pain or injury; then change it to another disposition by which he does not feel pain; and beware of this so that the position of it is straight and healed, so that no crookedness occurs in the member when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of constriction of the broken member is that which you see; for you should know that broken members are different in their smallness and in their greatness and in the shape of them.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small like the arm and the finger and the wrist and their like, then let the wrapping be of very soft cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are large like the thigh or the leg, then let the wrapping be hard and laced, for the laced binding connects the large member and strengthens it all around with even constriction, so that no ulcer occurs in it.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, and then your operation of equaling, pause binding convenient to that, over the spot of that fracture with three or four wrappings according to how much the member deserves; and strengthen your hand a little with the binding.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then go to that at the highest part of the spot of the fracture, and strengthen your hand so that you do not loosen the constriction with which you have strengthened the spot of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then lengthen it with wrapping of the spot of the fracture a little, and loosen the constriction a little by little, while you take from it one great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap that other part over the broken spot with wrapping, and then go to the wrappings at the lowest part of the fracture; and let your operation be in the constriction of the wrapping and in loosening it according as we have said above in the first wrapping.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the wrappings of hemp or cloth with which the crookedness of the fracture is evened out, if there is crookedness in it; and if not, then do not pause for any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause another bandage over those wrappings decently done as much, if in the spot there is no inflammation or gangrene cauterization, and then pause over it that which soothes the gangrene and stops the inflammation; and let it remain for several days; and then strengthen over it the splints.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the splints be of the thickness of a split cane that is well formed, or be of wood, or of reed, and let the width of each splint be according to this form and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, let the splint that is paused over that fracture be thicker and a little longer than the other splints, and the length of the splint according to how long it has been over the member in greatness and smallness; and then strengthen over the splints with another bandage according to your first constriction; and then lace over it with decent wire according as we have said about constriction, and let your constriction be less, and how much longer is the fracture, so much less is the constriction.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And let the threads be middling in thickness and fineness, and be of soft wire; and if the threads are thick, as we have seen by the operation of some foolish doctors who tie their threads with strings of linen, and it is a great error when the constriction is not equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And very thin threads are not convenient, for you will not achieve by constriction with them what you want, and let there not be the space of a finger between splint and splint.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is hurt by the ends of the splints, then pause under those hemp or wool that does not harm it.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some times the fracture is in a vein, and occurs rupture in the sinew, and we come to remember it in that in the head according to its singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not every broken member is tightened by splints on the first day; and the cause of it is when the member is large, then you should not pause over it splints unless after several days or a week or more according to your certainty of the occurrence of gangrene cauterization.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the bandages with which the Ancients used to heal, which were paused over fracture and dislocation and twist.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Way of bandage as a bath for healing of fracture, convenient to many complexities and especially to women and children, for it is that over which there does not go heat nor friction: and take from powdered bran, and it is the meal of the wheat that remains after the movement of the mill in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And cook it as it is, but strain the liquid through a cloth and let it thicken; then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of healing fractures and dislocations: take assafetida, ladanum, acacia, enula, and myrrh, which is ground from wild pomegranates, all in equal amounts of one drachma; also five drachmas each of myrrh and aloe; twenty drachmas of aloes, all to be mixed together with honey or egg white if the patient's complexion is cold; and then use this plaster, for it has a good composition and quickly restores broken bones, and confers health to many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of plaster which confers health to fractures and dislocations: take myrrh and met with white poplar in equal amounts of one drachma each, also five drachmas each of myrrh and aloe, six drachmas of acacia, and twenty drachmas of armenian bole.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Let all be ground in a mortar with a pestle, then strained and thickened with wine or white wine, and let it be applied.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of a plaster for joints and bones separated from their sockets, and for pain in them, and also for cracks and fractures: let fine wool be saturated with sweet wine and oil, and let it be applied to the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Perhaps in this plaster there is no virtue of restoration, nor of pustules or boils, but it does indeed expel pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of a plaster which restores broken bones: take leaves of the fig tree and leaves of wild poppies; grind them all and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of a plaster which aids in the restoration of broken bones and when you want resolution of the residue of pustules: take ground myrrh, chamomile and violet flowers, and flour of linseed, of all these an equal part .i. Let all be strained and thickened with wine, if the member is not damaged.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is damaged, then cook it in water scented with coriander or water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of a very strong plaster in resolution, when pustules occur with the restoration of a member: take ground myrrh and licorice root, and caraway seeds, and melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all these in equal parts i drachms; let all be strained and thickened with water or wine, all according to the quality of the member and its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hypocras does not dry on its own, it should be applied to the broken member for its restoration unless a poultice is made of wax and oil and nothing else; and let it be between thickness and thinness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But it is seen that they are applied to the broken member for its restoration and the causes in which there is dryness with little heat are similarly as myrrh, onions and their likenesses of those causes which we have recounted.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of a plaster which is beneficial for injury and pain: take ground mace, and nuts, and human hair or bird feathers, and myrrh, and salt, all in equal parts; let them be strained and thickened, and let a plaster be made from it.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the amount according to the quality which covers the ligature and let it be bound, is that you consider if there is no pain nor swelling nor the bone broken not drawn from its place, then do not loosen for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there occurs at the location violent pain or swelling or inflammation, then you cut it or loosen it in that hour and stop the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a ligature of linen and sponge the sea-lion which is moistened, and let that be soaked in tepid water, and with that wash the location until that swelling and the pain are stopped; and then let the member rest for an hour; and then apply to it fine wool which is saturated with sweet wine and oil or rose oil, and let it lie upon it for a night unless you are certain of pustules cauterized, and that the member's inflammation is abated and its pain relieved.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that subtle binding and small plaster and do not tighten it by your first constriction, and let it be subtle with that until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if the pustules and heat and pain and inflammation and all the accidents are now abated entirely, and you have stopped using the plaster and binding, then do so as you did at the beginning equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no cause occurs in the member of those which we have mentioned, then do not loosen it but let it be bound for three or four days or five or six. and some times let it be bound for 20 days according to what you appear by the loosening of the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and the flesh comes together over that.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then tighten the binding but not as in your first constriction entirely, and let there be less thickness of the bandage of the patient's body, according to what precedes its memory.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the location of the fracture dry and exhausted but not closed, then know that nourishment is prohibited from coming to it; and therefore soak it with tepid water for three days in total, and loosen the binding a little, and through this operation the member will receive nourishment, and it will be healed little by little.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But that which the restorer of the broken member does another inspection when it is not healed at the beginning according to how it was, and is healed according to crookedness, is error according to their operation and great fear, and if they were right in their free limbs and bent upon them.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do that, because it is more reasonable that it does not happen.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter according to: Of fracture when it occurs in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The kinds of fractures are many, and their shapes are diverse, and the causes are distinct; for some fractures are done by blow with a club, and the blow strikes all the bone within the head, and that is under the skull, as it would be in the trunk, and through this this kind of fracture is named asial; or the blow goes into any part of the bone, and goes into the flesh of it and does not go inside to its end; and this kind of fracture is named absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the amount of these two fractures is great or small, and the cause of it is blow with club or stone, and to their likenesses.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating so that it approaches the membrane which is under the bone; or it is in the membrane of the bone, and the amount of these two fractures is great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And in fracture it is split in the bone, in the thinness of the hair small, and because of that this kind of fracture is named capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is fracture that is done or by blow with stone or by blow of club, and which makes inside any lamina of the bone to its splits fingers, and it is done in the location bent so that it happens to the nails when there occurs to them blow and it is split of their splits fingers.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this happens mostly in bodies with wet humors, as well as in children's heads.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And after all these kinds of fractures have been set, they are bound like separated stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And then he will have a memory of everything in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And know all these kinds of fractures through detection on them and through inquiry with feelers and the appearance of rotten flesh that is upon them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And hairline fracture is known by what is uncovered on the bone, and cleaned, and felt with feelers, for the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fractures, consider first the accidents of the patient, and then if you see through the accidents that indicate by obvious sign over fear, as in vomiting of cholera, extension, loss of reason, loss of speech, fainting, acute fever, discharge from orifices, and redness of these, and their likeness to them in the major dispositions, it is not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see non-current accidents you expect health, then you begin his treatment.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason is that if the sick person came to you in the beginning as he was sick and it is in the days of winter, then consider that you study in the appearance of the bone before the day fourteen according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then consider that you cut off the bone before the seventh day, having that which is below the bone be rotted by the pannicle, and that the accidents we have counted occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the cerebrum, and is in small pieces and crushed, then consider that you cut off the crushed and ground-up piece, according to what I will count for you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you raise the head of the sick person and uncover over the bone according to your custom and manner possible according to the figure of the plague, and that he is lighter on the sick person.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you to do the detection of the bone, blood flow or cauterized pus, then you oppose it with what is appropriate, and it is that you apply the place with cloths infused in wine and rose oil, and let the plague rest until the aposteme is calmed, and be secure from the blood flow; and then begin in the circulation of the bone and in its ablation.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And it is according to one of two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the one manner is that you cut into the bone with a narrow scalpel, and this is its form: And then administer another scalpel this, a little wider than that; and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer the scalpel wider than the second.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And consider that it must be due to you a number of different scalpels, of which some are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than others and are in the last of acuity of their extremities, and they are of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in percussion on the scalpel so that it does not disturb the head and lead that one.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then consider that you bore into its circulation before you administer the scalpels with the trepans, which are named non-deepening trepans.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not named thus but because those do not stop the end of the bone from it that is under it, for so that to the trepan there is a rounded extremity or margin on that which is below the head of it pointed like margin or small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passing the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take of these trepans great number of which each one suits the thickness of each bone, while it is present to you in all heads of the brain, the extremity of which is acute, the quantity in length and brevity is according to the quantity of thickness of this head.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of trepans: The quality of boring into the circulation of the broken bone is that you pause the trepan over the bone and turn it with your fingers while you know that the bone has been penetrated; and then replace the trepan at another location, and pause what is between all trauma the quantity of the thickness of the groove or environment that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then insert with scalpels what is between each break of the bone, and do that more subtly that you can upon its end in thinness, as we have said, while you irradiate the bone or by your hand or by any other cause by any tools which you will have apparelled for that, as tweezers and subtle forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And consider that you keep with all precaution that the scalpel does not touch any cause of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And when you have circulated the bone and saw it separated from the brain if it is continued with it, and you have extracted that, consider that you raise and gnaw that in the asperity of it of what is in the bone by other instrument similar to scalpel, but however consider that it is more thin and more subtle than the other scalpels.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if a little piece of the small bones and fragments are raised, then take that with ease by what is due to you of the instruments; and then cure the plague with poultices and ointments which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manner of operation is lighter, farther from fear, which says Gualia and is praised by great praise; and this is its speech: it is necessary for you in the beginning that you begin to uncover the piece of the bone of the place in which is the fracture most violent and most manifest, while you have uncovered that piece and you have paused below it the extremity of this scalpel sluggish and gentle of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And that the lenticular piece is lion and does not insert any cause, and the acute piece is of it in two sides forward in length, as you see; let the lenticular piece be adjusted to the brain with the membrane of it incident acute into the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then percute upon the scalpel of one piece with a small mallet while you insert all the bone with ease as it is turned, and you are secure of the membrane that does not occur in it accident which you fear in any manner, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then if it raised any cause annexed to the bone of the membrane in some places of bone, insert that of it with the extremity of the scalpel that lenticular, and loosen that of it with ease, for it is loosened from it its harm and its fear.
