Therefore when the malasse is returned, then pause over it plaster which we have recommended, and let it be left and bound for 5 days; and then let it be released and let his hand be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of it is hindered and any difficulty occurs in it, then moisten that with warm water and with friction several times, while it is elevated.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter .XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the cure for dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes the fingers are dislocated completely apart.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any of those fingers is dislocated from the back of the palm or from its belly, then stretch the finger and push the dislocation of it with your fingers, while it returns to its place.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then hold the tip of the finger, and suspend that from the part to which it is dislocated, and leave that for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that and extend that until straight while it is greased in that its day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when evening comes, loosen that according to that narration, and do not stop releasing that in the day and exercising with movement, and loosen that at night; and do that for several days until it is tight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And make it seem like that if it is dislocated from the belly of the hand, and loosen that to that part and do with that the first operation, while it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do with that when it is dislocated at the other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter .XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure for dislocation of the spine of the shoulder.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it occurs to any of the spine of the shoulder or neck complete dislocation and only the spines remain in their places, then there is no cure in that, because death approaches the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And sign of that is that the excretion of the patient is outside without his will, and he can't retain that; and sometimes some members of him are weakened or two arms or two legs, or one of those; or it is weakened one spine from its place, because sometimes it is weakened and sometimes the removal of those is to four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then that is already weakened at the back parts and is named dislocation.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the cure of it is that you consider if the dislocation occurs from puerperal fever, because then in that there is no cure nor of that there is healing of all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in that which comes from settlement or from percussion or similarly to those, the Ancients already stated their ways of cure with prolix speech, of which the most returns with profit; but I and abbreviated that which is not excused by the amount of it, because of its proximity to my intention expose, I have expounded and formed that with diverse instrument from that by which I showed that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in dislocation that occurs from the front part in the feet, there is no use nor healing of that; and similarly in that which is made to two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And those are not healed except that which occurs in the shoulder properly by that I recommend.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient is extended over his face on the ground, and is extended under him instrument moist so that he isn't stretched the feet of him.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight staff is placed, fixed in the ground at the end of the wall around the head of him, and another staff in air under his feet at the other extremity of the wall.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister holds the staff, and it is not stopped in a pit; and another minister holds the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap a bandage around the patient's head and let the servants pull firmly on it; and extend the end of the bandage to the staff, which is placed behind the patient's head, and tie that around him; and then tighten the other bandage around his hips and the servants' hands, and tie those around his legs; and then adjust all the bandages and tie them to the other staff, which is placed by his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then each servant should extend the bandage to the end of the staff, and the two staffs and the bandages in their places where they are tied should not be loosen, but rather tightened as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor should place his palms on the patient's spine and press firmly down as he returns, or he may also lie on a table with his feet elevated above him.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if he does not return in this way, then take a table whose length and breadth is about three yards, and cut into the wall near where we said the patient was lying, a space big enough for the end of the table to fit through.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	Then place half of the table on the patient's spine, and have the doctor stand on the other end, and press firmly down as the spine is straightened and forced back into its proper place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open the turn which is wound around his hand; and then place on the ground in front of the patient's head, two staffs whose length is about one yard, and in front of his head, another two staffs, so that there is a palm' s distance between each staff; and there should be a cut in each staff through which a rope can pass, and each staff should be firmly secured to the ground so that it does not loosen.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there should also be a vertical staff in which the turn is wound around, and it should be secured between the two cuts in the two staffs.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at its end there is a cut through which the staff passes, the length of which is one palm long where it is wound around; and the other two staffs are similar to this one.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then tighten the bandages that you have wrapped around the patient' s feet and the ones around his thighs with the turn that is tied to his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then secure each turn and have a servant twist it with their hand while the doctor bends the spine as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And when the spine has been straightened and the wound covered, then apply a plaster made of honey and wax; and then place a splint made of wood whose length is three digits or more, depending on the size of the swelling, and its breadth should be as much as it takes to cover the area of the gelbositat and the upper part of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then tie it with a bandage as we have said, and let the patient take nourishing foods until he recovers.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is any swelling left in the area after the healing process is complete, then apply medicines that soften and smooth it out through the application of the table for an extended period of time as we have recommended; and a lamina of lead should also be applied to that area.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes it happens that there is swelling in the back of the spine's joints due to dislocation; and this bone, which causes great pain, does not respond well to this medicine, so be careful when using it.
Capitol .xxxi.	E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not become dislocated except by complete dislocation, and it does not happen to them what happens to other joints of small displacement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated in four ways, for it is dislocated at the inner parts, or at the outer parts, or at the front parts, or at the back parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most often it is dislocated at the inner parts, and seldom at the front or back parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of its dislocation at the inner parts is that when you move the patient's healthy leg with the sick one, it is longer and the heel is higher than the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend their foot because the joint of the hip is dislocated, and there is a swelling in front of the hip joint due to cauterization, so that the head of the hip has already come here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of dislocation at the outer parts is that its accidents are contrary to those mentioned above.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of dislocation at the front parts is that when they try to extend their leg, it does not bend at all without pain, and if they force themselves to walk, they cannot put any weight on the front part of the foot; and their urine is retained and there is swelling in front of the hip joint.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of dislocation at the back parts is that they cannot extend their leg or bend it forward due to pain; and their leg is shorter than the other one, and there is swelling in front of the hip joint.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, having already been treated with the proper reduction, then it does not need treatment at all; so there should be no cauterization performed on it.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But if the dislocation is recent and one of the four types of dislocation, then you may proceed to return the joint by extending it at its inner and outer parts, and also to the right and left side, for it will quickly return on its own without needing any further treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this way, then you should prepare a strong servant and extend the patient's leg from its lowest part, or by his hands, or by a bandage tied around the leg above the heel; and another servant should hold the patient's hand up high so that they can press down on the heel; and another servant should tighten a pointed cautery against the root of the hip joint.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And its extension is either from the inner part to the outer part, or from the back part to the front part.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And they are all extended in one motion while the patient is lifted up by their body from the ground and hangs down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common to all four types.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns as we have said, then all is well; but if not, then it is necessary to use any of the following remedies for its treatment.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of dislocation, when it is located in the joints within, the patient should be laid on their side; then pause the ligaments over the root of the hip at that spot between the head of the hip and where the psoas muscle is located below; and extend the ligament upwards from the part of the iliac bone to the highest part of the furcula.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	Then another assistant should strongly pull the patient's arms, press on the large part of the hip joint and extend outwards with great force, for this will return to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is the quickest cure through which this member is reduced compared to other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if you are excused and do not obey this species of cure completely, then the two feet of the patient should be bound together with a strong ligature, lightly, around both heels and both toes.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each of its pairs should be the quantity of four fingers, and the ill leg should be extended more than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	Then let the ill leg be suspended over the head of the bed, and let it be in the middle; and its length from the ground should be the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	Then command a strong young man to push down on the head of the hip joint, and let another young man suspend the ill leg, while the other young man, pushing with strength, pulls up on the hip, for the joint will return to its place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the reduction of dislocation, when it is located on the outside, let the patient lie on his back as we have recommended for those who have stiffness; and tighten the ligament over the ill leg properly and over its foot.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	Then two beams should be placed, one under the patient's feet and another under his head; and beams that are adjusted to the middle of the beam should be placed on which dampened cloths are wrapped, so that the ill leg is not damaged by the beam being between the patient's thighs, for when the extension is made downwards, it should not be pulled.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	Then each assistant should extend to his part, and the doctor with his hand will guide the reduction according to the article.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Thus, if you obey this reversal, it will be very good for you; and if not, pause on that diligently and also as we have said in stiffness by that equalization.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But let the ill leg lie on its side quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in front, then let the ill leg be extended lightly, and it is according to this narrative on the psoas muscle; and the doctor pauses the palm of his right hand over the iliac bone of the ill leg, and then tightens that with his other hand, and with that tightening, he extends that to the parts below to the part of the toe.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the back, then let the ill leg not be extended to the parts below and it is elevated above the ground; but let it be paused on a hard cause, just as it would be if the ankle of the ill leg were dislocated outwards, according to what we have said about its setting upon two axes; and it lies on its side and the ligaments are extended, according to what we have said, not much.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And let compression be administered with a board over the place where the joint is dislocated.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Thus, when the reduction is done according to what you have — and the sign of the reduction of the leg is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend both legs from the ill leg, and when you see those equalizations and the ill leg extending its leg and expanding without excuse, then know that the member according to which it has returned — and then you adjust two thighs and pause plaster and tighten with bandage so that the joint is not damaged in either part; and let the ill leg rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then release the ligament and the plaster, and compare one leg to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those equalizations in appearance, then know that the dislocation is already closed, and then let the ill leg go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then return and plaster that, and tighten that according to your first tightening, and leave it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then release that and make that delay in walking on each leg for several days, while it is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure of dislocation of the toe.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The toe is dislocated according to three manners, for it is dislocated on the outside, and within, and at the bottom most towards the back; and in front it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you command the ill leg to apply its leg against the hip; then know that the toe is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its manners is that you make the ill leg straight, in such a way that it already extends its leg, if it can over that; adhere the toe to the hip, and pause the foot between your feet; then let someone else adhere the toe with their palms, and pull those between your fingers onto the toe with strength, and another assistant extend the foot while the toe returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of its reduction is that its leg adheres to the hip with non-laborious elevation.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster that and make the leg adhere to the hip, and then tie those together with a bandage for three or four days, and then release those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the ill leg for walking for several days while it is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction of the leg to you is excused, then administer strong extension with ligaments of which in the cure of the hip preceding narrative.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle some times is bruised by minor removal, and some times it is dislocated according to compliment, and its dislocation is made either within or outside.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you see the ankle swollen proceeding from the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure of its removal is of easy reduction, and it is extended with facility with hands and is equalized while it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the cure of it when it is dislocated according to compliment, let the ill leg be straightened and a strong and valiant minister of the part behind the two of that in the middle place of it.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then you with your right hand the foot of the highest part, and with your left hand the part lowest of the foot in the place of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Then pull the foot to you with your right hand, and then with the left twice, and then extend with the left; and push the foot of the leg with the right because the leg has its work.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that two times according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then push the foot of the leg to the leg on the third attempt, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Thus if it returns on one or two according to this manner, and you see the foot equalized, it is good; and if not, then repeat the operation upon it, for it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from reducing it with what we have recommended, then let the patient lie on his back on the ground, and spread a cloth on the ground beneath him, and place a pillow between his thighs, and you have already wrapped a cloth around him so that he does not catch cold.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then the minister should have his thighs, and another minister should extend the foot with his hands or with a bandage that lies on the neck of the foot; and each minister should extend according to the direction of their side, and the pillow should be placed between the patient's thighs so that the body is not pulled towards the lower parts due to its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	Then the doctor should dislocate it with his hands, and another minister should hold the healthy thigh at the bottom, for the dislocation returns with ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation returns and you are shown the health of its reduction, then place an ointment and tighten it with strong bandages, and bind the foot to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And beware of the nerves that are behind on the instep, so that the bandage over them is not violent and does not hurt him strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then leave it for two or three days; and if the bandage softens, tighten it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then loosen it on the third day or fourth, and forbid the patient from walking for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to walk within that space, it is not safe that the dislocation is not dissolved and corrupted, and then that which does not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if an ulcerous wound happens to him, then you should administer in the healing of it that which we preceded in our narration, in another place of cure and brooding, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure of dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	Let him who is dislocated be stretched with a little extension without difficulty; and that which is not difficult, before it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some bones of the instep of the foot, then let him sit with his foot raised above the ground or on a table, and let him remain thus as if he were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	Then you stand on your feet, and place your foot over what is beneath the joints, and then press that with your foot with strength until it returns, and see that it is already stretched and there is no prominence in the location.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place below the belly of his foot a table that takes up the whole foot, which has two ends, and then tighten it with decent and firm pressure for three days; and then loosen it and let him rest from walking for several days, until he is healed and assured of recovery.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the kinds of dislocation that are made with a blow or with a fracture, or with any other impingement.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When one of those happens, and you persevere in the cure of it and in the restoration of him, many times death ensues.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that, one should not presume on the cure of him, but let him who is wise in the art, with long experience, compassionate and pity, be tardy, not hasty or presumptuous; and let him use in the beginning of medicines that yield ulcerous wounds only so much, and let the patient rely on divine judgement, unless he to whom you hope for salvation from destruction, with relief from sickness, and in which some hope appears.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And so endeavor to reduce it at the beginning of the cause, before he incurs an ulcerous wound.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And so if the member returns according to our will, then administer medicine which yields ulcerous wounds and heals the plague with that which is appropriate for him of the dry ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is with a fracture and the bones are separated, then you persevere in their setting, and do what we have said in the simple sicknesses of that which precedes them in those locations.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your ability that which is within the ways of fear, according to what my prediction precedes you; for that is better for you towards your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and healthier to your true body than those in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus end the words of Albucasim perfectly, from which God be blessed.
Amen.	Amen.
